3Zt0tYyNVvwIFrlzr9JRSA.text: One of my favorite Greek places to eat at. This place is always clean and the food is always good.

WLTeg0sNVNPmTRGMAVtX7g.text: I must start this review by saying, I LOVE Greek food. The flavors, the fresh vegetables, and feta cheese is a god send. With that said, I've been to my fair share of Greek restaurants in the states and The Great Greek is hands down the best place I have ever been to. If you love garlic, raise your hands. If you love Greek food, raise your hands. You have reached my favorite Greek Food Location in Las Vegas. Not only do they offer great food, they sell good deserts too.

AMGTTiD3Df6cwVV04xYlTg.text: This place is just as AWESOME as it's sister store on Blue Diamond.  I discovered the one on Blue Diamond about a month ago and fell in love with it.  I was told about the original location in Henderson and business took me to that side of town and I just had to try it.  It was amazingly good, just like the other one.  The Great Greek Gyro is just flat out great.  I have had both the beef/lamb and the chicken one.  I can't pick a favorite.  Do yourself a favor and get the Feta Fries.  Everything is so fresh and tasty.  The staff is super helpful and get the food out to you pretty quickly.  My only complaint is that there are not more of these around Las Vegas.

ExwpQ4G2plAmBehRCQKp8Q.text: Food was decent. The steak skewer was the best. The chicken could use more flavor. We ordered fries but received the plate with rice instead. The rice was good.  The plate comes with a delicious greek salad. The girls servicing were a little rude. It was very busy but we sat down rather quick. You make a line, order and then you ate able to select a table and sit down.  The lemon chicken soup was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lemon chicken soup

HwWGjv3iPxuPzURZVOIu4A.text: This was our 1st visit. Service was great, the young man that took our order saw right away I had 3 children,  said he would hold having our food prepared until we got a table inside.  The food was excellent, it was my oldest's 1st gyro, and he said it was amazing.. Service was great , pleasant, friendly and accommodating.  My 4 yr old are all his chicken fingers, which if you know him says a mouthful.  Thank you for the delicious food and awesome service. We will definitely be back. Got some baklava,  can't wait to eat it.

qg2wbvSDwvKmDPbpZfr2Uw.text: My least fave falafel in the valley.  They do not carry tahini...and the falafels were mushy. Which is still bettter than the raw ones Ive gotten at another falafel joint in town, so 3 stars for decent edible food.

feteL5pAON_G-9HNioauNw.text: Came here for dinner the other night and I was glad to finally check this place out. Inside isn't huge, but it was clean and there was a girl constantly cleaning tables and the floor under them. The woman at the counter who took our order was nice and gave us a number to put on the table. It took about 15 minutes for the food to come out, but the place was busy and they claimed to be making everything fresh so I didn't mind.  I ordered a side "Classic Greek Salad" priced at $4.95 with house made Greek vinaigrette. The salad had crisp greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, kalamata olives (has pits...be careful!) and feta cheese. The salad tasted fresh and the dressing was delicious. The salad also came with some grilled pita bread that I put some cucumber and tomato on and folded it up to grub on. Yum! Hubby got a burger (said the patty seemed frozen) and made it a combo with "Feta Fries" for us to share. The fries were excellent! Especially dipped in some of their tzaziki. I will be back to try a gyro and baklava.   They also have tables outside if eating inside isn't your thing or you can call ahead and place your order to-go. Ask about their family meal deals, they have a couple to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Baklava&#34; @ The Great Greek - 4/28/14
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Grilled Steak Souvlaki&#34; @ The Great Greek - 4/28/14
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Greek Salad Wrap&#34; @ The Great Greek - 2/13/14

RvqF3Zl_E2fRGzcYKf7eIg.text: Very disappointed. We came to dine and usually my wife or me will get a table while the other orders our meal. Well the cashier male who is always congenial with us told my husband in front of everyone to hold off sitting at a table. We were embarrassed and left the establishment. Long story short we thought seating was first come first serve and feel this treatment was unnecessary. We ended up eating at Mimi's.

t6UrPF60Tl1osqwfFFanjQ.text: I don't come to this side of town often, but as soon as I decided to meet my friend with the big fat Greek appetite I knew we would be coming here.  Great Greek is certainly where it's at for gyros!   A hearty portion of wonderfully flavored beef/lamb meat is sliced thick and surrounded by a warm fluffy pita (the kind you'd feel comfortable resting your head upon if you weren't ready to devour it) in this truly special gyro!  I'm not sure if I would bestow it with the title of best gyro in the valley, but it is certainly one of the best. ... add some Feta Fries and a Greek Salad if you brought your beast appetite... or just want to save some for later because both are great options here. I tried some of my friends Avgolemono Soup...another great addition!  I haven't had the opportunity to try any of their other dishes, but I would order whatever I was in the mood for with confidence based on the quality of what I had.

9P3mvjaT8GZhKNZ2PTT5Lw.text: I live right down the street and this place is a favorite. It's usually pretty busy but hey that's a good thing right!?!? Super fresh, healthy, and delicious. The service has always been on point as well as the food.

9jE_8_n35UrHgDw1Gdp3UQ.text: My only complaint is that this place is so fantastic that it's really busy all the time. The only thing better is the other location on Blue Dimond! I could eat here every day.

5Un0-kxvimRYjbNkgyy_eQ.text: Wow! Just a surprise stop instead of the deli across the street, what a surprise! Amazing food. Amazing service. Jack stoped to talk to us while we were eating and was so nice. First time eating Greek food in a long time. And it was so fresh and amazing. I had the small Greek salad with chicken and steak skewer and melitzanosalata aka pureed roasted eggplant with pita. My friend had the great Greek rice bowl with steak and lamb skewer. They ask how you want your steak cooked as well. We were greeted by Brittney, she was awesome. Explained the whole menu and recommended the rice bowl. The place was super busy and she saved the open table for me so I didn't have to leave my purse there. The whole experience was great. This will be a new regular spot.

lbQNtOD2KyLDe3CyLV3vXA.text: EXCELLENT and DELICIOUS FOOD, a FRIENDLY and INVITING STAFF, and IMMACULATE RESTROOMS!     This Greek bistro in Henderson is a winner on so many levels.  I'm fairly picky about Greek food and haven't been too satisfied with the choices of Greek-themed restaurants in Las Vegas, but The Great Greek in Henderson has won me over.  I ordered the Gyro plate, which was stuffed with ample meat and other fresh ingredients.  One another occasion I also tried the Avgolemono Soup (a traditional Greek chicken and lemon soup).  When I first tried this soup some 25 years ago, I fell in love with it.  I could tell that The Great Greek prepares this soup daily, as you can see and taste the fresh dill, roasted chicken and pasta in every spoonful.  I also highly recommend the Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves with rice and fresh herbs).  Squeeze a little fresh lemon on them for a tasty treat.  The Spanakopita is also delicious, made with spinach and feta cheese inside a light and flaky puff pastry.  What I like most about The Great Greek is the staff.  They remembered me each time I visited, they knew what I wanted and prepared my meals quickly, and they engaged in a friendly banter that made me feel right at home.    The Great Greek's menu is designed for customers to return again and again to try new dishes.  I've been there three times in one week!    Finally, dining at The Great Greek won't break your bank, unlike many other Greek-themed restaurants.  Just about every meal can be purchased for under $10.  Now THAT'S a bargain!    OPA!

jTtYuEZJgEhcWvAIJ0tJPw.text: Stopped in to the Great Greek today since one will be opening in my area in May.  I was very impressed.  A lot of menu choices and reasonable prices.  Large portions and great food.  The gyro was the best I've had in awhile.  Better than the other local food truck and sit down bar options.   I'll be happy when they open near me!

F6yr4kgTMnOBBpCht1NjLA.text: This place is a great find. Counter service always seems busy, but it's worth standing in line. Hummus was tasty, but the "Great Greek" gyro stole the show. If you're not watching your waistline, get the Feta Fries as your side.

OUmICKj30qLADCWw0uIrMA.text: I love this place! My classmate and I come here for lunch at least once a week. We go so much they know our names and I'm not at all ashamed.   The service is great - always friendly, always prompt. One time Jeck (Jack? I don't know how to spell his name) saw us shivering at the outside tables and came out to get us when a table inside opened up. There has never once been a mistake with our orders.   I always get the beef-lamb gyro combo with a side salad for ~$10. Since I always save the side salad for my dinner, that's a pretty good deal! The gyro is tender and flavorful, the tzatziki is just the right consistency, and the pita is always soft and delicious.   I rarely give 5-star reviews, but this is one my favorite Henderson haunts and they deserve it!

tzLeleMEyT7PzA-gWAkugA.text: Since our original visit, we have eaten here 6 or 7 times (Just about every time we are in Vegas). Every meal has been outstanding, the place is immaculate and the service has been excellent. If you like Greek food, this is definitely a must-try when you are in Vegas!

4clOcHRNmn3IrZ0TYjXxFA.text: Finally popped this bookmark....how does the GYRO fare??  The Great Greek Gyro ($7.50): Beef-Lamb, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, and Tzaziki. This was very good, with LARGE thick slices of meat, and heavy...had to be a POUND of goodies! Yum!  I think the meat here is a little thicker than the others I've tried, and it was seasoned well with just the right amount of salt.  But when I compare it to my current favorite, this one didn't really blow my mind.  Now I have to try the other spot again to refresh my memory, to see if it really WAS that good.  Check it out if you are in the area!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. The Great Greek Gyro ($7.50): Beef-Lamb, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, and Tzaziki. Very good with large portions!

ZzXAFNrKxMJXseJoSgXcOg.text: When locals are greeted by name, families arrive for a low-key Friday night dinner together you know you come upon a restaurant worth consideration. With  days of three digit heat behind us the patio is definitely welcoming. Carry out is popular here and in the course of an hour to see half a dozen people walk out with three bags full is not uncommon.i've eaten Gryos here before and quite honestly that's why I came tonight. Later, as my mouth filled with the delicious flavors of lemon potatoes, roast leg of lamb and Greek salad I was all that more happy that I'm a flexible person when it comes to such decisions. Suffice it to say I'm one happy Colaneri camper tonight. Normally, I would also order baklava but the Greek cookies looks so fresh I had to give them ago. Now I'm waiting for a pot of coffee to brew and I'll enjoy my second cookie. Definitely worth your time and dining dollars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. I came on hungry for gyro but how can I resist leg of lamb special???
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Attention to aesthetic detail in spite of location in strip mall!

jfR5EbOhauSYO2stKZGC1A.text: Good food. The only thing I ordered was the great greek gyro. It was huge. I am so glad I decided to forgo a combo or getting a side and I don't think I could have handled anymore than the gyro itself. The flavor was great! I'd return if I was in the Vegas area again.

lkNgNLcIljNVRsyZbkKRXw.text: We were greeted by the owners immediately upon arrival. We ordered the bowls one with falafel and the other with shrimp. I saw a tray of spanakopita coming out of the oven and had to try it. Sitting on the patio they brought out the appetizer.  Fantastic!  The bowls came before we could finish. Fresh, Beautiful, Delicious food. The shrimp were large and grilled to perfection.  The wifes falafel was cooked perfectly.  The taziki was amazing the julienned cucumbers made it pop! Too bad this is 2000 miles from home.  We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

gSp-rhV44IcIuS8B5rDQTg.text: I don't write great reviews but I'm in love with this place. The service is awesome and the food is better. Favorite place to have lunch during my lunch breaks.

W0EuBNjhbXaA7AJrAW_vvQ.text: Was in for Labor Day weekend w/ the family, visiting ... family.  Asked My sister n Law, "Wha's goo' 'round hurr" ( terrible texan accent, maybe it's 'cuz I'm not from there)  She had no clue and I had to whip out the phone.  I was looking for something healthy, quick and nearby and .. BAM!  This lil' place had good reviews and I hadn't had a gyro in 4-5 days!  Got there 5 min. after they opened, there was a chick taking pics of a plate ... prob. for some paper/mag. and the guy looked greek, the lady that took my order looked greek, so I was pretty confident that this place was going to be good.  11:15, this place was busy, no seats available and when I saw the Gyros come out, I knew why.  Everything was fresh, except for the pickled stuff, obviously ,,,and I think they make their own Tzatziki sauce since I've haven't had cucumbers in long strips.  Delish!  I highly recommend this place because they were not stingy on the proteins and that's always what most places skimp on.  took away a star since my order was lost in the shuffle due to a guy being late and didn't know who ordered first.  There is also outdoor seating but who the hell wants to sit out in 110 degree shade.... yeesh.

wbNf8NdyihFTWu0MSMIldg.text: EXCELLENT IN EVERY WAY!!! We've tried several different dishes, every one was great. Service is friendly and fast. You can't miss here!!!

RhMktyQnxUIO6SJlyH_AEg.text: I've been to this restaurant probably 4 times so far and I'm surprised I haven't given a 5-star review yet! Quite possibly the best chicken gyro I've ever had and their salad is right there with it (those are the only 2 things I've had).  One thing I did notice though is that the time it takes for food to come out can be long. I know that it bothered me a couple times primarily bc I had a to-go order and needed to get back to class, but the food took over 30 minutes to come out. However, the flavor and quality of the food made up for it. Just know that this isn't a stop and go kind of restaurant.  Prices are fair for what you're getting. Middle eastern/greek food is always going to be on the more pricier side, but then again its the quality that matters so the prices here are decent.  Service is great and everyone is nice over there! I'll be back for more!

xdGJ3mh9RJEsgKvOQEgJ3Q.text: I didn't have much time. Just popped in to get a gyro. It was incredibly good.  one of the best I've ever tasted!

oylRNIy4HuoSUrH2ssKSrQ.text: What can I say...  food from The Great Greek is made with love and that's the not so secret ingredient!!!  First off, this place takes care!!!  The food that they serve is definitely a reflection of the quality of produce and products used!  This is an important element that differentiates their food from surrounding competitors, and it's a difference you can really taste.  Moreover, the food here is extremely affordable and definitely worth the price mark, add ons and all!  I'm always open to new food but when trying a new Greek restaurant I always take it back to basics.  Hummus and tzatzki with pita bread are ALWAYS a must for me so I was delighted with the fact that I had found a place who knew what they were doing.  The texture and seasoning was on point and I love the accompanying pita bread!!  It was thin, soft, warm and didn't overpower any of the dipping sauces.  In other words, it was not overly thick and hard.    Do try a little combo of the different appetizers such as the hummus, tzatzki, dolmades, pita bread!!  It's a wonderful selection of the most popular Greek comforts.  Those little dolmades were fresh, flavorful and stuffed just right.  Please... Do yourself a favor and get an order of the Great Greek feta fries. Damn!! This dish really won me over cause i'm a sucker for fries and this little twist was such a nice palate pleaser! Amazing!!  Can't stop thinking about them!  Gyros are tricky ordering for me because others i've tried either had too much of something, or too little.  The Great Greek's gyro was huge and each ingredient it was stuffed with did not outshine another; it was the perfect amount of everything.  Presentation is simple and to the point but also exhibits a hidden wow factor that I like.    The restaurant itself is extremely inviting and exudes a very "my house is your house" type of feeling!  Being that it is a family affair, there are no inconsistencies when it comes to service!!!  This is what I love about gems like these... It doesn't have that "chain restaurant" feeling... and that brings me back to the not so secret ingredient: love, love, love!!!  You can tell that you matter as soon as you step in cause you're always greeted with a smile and a welcoming hello!  Anyway... Go ahead and give The Great Greek a try for yourself.  You'll see just what I'm talking about once you take your first bite.  I highly recommend! *love*

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. I always leave with a full tummy!

eCuFA669_ovaklgMAt6exA.text: Best Greek Food I've ever had!!! Probably the nicest staff I've ever seen too!!  I drive all the way from the north side of Vegas to eat here!

5Cy5vA5BvfMbcAKVFe9Uow.text: Fresh, delicious and healthy. The enthusiasm of the staff is delightful to observe. This place is light, cheerful and the food will not disappoint. It's that great combination that you get from truly good Greek food: light, delicious foods but filling and full of flavor. The coolest part of my experience here came from the attitude of the staff. They were just so damn happy to be there! That upbeat vibe was unexpected but very welcome.

pSKHs4BJGpCw8Q7bejLKCw.text: I love this place!  I drop by for lunch at least once a week.  My favorite is the Great Greek rice bowl with shrimp!  It's like no other rice bowl that you have ever had - and its fabulous!  I also love their salmon, which is perfectly cooked.  The family that runs it is so great!  I love supporting locally owned services - and these guys really know good, clean, healthy food!

zEGjeClCv5KFo1nx_4QwhQ.text: 1 - 5 scale Food 5 Service 4 Decor 4 very clean  I think the gyro is as good as what I've tried in New York City, but the fries are the best in town. The flavor is fantastic if you're a chicken or lamb fan and the feta fries are killer good.   This is a great little place to grab a quick lunch on the patio.

BrN27CiY21I_IM4GUDFutw.text: My favorite restaurant, hands down!! Always pleased with food and great service. Great Rice Bowl is terrific and the soup is a must have.  The chicken is my favorite so far, but after 9 or 10 visits I must admit I haven't tried the beef or lamb, but my husband has and he really likes them. Pita is wonderful and tender, and giros are really good too. We do feel like family when we dine here...everyone is warm and friendly, quick and efficient too. And the place is spotless. What more can you ask for? Even the prices are reasonable.

9lTze7_K0_jiKKxfPVd_8Q.text: This place is good for the price. The fries are Not bad, rice always cooked perfect. Gyros are consistently good. I'll go back when I'm near and craving a gyro.

t-z_OzpA5ZvO1fB5vJGUqA.text: If you like Greek food and a good place to eat when you're really hungry this is the place. The service is friendly and quick and the food is always fresh.  This is the place that I always take out of town folks to come get a nice lunch. Check it out!

RBlA9J727bm5cFjeQy2UHw.text: We stopped by this place while visiting from Portland, Oregon, after reading some great reviews. We were looking for something quick, delicious, and light since we were in town for a race and didn't want to eat typical "travel food". This place did not disappoint. I'm not a Greek food connoisseur but we have some pretty amazing restaurants back home, so I feel like I have enough street cred to say this place was amazing.   We had dolmades, chicken souvlaki, greay gyro, and some baklava. Yum, yum, yum. Moist and tangy dolmas. The chicken was just the right amount of salty/seasoned, and it was moist and tender! The baklava was perfect. Ooey gooey, sweet, and flaky on top. Not rich, just perfect.   Staff was friendly, too! Great service. HUGE servings. We were hungry, and we brought home half our gyro and souvlaki plate. We enjoyed a nice patio seat and relaxed while eating. The place was packed when we arrived and left, so that's always a good sign.   Highly recommend eating here!

byogBELzM9mQGQVw1E0WpQ.text: 3/9/16 - just returned from dinner. Food was good, the young gentleman working the register is a great asset the business.  Upbeat, positive good people person. Atmosphere is ok, don't get me wrong, clean, clean, clean. Just being from out of town I wanted a more relaxed setting.  I will return the next time I'm in the area

vi-dKr4kQO5q-5pTfs82lg.text: I just love this place . The food is just so good, Staff is very friendly , they treat you like family. I really like that they have specials going on every week. To have a big menu with a lot of things on it. I recommend it to everybody

s235sa3UeXRx-Dwm8W4rSQ.text: I have been to this place over a dozen times in the past 6 months and it is AMAZING!!!!  The service is always friendly and helpful.  I usually get the hummus appetizer (ask for extra pita bread!!) steak-lamb gyro and fries.  You would never think that fries would be good at a place like this but they are delicious!  A little crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.   I have also tried their greek salad with chicken. So good, especially if you are watching your waistline.  A little of their dressing goes a long way.  If you have room for dessert you need to get their rice pudding.

VWGRbLI0v3BxHQHAjEjiIA.text: To write this review while I am starving is dangerous because I am tempted to eat my screen to see if I can perhaps capture just a drop of the deliciousness contained in the chicken gyro at The Great Greek. My stomach is angry at me for even attempting to write this while it is suffering, so I will keep it brief.  The spot is casual and spotless. You order at the counter. The prices are reasonable.   I ordered the chicken gyro combo and selected the Greek salad as my side, and as soon as it hit the table, I was in love. The pita was fluffy and piled high with every condiment I could covet. I snapped up a morsel of chicken that had fallen out, and I made a little "oh yeah" noise upon eating it. It was tender, juicy and filled with flavor. The side salad was super fresh and topped with the perfect Greek dressing.   I know it is trite to say, "I wish it were closer," but it is True! I want a chicken gyro, and I want it now!

m1F1YeeYPc5oUXeKFCHVkQ.text: DELICIOUS!! Everyone in my party loved their food. Great prices! $3.95 hummus? Small bowl, but sooo good and they offered an extra pita (warm and melt in your mouth) without us asking. My great Greek rice bowl was the perfect combination of flavors. Yum!

-6OstZtATjrEGRaRS64aZg.text: Absolutely love the salad with chicken. Other than that, the restaurant is always clean and the workers are on top of the game. I seriously crave to come here at least once a week.

nRsumMC5l-x7EE19fYMdvA.text: The food was delicious and the staff was helpful.  I enjoyed the rice bowl and hummus was yummy.

xX5KWIc-x04XhzNNu4HJ9Q.text: LOVE this place. Sitting here waiting for my food so I thought I would write a review. LOVE this place let me say it again. Best meat, fries, everything lol.. and the best vibes ! mmm I can't wait for my food to get here, cus its so fast!

LvsVPY1Vbnfgh_sPLwU9Ww.text: Update:  Happened again... using the app to put special instructions on each item does not yield expected order. The first order of the Rice bowl was correct, but the second on the same order was incorrect regardless of information posted to it. -shrug- ughh I used to love this place  Original review: Order screwed up yet again. Plus 30 min wait for carry out. Online orders seem to have the higher priority than customers who take out or dine in. Other customers behind us received order. I used to LOVE this place, but it'll now be the 4th or 5th restaurant on the list now.  We've been coming to this place before they opened their second location. It's not worth the hassle to call to complain because I'm not driving 5 miles back to fix my Great Greek islands that's just a regular salad.   I threw it out. Hot pockets for me tonight.

pfrZQbFK_QyRMoVtLwrbrQ.text: Ok folks I just got done eating at this gem of a place. I have started a plant based diet (ignore the cheese)....lol. So what better food to get then Greek/Mediterranean. I ordered Dolmades, Falafel Pita with Feta Fries. First the place: it's a very clean and quaint place with both indoor and outdoor seating. The Service: Quick and Super Nice. Now to the fun. The Food: I thought the Dolmades were very good. The Falafel was DYNAMITE!! VERY TASTY and filling. Then comes the feta fries. THERE was a recommendation to add hot sauce. So I did. I wanted to jump in the fries and live there. They were divine. One side note that doesn't matter but I had to say because it was kinda cool to me. Now I'm married and happily but the amount of beautiful women coming here to eat was phenomenal. They just kept coming. Anyways! Give this place a try. You will totally love it!!!!

cOQNa-CSmYxetPHtAixI7g.text: This is our favorite quick, casual Greek food. We usually have the Greek rice bowl or salad to go and are always happy and satisfied with the quality, quantity and taste

q0za14VDK45UO5qnoqmh6g.text: Food - 4/5 Value - 5/5 Service - 4.5/5 Atmosphere/Decor - 2/5  Gyro Plate - Deliciously seasoned gyro meat over soft pita bread. Served with tzatiziki and rilce pilaf. Rice was a bit undercooked and underseasoned. Served with a salad with feta and unpitted kalamata olives. 4/5  Update: First visited 11/3/2017. Ordered from here 1/5/2018 and the rice was both cooked and seasoned perfectly. Updated to 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro Plate

8EojA5BzUqs23-4vysKEXQ.text: I must start this review by saying, I LOVE Greek food. The flavors, the fresh vegetables, and feta cheese is a god send. With that said, I've been to my fair share of Greek restaurants in the states and The Great Greek is hands down the best place I have ever been to.   This place is ALWAYS packed, on my last visit a family of 3 had to cram into a 2 top table and I had no choice by to take mine to go (literally the only drawback to this spot is how popular it is, go figure).   My favorite items on the menu are the gyro's and feta fries and the consistency in their meals is fantastic, always delicious, always perfect. Honestly, you haven't lived without trying the feta fries (extra lemon!)

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro and Feta Fries

Q4MNJyZFRk5Tipl3CIqZbQ.text: I have been here 2 times so far and they have both been great experiences! The food is fresh and delicious! Great for a lunch or dinner with family and friends. I love the chicken gyro!!

NFpuKjIAD-N8l5XtdFNcgQ.text: They are always so welcoming and quick! The food is wonderfully amazing ALWAYS, doesn't matter what you order.

y7ufHZ3GANaIFJ6p51OSdQ.text: This is the real deal!! From the grape leaves to the tzatziki sauce was on point. I'm usually not a fan of the tzatiki but this one is the best I've had. It's not on the menu but you can mix the meats on the traditional plates!! I'm glad cause I got to try the shrimp and lamb. Both awesome!! The staff here is friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. This place is very clean and they are fast. I will be back I have to try the gyros.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb and shrimp plate

YiMB02efQPsYnuE-myUZjw.text: Best gyro in town! It's huge, 2 meals easily. A bit on the pricy side,

4AtkOQbhL_agZE0Yq8vWhA.text: Great fresh food and fast delivery through Grubhub. I love my Greek salad with double gyro and my daughter is a huge fan of avgolemono soup. Yum

WbgwaPedkkw_Y7SLruImbQ.text: I liked the gyro and I liked the gyro salad. Atmosphere was fine, people were friendly. Not a lot of room to sit inside during the busy times of the day and during the summer, I doubt you'll sit outside. Outside sitting area desperately needs a misting system. Other than the seating this place is a great lunch place.

5nfEFDbmWFCNakzW0pU22g.text: I was running errands and I happened to pass by the Great Greek. Earlier this week I went to another Greek restaurant that was just average, so I figured I would do a round 2 and hopefully score a better experience.  I did, but unfortunately not by much. From the outside it looks like a big place, but it is actually quite small with only a handful of tables to sit down at. It is very casual, and I suspect most people are taking their orders to go.  Surveying the menu, I decided on going for hummus, and Lamb Souvlaki with fries and a bottle of water. That turned out to be much more expensive that I thought for such a casual place. But if the food was great I can justify it.  My meal started with a greek salad (comes with the entree), and that was very good. Honestly, it was the best part of the meal. The hummus with pita bread came next. The hummus was good, much better than the last place. Creamy, with some whole garbanzos mixed in with some paprika and olive oil. The pita bread was nothing special, but worked for dipping into hummus.  Then came the Lamb Souvlaki and fries. The fries were very disappointing. It reminded me of my childhood when I would make Ore Ida Zesties freezer fries. The Lamb was cooked okay, but had very little seasoning on it. It just tasted like meat. It was good quality, but not properly seasoned.  A lot of this could be forgiven if it was properly priced, but as it is I wouldn't go back. While I was waiting for my food, three ladies went to order and there total was over $70. They were shocked and just left. So I think for this class of restaurant, the price is steep. But they seem to be doing okay, lol, so perhaps it is just me. :)

-mHroQEff3aez5u976MdBA.text: LOVE IT!! Going back soon. Taste so good, good price for the amount of food. Worth it every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing!!!! Love it! Great taste, reasonable price for the food that I order. I&#39;m going back soon.

hafR7bRyWx5Z7Sf5uMpH1g.text: The food (once it arrived) was outstanding!!  My wife had the Greek salad with chicken.....great flavor and fresh ingredients.  I had the gyro....again, great flavors!!  The delivery problem was not the restaurant's fault, the GrubHub driver delivered to the wrong hotel.

NEPmnUbXVifbwzlZd1QcJg.text: Stopped and ordered two Great Greek Gyros meals, one with fries, the other with the house salad. The Beef/lamb was cut from a spit and the gyros were large and prepared with fresh veggies, a layer of Tzatziki sauce and sprinkled with feta.  Just awesome.  The people are friendly and the service was perfect!  Thanks for a great lunch, we will definitely be back!

ocSQmPV8mmfTJqfBY8d69A.text: Real greek food! Delicious fresh and over all beyond expectations! You should go! Food coma !

Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. I got the steak wow and the feta fries woooooowwww
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy dolmades if im spelling it right. Tastes like home.

Vx6YqWiuIaUSqRgW770x8g.text: Great people, great food, This place does it Right!  We usually stop in here every time we come through the area. It's always a very comfortable and casual atmosphere. The staff are the most happy and relaxed group and always smiling and helpful. To me that really adds to the mood of the restaurant.  We have a toddler and they are always super friendly to the baby and accommodating.  The food is delicious and well priced. We have eaten here several times and tried several dishes. They are all very good and worth your time.  We found the great Greek by searching for something outside of Vegas because we don't really want to fight the traffic or the crowd just to eat. This place is easy to find, easy to get to, lots of parking, no wait, fast service and even a patio.  So If your just in the area or looking for something good outside of Vegas this is a must try!

-yva4NHxia85hwUB96vbYQ.text: Greek food is my favorite and I tend to crave it like a pregnant woman almost daily! And the Great Greek always hits the spot, always!! Hands down this is my favorite restaurant in town and the value here is unbelievable.  The ingredients are always fresh and I have tried a variety of options from the menu. The pasticcio, to the gyro, to the salads, to the Mezze plate and the specials are all phenomenal. Usually even when a place impresses, there is always a but involved, but not here. This place is the best! Zack gives great customer service and his smiling face is almost always here!

j22nD6w7CGbwhmQIOkMBFg.text: (O)rder the Meze Platter to start..great way to try different things (P)izza pans are cleverly used as trays here...Sorry kids, This ain't Cici's...:( (A)vgolemono is the way to upgrade your combo especially with this weather...Fries go with burgers and salad is for rabbits  (G)angnam Style won't be on the stereo here....THANK GOODNESS!!!!!!!! We have been eating here since we moved to Vegas almost 3 years ago My family always is happy after eating here and we will continue to come back!

dQaquveNR1ELTEZJI70MQA.text: Today is Saturday and I hadn't eaten with the old folks for 4 weeks now. So I grabbed the better half, cranked the old beater car up with my cranker, shouted "contact", and off we went to take them out to dinner. I have been wanting to try these 2 Greek places out near Galleria Mall, since, well since the last time we went to eat. With a name like the Great Greek, it's got to be great, right?  It was very good. I don't think it was great. (It's The Good Greek to me.)The place is busy and fast paced. The kind of place where they are so busy that they might tell you to get the heck out and don't let the door hit your rear end on the way out, if you disagree, type of place. IF they were that type of establishment.  But the place is very cheery and inviting. We arrived at 6 so there was a line of 2-4 ppl. I didn't know what to expect when I walked in. So I heed and hawed until I figured out the arrangement. Yup, you order, they give you the numba and you sit down for them to bring the order out. I don't eat Greek too often. Ok, why lie?I don't eat it barely. So I stepped aside and stared at the menu on the wall. Since I couldn't make up my mind, I took a paper menu and stared at that some more, thinking something would jump at me.  The prices range from $2.95 for the feta fries to $12.49 for a entree dish. We ordered 3 dishes, feta fries (because all the good ppl of Yelp said they were to die for...a little more on that in a bit), and baklava for dessert. The girl taking the order is more than happy to teach you how to say these alien sounding words on the menu.  The tables have a nice touch with a flower in it. The place is bright and welcoming. The food came in about 10-15 min. I went to wash my hands in their uber clean restroom and hallway since I was anticipating eating my fries with my hands and not with a knife and fork as they do in England I am told (as that is how 007 would eat, being all debonair and a spy I suppose).  I munched on a fry and then I munched on another. It's crisp and fried hard but tasty. Not so hard that it will crack a tooth mind you but sufficiently more fried and nice and brown then McDonalds (my fries barometer). All I have to say is those people who die for the feta fries, they must not have much to live for. Because heil no I wouldn't die for this fries. They melted some feta cheese on the fries? Forgive me if I contain my exuberance. But I might shout more if I was in a shampoo commercial like Julia Louis Dreyfuss did years ago. The fries reminded me of In N Out chili fries. Does slapping a American Single on top of their fries denote chili fries?  Yeah, like that kind of to die for if you ask me. The fries is better enjoyed left alone without the accoutrement if you ask me. But then again, what do I know about Greeks besides their IMF downgrades and EU bailouts? I think I vaguely remember that they are famous for catering bathrobe parties in college fraternity houses.  We ordered the pasticcio, mezze plate, grilled steak souvlaki, and gyro plate. The steak was perfectly cooked medium rare and was tasty. The mezze plate composed of hummus, dolmades, falafel, tzaziki, and spanakopita (I have no idea what these things are, they sound very cute though).  The falafel was small and it didn't remind me of falafel. It was ok. Is it supposed to be that small and dry? I honestly didn't know which was the falafel but my better half pointed it out to me. I just eat. It was the size of a giant Walnut. The hummus was ok. The plate came with yogurt, Greek "yoghurt" that is. I think it had olive oil in it as it was green. (That or my yogurt was crying green.) Greek yogurt is so special that they included a H in it. The rice that came with the steak was tasty. It was more yellow than I was so I assume it must've had butter all over it? A salad came with 3 of the entrees. It was good, it had feta cheese in it? Really Mediterranean olives that were tart enough to make Stevie Wonder see for a second. It was a nice small salad. The pastry looking baked things were nice and flaky. The pasticcio was a lasagna it turns out. Basically cheese on top and macaroni on the bottom that's been impregnated with meat all swimming in a nice tomato sauce. It was good.  By 7pm there was a line that stretched from the counter to the door. Now this isn't Katz's Deli kind of snaked line but it was long, then again there's only maybe 6 small tables inside. If they sold pizza, I'd have to go outside to eat a Large pizza.  The girls were nice and friendly and brought out the food fast and cleaned up just as fast. They cleared the table for us before bringing out the baklava dessert that was drizzled in honey. Yes, it was sugar on sugar on honey. If it was any sweeter, Shirley Temple would've been a penniless Vaudeville player (I am a history buff). So if you are in the hood, want friendly and fast service with a small neighborhood feel restaurant, stop in and see The Good Greek. (Yes, I said good not great.

BPPblskRNFbfZXVhzQim4Q.text: Dear Jerry G, On May 11, at 4:30, we placed an order of your House Special Pork Chop, the lady said it'll take 10-15 mins. We came at 4:45 and I sent my son to get our food, they took my son's pay but did not give him a receipt and told him we had to wait another 10 mins. after the 10 mins, it yet was still not ready, I was furious, I finally went inside to see what was the hold up, and they said that they didn't want to serve raw pork. like are you serious?, Who does that! I finally got everything by 5:05. If I knew it would take more than 30 mins to cook my dry pork chop, I would've chose another place to eat. They also need to stop telling people that it would take 10-15 mins, when it take 30 or more minutes.   P.S. This is the first time I've ever written a review on a restaurant because of how many flaws and how much I was disappointed. I didn't enjoy my food because of this, yet this would've never happened if they told the truth of the time.

Great Greek gyro combo with rice, 7.95+2.95 - Chicken or Lamb. Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, Tzaziki for $23.08  Side choices include: French Fries, Rice, Greek Salad, Avolemono Soup, Feta Fries (50c more) - Nice patio seating. Food delivered to us.  - Wait time around 15 min. Fast food style but wait time like a dine in restaurant. - Big portioned burger. Fresh and crispy fries.  - Packed Gyro. Lame rice. - Good taste. A bit pricey for what it's worth. Worth it for 1 try.  - Hard to compete when there are so many around for about the same taste with coupons for cheaper.  - Uncertain if I'd return.

bLXWMbhuj0yYifqYJ9j8bg.text: Always busy, and there's good reason!  Previous owners of The Fat Greek restaurant off Flaming/Decatur they have experience and heritage backing the booming reputation.   This is a quaint cafe and location with indoor and patio seating. If you're looking for "affordable, quick, healthy and fresh" Greek food that is pleasing to the palate, this is the place!

UJS6RmhFf8z8pi8dkGm8ow.text: Excellent greek food.  The gyro's are awesome and the rice is to die for. It's hard to find good greek around here, but this place is the best.

3PHT-2FW7CbiU5mqCQvfLQ.text: Falafel wrap is good.  Be warned:  portions are big, so come hungry.  The feta fries are ok.  The feta just doesn't melt well like other cheeses, so I was disappointed with the "upgrade."  The dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves) were not good.  Too oily.  Not enough rice.  They were on the thin sized.  Daphne's Greek Cafe's dolmathes are better.  Restaurant is small, so come early if you plan to eat inside.    Prices are reasonable and bathrooms are clean.

XoPJOKLtALQ0j9x-qqUdKQ.text: I love the food here! I always get their grilled chicken souvlaki plate with rice pilaf, and it's usually enough food for 2 meals. Everything is always cooked to order, so if you're in a hurry, you must call your order in 15-20 minutes ahead of time. They're also pretty busy most of the time, so you will more than likely wait a while for your food. The staff is very friendly, and the guy always offers me a cup of water or something while I wait. The only downfall to this place is that their dining area is really small and always busy.

I once called and asked if it was possible to make a gyro bowl in  5 minutes and I don't know how they did it, but THEY DID IT! Love this place!!!!!! I give the gyro 5 stars! I still have yet to try any other dishes. BEST GYRO I'VE EVER HAD.

NVkSUWO6e9UyT3gIzUMOuA.text: On Friday I searched Yelp to look for a Gyro Sandwich, there were alot of different places to choose from so I chose to try this place.   Great decor and Food. Had to wait about 25mins for my order and that's because this place was rocking, there was nice amount of people eating outside and inside when I got there. I ordered the Gyro Sandwich with fries. The only problem I had was that I ordered the fries with tzatziki and they forgot to add it, so I had to wait for another order of fries. The staff was pleasant.   If in town you should try this place.

pzI1fk731Ji-qHLxlF0SKw.text: We have been here a few times and everything has always been really good and fresh!! The chicken and steak skewers are good, pita is hot and hummus is delicious!!  The service is always friendly and you can tell that they work very hard!!  Last night I ordered the Salmon Greek Salad and the Salmon is the best thing that I have had so far.  The Salmon was seasoned and cooked perfectly.  Make sure to order it medium because they said if you order it well done, it will be dry.  I am so glad that I listened to them because it was AWESOME!!!  This is definitely my go to place for Greek and Mediterranean food now and can't wait to get back there and have some more Salmon!!!

My girlfriend gets the Pastitsio. Both are delicious.   The only downside- there is often a wait for take out, usually takes 30 minutes.

fGOVyFzMKO_iJGUJkhZ-Pg.text: this place has great fresh homemade food. one Friday i had the Greek lasagna and been craving it ever since.  highly recommend this Greek food as much as the other great place around the corner, the family run hole in the wall Manna.  if you love this place try both, love the homey feel

0E0X0TsR70lBOS9D_WiqJw.text: I have a new obsession with Greek food. I don't know why but I do. I guess there are worse things to do in Las Vegas.  So I did a yelp search and this was the closest place to my office. The reviews looked good so I went over for lunch. I walked in and the place was nice and clean. It's pretty new with several high tops and many shorter 4 tops. I got in line and ordered a gyro plate, Hummus (togo) and some banana pudding.   Gyro Plate - It was pretty good. I enjoyed the meat and everything was fresh and tasty. Now I'll have to say I enjoyed Ambrosia Cafe MUCH better which is why I gave it 3 and not 4 stars.   Banana Pudding - It wasn't that exciting. There was a  place in Denver that just had the best in the world. It was ok, but I would have liked it to seem like they had put a little more love in it.  Hummus - As always hummus is just awesome. Their pita was soft and yummy. I wish they had given more, but there you have it.   I liked this place but didn't just LOVE it. It's close so there is a chance I'll give it another change and see what else they have to offer.

exE_LVWKz26XR6jIj3SReA.text: Very good.   Ate there today and had the gyro plate and greek salad.   The Rice Pilaf as a side item was excellent and the gyro was tender and moist and the sauce was excellent.     Place definitely gets a thumbs up from me.   Clean, inviting, and very friendly staff.

kU0ieAyUMEJn7pcbz3hD1w.text: I visited this place during dinner time on a Saturday and there was a crowd! The good thing was that the service was quick and the food came promptly. They have inside and outside seating which is pretty nice when there's nice weather.   My husband ordered the great Greek gyro. He ordered it as a combo and it included a drink with a side. He picked the feta fries and they were good. He also said he really liked the gyro. It looked full of lamb and yummy!   I ordered a plate with rice, lamb and pita bread. The portion was big and there was food left on my plate when I finished eating. I thought the food was very flavorful and fresh.   We also ordered the dolmas as appetizers and they were pretty good! There were 6 pieces in our order which I think it was more than enough for two people. I do wish they offered a 4 piece for 2 people since we ended up not eating all of them.   I would definitely be back!
