-OfvDFKkEPFwZcZBwE8GwQ.text: If you love garlic, raise your hands. If you love Greek food, raise your hands. If you love feta! You have reached my favorite Greek Food Location in Henderson. Not only do they offer great food, they also sale beer!   I had the absolute pleasure of trying, The Grilled Chicken Souvlaki! I have now idea how to say Souvlaki, but it's amazing! For $12.95 you get two skewers of Marinated Chicken Breast, rice Pilaf or Feta Fries! Yes Feta Fries can you believe it!! check the photo out, they are in no way cheap on the Feta! My entire order came out hot, and ready to eat, the restaurant and it's service second to none. When the suns out you can eat outside or inside either or!  Other great items to try, warm pits bread and hummus $2.00 and Falefel $2.50.. gyros run, chicken $6.95 enjoy all and don't forget the gum after or the mints!! Garlic is life here! Yummmm

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta Fries $2.95
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Pita Bread and Hummus $2.00
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Best Of Las Vegas 2015

a2tMc98GUmS19LpyBl5Csw.text: Can I leave no stars? I give this place a big 0!!!  The family and I stoped here for dinner. Most of the flavors are okay. The chicken smelled and tasted foul. I couldn't figure out what it was, something was wrong with it. Almost immediately we got really sick and after ten minutes from eating, my hubby even threw-up. Not to mention, we payed over $70 dollars for this meal.  We where very excited to try this place until all this happened.  If you have a strong stomach go for it!

JlvJyB5StOHln8I9WzM1dA.text: The best gyros eva! Always busy, so the wait times & getting your correct items can be a challenge at times. I kid you not...1 night someone with my same exact name had a to go order with Uber eats and I almost took their food home because the staff gave it to me! Lol. But once you try their gyros...you will join the fan club of this yummy place too!

g1lcT8BTDVpAUflD_Gcs9A.text: I love this place! It is the best Greek place in Vegas! I always go to the greek fest here in town each year and I still LOVE this place the most! I also love that its family owned because  ALL the employees are super nice!

0rNXGN8kYk3bqoJc2xremg.text: OMG SOOOOOO GOOD!  Last time I had this kind of food I was in a different country.......They are super sweet here and all the eating customers were happy.....good vibe good place....they get 10 stars!!!!!!!!!

_SGf8hRuL0E9gHXibFxEsg.text: I am obsessed with their feta dip (Tirokafteri)! It is creamy Greek feta with spicy roasted peppers and it is amazing! I seriously dream about this dip.  My Husband loves Greek food, so it doesn't take much convincing to get him to take me to dinner here. We traditionally get the gyro plate, which comes with sliced gyro meat, pita bread and your choice of french fries or rice pilaf. I usually get the rice because it's a healthier option and it's very well made.  The restaurant is small and gets crowded. There is no table service - you order at the counter and they will bring your food to you when it's ready. The gyro plate is just $11.95, which is a much better value than many of the other local Greek places we've been to, and in my opinion this food is better. They've been around for a long time, so I'd say they're doing something right!

LQ-2SLi65rL65DdcXSXthw.text: What an awesome but small place this "Great Greek" is. First you have to watch for it and second you have to stay in the row to order.  At the end this does not matter, because the greek  food is more than excellent. Don't forget as dessert to try the rice pudding ! YUMMI.

g4goGmJ_peI0vv_SLpeswA.text: Call in your order ahead of time! There is always at least a 20-30 min wait. The food is always amazing and super fresh! The hummus is some of my favorite! The staff is super friendly and the place is always spotless! Love love love this place!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak and lamb
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken

Hde03XRtrbIlIegL_MfDiA.text: I've stopped in a few times and there's always a steady stream of people. If that's not a sign, I don't know what is... Actually, my bf says that he sometimes passes by people picketing a labor dispute here, but I guess those signs don't deter anyone. Like they say, "there's no such thing as bad publicity..."  Talking strictly food, I do enjoy ordering from here. Even though the beef/lamb gyro seems to be a customer favorite, I prefer to get the grilled chicken option. The traditional gyro ($6.95) comes with tomatoes/red onions/tzatziki, while the Great Greek gyro ($7.95) includes that plus lettuce and feta. Worth getting the latter. Love me some feta cheese. The traditional plates range from $11.95 to $13.95, which include your choice of protein, along with a Greek side salad, pita bread, and your choice of rice pilaf OR french fries. Plenty, plenty food. I've only bummed off a few bites from my bf's plate, but their rice pilaf's good -- light and lemon-y.  Tip: Order ahead of time online using ChowNow. It'll save you from sitting around and waiting for 20 or so minutes. The first time we went, the poor cashier was handling both for-here and to-go orders, AND bussing the tables.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. greek side salad that&#39;s included with the plate.
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. the great greek gyro (with grilled chicken).
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. grilled chicken souvlaki plate. (salad not pictured)

5QuaBkx1rbY5g5BgxOJgng.text: My husband and I are here almost every Friday night. Truth be told, we've been known to come in more than once a week. Everything we've ever eaten here is awesome,  but if you fancy salmon, I definitely recommend it! Everything is seasoned perfectly.  Service is always terrific. Every time we have company in town,  this is absolutely on our lunch itinerary. We've brought you devotees from several states now! Just can't find enough good things to say.

yWKJnPd2aeL5QyBgeNKTtw.text: Second review, because why not. Tried to come on a Sunday for dinner but it was closed so we had to go for another place and boy were we disappointed. We made another attempt and ordered to go yesterday a little bit earlier and we are now committed to the Great Greek for our Greek food fix! The food, as always, was exactly what we would expect from the taste, to the quality. I may, one day, decide to explore other items on the menu, but for now I am hooked on to the Souvlaki plate with chicken and lamb skewer.  Tried baklava for the first time which I wasn't a fan of but everything else is always great.

1fPw5t4fEPlRfYGIIvK_1g.text: Date night with my wife. Fresh lamb gyro for me.  Steak kabob and salad for my better half. Waited 7 mins for table but well worth it.  Best food. Best service!

kGucrQoF1-UNYl7DTWSvnA.text: Place needs to expand. Always packed. Seating is a battle. Since they've been catering to Grub Hub, the food quality has decreased.

zBxmL4JW6JL0Ww6A2nMlBQ.text: Amazing lamb and great portion siZes.  Feta fries were great melted.  Can't wait to try baklava ice cream and rice pudding

oWwkSQgwq4gV3n_BUU0BwQ.text: You Have to try this place.  We ordered the "small" Greek salads with falafel.  Nothing small about them and perfect.  Gyros are spot on. Less than a mile from my house, how have I missed this place?

c8drStb3Ff5qdimabddmSw.text: Best Greek place in town!! Absolutely delicious and good portions for an affordable price!! We definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

oV5QG04hdJjbJZTayIvmcQ.text: Simply amazing. Best Greek food I've had since I went to Greece in 2009. Chicken gyro was tender, fries super crispy and the pita bread was so fluffy and delicious. I took my food to go but I'll dine in when I return. Great selection of domestic and Greek beer (Mythos!) and wine. Great menu, too much to choose from is a good thing. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken gyro to go with the most crispy yummy fries. Loved!!

9xsWL64Wv5K3fiMrlanTeg.text: Can I tell you how obsessed I am with this place! AMAZING FOOD amazing service! Me and my friends come here on a regular, they are amazing! The staff is so friendly. The only thing I will say is that I wish there was more space so I could bring more people! I 10000% recommend eating here.

0CKVQqR-LEezOELIk2pGIw.text: Just got back after 3 months and where do we go for dinner? The Great Greek ! Delicious as ever and the servings were great. The meat in the Gyro was melt in your mouth good and tender. The salad was garden fresh. Thank you Great Greek for fresh, delicious, healthy Greek food .

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great food at Great Greek
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. For Tom Lamb+beef gyro  and a salad. For me Shrimp plate dinner at the Great Greek in Henderson. Great food !

RgdC-Z5Jh1uv7HBHPKlpkQ.text: In Henderson to shop, yelped Greek restaurants and Great Greek came up. What a find! The szatziki was amazing..they make their own yogurt which made a big difference..and the spinach pie (can't spell it) was so crispy and flavorful we ordered another. We will definitely return.

qytV_kfu13dYmzHGjUoN4g.text: I like Greek food but I don't think This is Real Greek foodI think this would be the Taco Bell version of Greek food it's still good bye it's not the real Greek like you would find in GreeceThe food still tastes great

W17EdPw4upxmsc7pN4Xkcw.text: Fantastic! Loved the lamb rice bowl. Was delicious. This is definitely our new Greek place. Service was great also. Very nice people.

7WxGi_sm45jWQEHl62apDQ.text: Wow, let me start by saying I this is the first time any business has asked me to give my seat up for other patrons. I came in and ordered to go, feeling under the weather so I decided to get dinner for my husband and I. After ordering and tipping I found a small table and waited for my order. The Owner/ manager comes over and taps me on my shoulder and asked me to move to a single chair by the door so other customers could sit. Wow! I'm African American and a business owner myself, and that is a complete no! No! There was a gentleman ordering to-go whom sat at a table with four chairs and remained until his order was complete. I wish I could've un-tipped and left! I will never return as well as letting all my friends and family know just how this establishment feels about people of color! I'm more hurt than anything that this type of action is allowed yet still. We are all humans, no matter what color.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

uTjmI0vLtngfhddUMzwJAw.text: I love this place! The whole staff, especially Jak always make me feel so special. I would recommend anything and everything on their menu.  It's always fast, fresh and always exceptional service.

k8JUalpgCBNfvgulzJkbSQ.text: Delicious... hit it out of the park again. Greek salad with gyros meat. Huge sluces of vegies in it snd lots of meat. Always my fav greek place. The service was gast for lunch so i appreciate that and the people are always nice.

myMn79w-pt-QR0wtrykTIg.text: My employer caters with this place once a month or so. DELICIOUS food. It is always a work favorite when we order here. Fresh ingredients and great taste!

g9uD6s9MoQ9KjB4mwe2eoQ.text: GREAT GREEK BOWL WITH SHRIMP! Not even kidding, don't come here without getting this- it is delicious. It's a huge bowl of soft, moist rice topped with cucumber salad, tomatoes, lettuce, feta, tzatziki, garbanzo beans, and the perfectly grilled shrimp. It's basically a Greek salad on steroids, with some rice. That shrimp is the bomb dot com, no lie. Grilled and seasoned to herby, lemony perfection. A light but filling meal.  The GREAT GREEK GYRO is also a tasty option- pillowy pita with a good portion of beef-lamb topped with red onion, tomato, feta, and more tzatziki. It's a good gyro, dont get me wrong, but the bowl is a bit more unique. The AVGOLMONO SOUP is a flavorful lemony broth filled with chicken and rice. The version here is tastier than many other places ice tried it, and as a side, the portion is quite large.  I'm not in Henderson often, but when I am, I'll be keeping this place on my radar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great greek bowl with shrimp
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Avgolemono soup

89-YD3k75ghtWNDQw45jKA.text: Delicious every single time! You can't go wrong with the traditional gyro. The place is nice and clean and has plenty of seats if you want to dine in, but I usually call ahead and get carryout.

GYaSBqtqiX-1IOt5PDPAxg.text: Good Service, GREAT FOOD. I really love this place they serve up a great gyro. Good place to go to once every couple weeks to get my Greek food fix.

LamBsQ5VcHhQO9Rm07E67Q.text: Great food...staff...whats not to like??  Quality at its best and prices are unbelievably low compared to other places

rgNvUrxILiY8B8QDVBNiEw.text: Came here to try something new in the sunset area.  Nothing was wrong with the place, but it was mediocre food, fine service, it was busy.  I found it by reviews. I've had better gyros.  I wouldn't come again.

G12ZGF3WI0LrwfN9ODxK0A.text: Perfect rainy day to visit a sick friend facing major surgery so I stopped at The Great Greek for a fast but tasty take out lunch. Fresh Avgolemono soup ( traditional thick Greek chicken & lemon rice soup), warm pita bread and a bit of white wine. I really like having lunch there but stopping by for take out at noon or dinner works too. Counter customer service is reliable, friendly and respectful. They remember customers and I appreciate that in the food industry. Thinking about using their catering service next.

7PduSiSyjSVsv2_b_cCgWQ.text: Within 30m of eating here, my stomach was turning! It is now the next day and I'm still not right. My stomach has been tied since!  It's now 24hrs later and I still can't be too far from a bathroom. I'll never eat here again. I had the traditional gyro and salad and the falafel appetizers.

tWZB_xXaxJAVjt__bqOT3g.text: It was my turn to pick lunch and The Great Greek had been on my bookmarks for a long time.  The location is small inside and seemed to be busy the entire time we were there.  There is also patio seating that will accommodate once the weather warms up a bit.  I had excellent service.  The gentleman helping us was very helpful since we told him it was our first time in.    I had ordered the grilled garlic shrimp plate.  It was accompanied with feta fries and pita bread.   Delicious!  There were 2 skewers of shrimp with 4 on each.   This was definitely plenty to fill my stomach.  Not to mention the outstanding fries.  This was my first time having these and I love feta cheese.  Yum.   My plate also came with a side salad which I didn't finish.  The dressing was a little bit much and overpowering.  But overall it was great.     I had asked the gentlemen if they had lemon potatoes since they weren't on the menu.   They do!  You just have to ask them to make them.  I might just have to go back soon to try those out!   So the business name fits the review - Great Greek! Opa!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled garlic shrimp with feta fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro

I3CZS1cPkL9xX1qj1p_YkQ.text: The best Greek food spot. I travel from Summerlin to Henderson. That's how good it is. I have gotten their Gyro and athenians burger. The meat isn't too oily and is seasoned well. The feta fries are nicely seasoned and the feta is melted properly and not burnt on top of the fries. It's a small place so it's hard to find a table but the service is good and the workers are nice and helpful. Their rice bowls are good too with good amount of protein and vegetables. Will continue to get my fix here.

a5o7sOYLx95rsQhro6PF7g.text: This place is clean,tasty and quality food although I do wish they would do a better job of keeping the line down and being more flexible on their combos.I don't want 5 servings of rice..how about 1 serving and a salad included?I refuse to go here anymore due to the portion sizes,I go to the place down the street usually but I do still enjoy this place very much.

jjc8dsFC23olFjmsmN0WRw.text: It's so good that we seriously need to consider leaving bad reviews -- it's getting too busy!  EDIT: After a couple years, the Great Greek just became too busy. The quality has suffered a little bit (chicken soulvaki tough on a few occasions) but overall it remains a solid place to eat. Us, personally, we've found another Greek place in Henderson that we enjoy a little bit more (I will not disclose the name, because both are very good, and the object is not to take away business from the Great Greek -- because, it is, in fact, great. It just isn't as great as it used to be. And I have to be fair to the original five-star review.   This seems to be somewhat of a regular problem in the valley: places open strong & then cannot deal with the influx of customers.

eKoOS1-8WB13X7-MpzUGiw.text: Any dining establishment that caters to my kids is a go-to for me! I love this place!   Atmosphere: family oriented. The place is family-owned and they extend that family feel to their customers. My husband orders a greek salad but he asks them to leave off the tomatoes and cucumbers. The owner acts like this is fine with her while I stand there and laugh! They are awesome!  They have the best rice that I've ever had. My kids beg to go there and eat some rice.  The pita and hummus is just insane delicious. Whenever we are waiting for our food, they pop over with some warm, fresh pita slices for our children.   The chicken souvlaki plate is my staple there. The chicken is marinated to perfection and the rice and salad accompaniment are the perfect meal!  We've tried the falafel and the texture is perfect. The flavors blend well with the sauce, onions and falafel and it tastes heavenly.  The baklava is the BEST I've ever had!   Wish they had more seating (it's almost always full when we go in to eat). We often take the food to go for this reason.  Don't miss the rice pudding!!!

wFmtSBW8jyqXg6CfxEu83A.text: Loved it. Very authentic! The girls were doing double and triple duty, serving as cashier, bussing tables, and serving food with a great attitude and a smile. The gyro was fabulous. Didn't skimp on the Tzatziki sauce like most. The salad wrap is actually on a grilled tortilla. (I missed that in the description). Though my fault, I was still disappointed. I love pita. Why would you choose a tortilla when you could eat a pita?? Still, food was great. Highly recommend it.

8l_8fG2LvGHv-o43P1iyMQ.text: My favorite Greek place hands down. Wonderful service AND wonderful food. The best of both worlds ;) and I love the family! So sweet

ORH0xjcju9ktb2MTwPq0jw.text: Food was fresh and resonabley priced never had greek food before but would definitely try again.

f-9cRXC04EJYr9nitxSeyQ.text: Went here again a second and third time and service was not as expected.  Second time I went after work around 4:00PM. There weren't any customers ahead of me so there shouldn't have been any problems. Took about 15 minutes to get my chicken gyro to go. Since I was off I wasn't in a particular rush so I let it slide. Food was still great so I would give it 4 stars.  The third that I went I was around 1:00PM on a Thursday. The lunch rush looked like it was about to end because many people were finishing up there food. I got in an ordered the grilled shrimp plate thinking it shouldn't take so long to make...that is if the kitchen doesn't forget order.   I sat and waited patiently for 25 minutes and noticed people that came in after me after got their food already. Nobody came to check up on my even though I was at the table right in front of the counter. I approached the counter and asked what was going on. The lady working the front looked confused and shouted at the kitchen asking what's taking so long with the order. The slip was still just hanging at the food window untouched. I couldn't wait any longer as I had to get to work and asked for a refund since my food haven't even been started yet. The lady did not even say sorry and just kept shaking her head at me as she voided my transaction.  Maybe back of the house were new? I don't know, but I was not treated very well by the front of the house. Maybe I'll try this place again later, but it's going be a long while before I come back.

3ulmqN9CloHeZ8xPSg9Gpw.text: The guy behind the counter, the owner's son?, is fabulous.  Great disposition.  Part of the experience.  The food was great.  Very tasty.  Had the baklava ice cream.  It is FABULOUS.  Definitely will come back.

fanu6uRxjVctawY_ua9hWg.text: This is one of my favorite lunch places, their gyros are fantastic! :D I will definitely come back here again! Plus the staff are amazing :3

FbHAs1SF3jfSyz9rIEqg0g.text: Really good food!   The Gyro plate is such a GOOD DEAL! You get so much Gyro meat for your money. They give you a Greek salad, that is really fresh. Then you get a choice between fries or rice. And they give you so much Gyro lamb and beef.   And it was really delicious.  The girl working the counter was very friendly. Restaurant was clean and so was the bathroom.   I live about 15-20 minutes from here but I will definitely be back again.

lbMD3K0Z7A94sBcm-9CW2A.text: The staff is awesome and you get that family-owned vibe. The food is great as well and I love the baklava ice cream! Good price for what you get! Love the lamb gyros. I try to bring as many people as I can here.

NJuKvCrNjGZWfEfCXMWWZg.text: Been here several times but never posted a review. Not only is the food delicious, well cooked, and perfectly seasoned, but the wonderful service you receive from this small business is awesome. I wish larger businesses in the area would practice the same wonderful customer service that The Great Greek has consistently provided. Love having this great place in Henderson!!

EarhMpl2Bc4uSyYxh7AQew.text: Fresh and fast, and YUM! You know you've made a good lunch choice when there are police officers eating at the restaurant as well - they always know where to go for food with a great value. We tried chicken soup, dalmades and a salad. The salad was amazing, definitely try it with the falafel or chicken, comes with a couple pieces of warm pita. The dalmades, do they make them fresh? Because it sure tasted like it, comes with 6 pieces and a wedge of lemon. The soup is a little strange, it doesn't know whether it wants to be chicken-based broth or a cream-based, but very citrus-y and refreshing, so I let that slide.   Basically, a great place for a quick lunch, it's very clean and as usual with restaurants in Henderson, NV, tons and tons of parking.

CKpc-90zHMk7pzrEHowxnA.text: I LOVE this place. It is by far my favorite Greek place in Las Vegas. The food is so fresh and you can tell lots of love goes into every bit of making it. Yes it is busy and crowded, but that's how you know it's a really yummy place. I'd wait any day because it's worth it. You have to try the RICE PUDDING. Seriously amazing. The service is great and the people working there really make you feel at home and try to accommodate you wherever they can. I laugh at reviews that say"it needed a bit more salt" or the pita was a bit too soft? If you are that picky you should dine at 5 star restaurants. It's a mom and pop place( family owned) people. Geez....trust me try this place. You won't regret it.

4KA6n3-DIX4TcP2Hb2Om5Q.text: Now here's a place to get excited about. It's delicous and delightful. Amazing fresh food. I just moved to Vegas 6 weeks ago and I've easily been here 10 times. Everytime the food is amazing, friendly staff. The place is small and getting a table is HARD, the wait for the food is a little longer than I'd like. But you can't rush perfection and deliciousness! Definitely worth all of it!

H3i7LpKfW-F21jB9eHohNA.text: Wonderful service and delicious food! I always feel  welcomed.  My favorite is the shrimp skewers and hummus! I've tried almost everything on the menu and can't say one bad thing.

L7mQhZDdBRoiEu_o2bd4Gw.text: This is the one of the best Greek foods in Nevada. All my Greek friends go there and love it. You NEED to try this place. Our favorite is chicken souvlaki with rice pilaf, feta fries and their tzatziki sauce

RcoqA-xMuUGm4IGxxhqBtw.text: Rice pudding Home made is to die for. Family owned and run. Very friendly staff. They used to offer a salmon version of the greek salad wrap. So so so so so good, but not sure if they still offer it with salmon.

HEalNXGFopxXdfq1IyM23g.text: Just tried this place out for the first time today! I tried the Avgolemono soup and it was delicious (and by far the best side of Peta slices I've ever tasted)! I will most definitely be coming back! Prices are fair, however it is a small dining room and there's only 4 patio tables outside, all of which were occupied when I went. So prepare yourself to wait for people to leave and open a table or get your food to go.

wKnvGU9-x-ypUEN8jk_dQQ.text: Had a great lunch with friends before the movies, was awesome. I enjoyed the grilled shrimp and Greek salad and watched so many delicious looking entrees served around me. Have to go back and try them all!! For dessert I devoured the baklava ice cream which was heavenly. The service was great, you order up front and they bring it to your table. Truly enjoyable.

Y5gTdgK7yRzVCCzH-uEqSw.text: This place is flat awesome! Super friendly staff, clean facility, and great food and value! Enjoyed the Greek gyro with chicken and feta fries. Will definitely return.

N4gzWpURqsBakTx-g4OrFg.text: Apparently this is a relatively new establishment.  I've been in twice now for lunch carry-out and neither time did they disappoint!  I had the gyro plate, grilled shrimp, spanakopita, dolmades, and baklava.  The service was excellent and the food wonderful!  Price-points offered good value.

k51ARLsdXT03mzg9a_iWOQ.text: Its Friday.  I'm not too fussy, but Mr M challenges me with the choice of Mediterranean or Cantonese.  A couple of checks on Yelp means we can't find a Cantonese we haven't already tried, so The Great Greek was the target.  Nice little cafe-style casual place, and all the tables except one are full.  Place was super clean, staff were lovely.  Mr M had gyro plate and I got Mezze plate.  Good sized portions, and fresh Greek side salads.  Hummus/Tzatiki (sp??) were pretty nice and pitta bread hot and bendy.  I overheard another family leave and say "man, that was good, we'll be back".  I agree.

P4oISN2ZIhUPnc3YF5xngQ.text: Food was wonderful, clean restaurant, fast service and all around great experience! Definitely a new fave for my family

yAvxvnbkKSGORpB3E6EThw.text: I have been searching Vegas for a long time to find a Great Greek restaurant that would make me feel like I was in the kitchen of a homemade cooked meal. My search is over. Yai Yais pastitsio can't get any better! The seasonings in the Greek salads cannot get any closer to booking a trip to Greece itself. I am in the food industry and I will send everyone I know,that has a longing for excellent Greek cuisine.It gets busy,but well worth the wait. Portions are large,price is right. You have a new customer for life. OPA!!!! Good luck to you and your family.

Pp6XBxvkWs-uvu5RycrafQ.text: I'm really not sure why it has taken me so long to review The Great Greek, we first ate there probably close to 6 months ago. We were in the process of buying a new car at the nearby auto mall and came here on our "solo" test drive. I guess they were really close to closing for the night, but one of the workers saw us at the door and came over to let us in. Once we got our food, it was so delicious! The staff is very nice and helpful and the place is also very clean. I will definitely try this place again next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great food from The Great Greek!

f-BBoCI2svD2GshldOF_Xw.text: AMAZING!!!  We drive all the way from Summerlin.  A good 30 minute drive!!!! Everything is delicious.  Please build a cafe in Summerlin!!

8rlhCIAwsFsE9HKstCBBaQ.text: The Great Greek is as good as it gets. The food is amazing. Fresh, perfectly prepared, and huge portions. They also have a nice selection of beverages in addition to the everyday fountain drinks and iced tea. I bring the family often and get the family meal. We are a family of 5 and we always have tons of leftovers. My only complaint would be the small dining area. It's pretty small and there aren't too many options for parties of 3 or more. We have had to leave several times because there was nowhere to sit. Not much they can do about that since a crowd means customers, and they can't exactly make more room. Overall, fantastic food, and great service. I dream about the feta fries.

tI78qe94d1BUDgXpzRJsXA.text: took my cousin to go check this place out. i got the lamb/beef pilaf rice plate and he got some kind of salad platter thing. honestly when our two orders came out they had the same ingredients but positioned differently. but mine came with pita bread. the yogurt cucumber sauce was really good. definitely didnt think i would get full off of it but i was stuffed. drinks are self serve. the lady who i assume was the owner would come around and check up on us frequently and came and took our garbage away.

K3q98EeWSVZI1MPX2gW54w.text: The Greak Greek is one of the best things that has happaned to our neighborhood. The Fries alone are worth the trip and I believe the Chef has created an amazing deal for a $5 Gyro which makes Subway look like a Ford parked next to a Rolls Royce. If you are looking for an affordable place to eat that serves quality fresh food at its finest then go to The Great Greek.

yYH1d67HbUHSL86dt9NHeg.text: Was craving the (gyro) sandwich and went here to get the (gyro) plate.Have got the plate before and it was good? This time i went for lunch alone and got the plate to go with extra pita. Got home and the Gyro was plain? (no veggies)  I mean onions or tomatoe? Who makes a Gyro like that ? or do you have to ask for onion and tomatoe..I thought that was part of the sandwich..Very disapointed..I have to say the youg man at counter was polite and opened the carry out box for me to see before leaving , I assumed that the veggies were buired in there some were, so i took it. If the Owner was on top of the Kitchen stsaff (instead of hugging the guest in the dinng room) and making small talk, The food woould be on point all the time ? Not hit and miss  $10 is alot for lunch to get a Partial sandwich. I noticed the other times i came here and the (owner) was in the Kitchen the orders came out correct.

sKx11CqXZSMPlwVxyF1aQw.text: Never had a bad experience with the employees or the food. This no doubt the freshes salad you will every eat.  We work close and Alice (owner/cashier) knows who we are by name and what our order will be before we tell her.  Ok we are creatures of habit but when you find what is exceptional why order anything else. The side salad with grilled chicken is huge. The sandwich's are delicious and large portions. If you don't experience the feta fries you are missing out.  Lunch time is very busy which to me is a good thing, it means they serve great food. Just call ahead an order, they open at 11am and we call for a pick up time an it is always ready. They have a nice patio when it is not too hot.  Sorry to hear some people had a poor experience, all I can saw is try them again, you won't be sorry.  Karen

nGD_LrW9Ufjlk2Jtix_k7Q.text: finally i found a greek restaurant in town that i can love. the service was excellent. the food, great. i got the gyro combo with fries and side salad! yum!  i ordered a chicken souvlaki (a side for $3.00) and got a small chicken breast instead , dont get me wrong! it was delicious! i just thought it was way too expensive for the size i got. i want to go back soon! oh, and very clean! great job guys!

zA60fA2m1txBy960neeiTg.text: Awesome Greek food! Its now my new favorite place to eat Greek food. The food is amazing but so are the people who were there. They are so nice and friendly. Also the atmosphere was amazing. You cannot go wrong by eating here!

GzOhJ-oeMAirvxGtFHOEPQ.text: Fabulous gyro! My wife is raving about the soup. We'll be back.

9c-riNAdZlJqnpoISinK4Q.text: Great food, great people. I got the burger, which was very good, and my wife got the chicken gyro wrap, she liked hers too. Place was packed, always a good sign, the food is superb.

vFwthjriXm-qGDaUpbSTJw.text: Good solid food - great and simple greek salads, gyros, passticio and other greek favorites.  Woman who runs the counter is friendly, and all of the food is fresh, with fresh ingredients.  Has a home cooked quality to the food.  Recommended.

eCvNkM1FNbDTR_L2le3_9w.text: best place ever. gerry get to class at the pit vegas!

lW0lvi2Ph45YWTFexT2sZA.text: Thank you Yelpers! Very much enjoyed our meals and the friendly people. Portions are huge and tasty. The night we went there were several tables that had ordered one of the special family meals (looked like a good deal). The baklava seemed especially good (albeit still very sweet). I would definitely recommend this place.

hGKDUmGI9qapQ4TGTKNhUQ.text: The BEST Greek food in the area!!! My husband and I have been dining there since we moved to Henderson over 2 years ago and the food never disappoints! The owners are so friendly and they are always busy, which is a good sign that the food is great! We are huge fans of the Rice Bowls and the daily specials are always fantastic!   Also try the Feta Fries, they are awsome! We dine in or take out at least once a week. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for homemade food that is always fresh and delish! I have sent numerous friends there and they agree that it is the best Greek food they have had. What are you waiting for...go try it!!

ciRGtN1IpqqYYA8afNtOGw.text: My husband and two boys are picky eaters and it hard pleasing all of them. We tried this place for the first time and WOW! The restaurant is very clean and simple, the lady that took our order was very friendly and helpful, portions are huge, and the food is fresh. We got the family meal with 4 great greek gyros, feta fries (I paid $2 more for the feta), and huge Greek salad, 4 drinks, and 4 desserts. It came out to $49 great deal to me for the amount of food. I was surprised how fresh everything was considering we went before closing time. The lamb was wonderful tender and full of flavor, the salad dressing was so good even my 11 year old loved it, and the tzaziki was so delicious and refreshing. The fries was a huge hit with all of us especially my 4 year old son. We have baklava which was good, but a bit stale considering it was sitting for the whole day. The Shamali wasn't to my liking, but it was sitting all day also. I really wanted to try the Yia Yia's rice pudding after reading all of the reviews, but she said they sold out. I will definately frequent this place, recommend it to my friends and brother (another big foodie), and bring my mom (the biggest foodie). I give this place two thumbs up and a double ok!

H9FG8lAqRYCWL5enQIJZeg.text: Everything about this restaurant deserves five stars.  This family deserves all the accolades.  The food, the service, the quality and the cleanliness keep me going back for more.

at-JRMn0ps2tqQsNAybkcw.text: Love this place. The food is great and fantastic customer service. I usually order the gyro plate with side salad and drink. Gyro meat is perfectly cooked and the salad isn't overly drenched with dressing. Highly recommended!

R7qc5ETXs_QeJVpoAsUwaw.text: A great place for a quick take out or eat in lunch. Gyro's are large and tasty. Greek salad is excellent with lots of feta. The spanokopita was reheated in the microwave so was not the crispy phyllo that it should be. Baklava is classic and tasty. Disappointed that there is no moussaka on the menu. Fast service from nice people. Small inside dining area and nice patio as well.

Z2SP0EzTSxjy8V8qNOxVOQ.text: I agree- Finally a good Greek Restaurant on this side of town!! The Gyros were huge, and delicious! The service was was impeccable; very friendly and definitely pride in ownership. The "Family Packs" are a great deal- I can see gyros for dinner once a week...!

4GNOQM_9cExx1lXgVRu3OA.text: great place to grab lunch the salad's good and gryo's are really good as well

INTVfHujwGBjfDeLaEUPmA.text: The food is always good, but our carryout took 30 minute. She needs more help out front. There were 3 people in the back, but how long can it take to get 2 orders of soup and salad?  30 minutes?

aGPxRtTkaB2D_ZAPUYPqUw.text: The Gyro here rivals and or tops any I've ever had. A healthy portion of feta cheese over the top I think is the secret vs the competition. Well worth the $7.50.

zqA7vptIJQ2l8RuAw8B0aQ.text: Best gyro I've had in Vegas (or Henderson). The food does not disappoint. I haven't had anything bad from here. they make the gyro well with good tatziki and perfect gyro meat. Even the side salads are authentically Greek tasting with a kalamata garnish. Worth visiting. The service is usually pretty slow, and it's obviously a family joint, as I always see the mother and son arguing. Other than that, it's a good one!

H9k0BThaEe53CzbbhTKznA.text: The food was OK, but certainly nothing special.  In my opinion, you can get better greek food (gyros) within a few blocks of this restaurant.  The staff also irritated me.  I happened to be the only person in the restaurant while I ate and the staff just stood around and stared at me.  Made the whole experience somewhat uncomfortable.

IrBljg2Sc-q0h5G_yCecTg.text: Uh-mazing!!!!!! Simply the greatest Greek food in town!

Ru9NB6I60loeaK_KIpeUJA.text: Love, love ,love this place. In my humble opinion this is the best greek place in Valley. My husband and I go there almost every week (it's a little ambarrasing ) and so far food quality and service has not change. Just excellent as usual.The name Great Greek speeks for itself! Thank YOU!

yOess-w99ZAXSOr78uaMcA.text: This place is Amazing! And Momma's rice pudding... Good god! Never not get the rice pudding!

NUXTZdNYgXx3_5kBhp29KQ.text: It's a cute little place. Awesome food, awesome service and awesome portions!! The guy behind the register explained what we were getting and he was right on the spot.

8nsTZBNCpOt7CPZOQUFZGA.text: The best Greek joint in town.  Excellent and fresh every time.  Get the rice bowl or the plates, you won't go wrong.

SuSv7wM_rAewRnwsSQbnzw.text: We visited The Great Greek based on a recommendation from a friend a few weeks ago. I am so glad we found this place! My husband loved their gyro and I am in love with their chicken kabob plate and their hummus! Everything tasted very fresh and full of flavor. Although it was very busy and we had to sit outside, the service was great and it was worth the wait. I can't wait to go again! We tried to go last weekend and learned that they are closed on Sundays. Hope to revisit again soon.

no_dPlNd4PS8Vtinr_PYhQ.text: This place never disappoints. Their tzaziki and garden veggie app is amazing, the gyros are huge and delicious,  kid's meals can be made healthy and are always a hit, and the falafel is a really yummy vegetarian option. This restaurant is a True gem.

ZZNDLKhRrKfuCrJl_BHzwA.text: This place is such a GEM! Not only is the service great but the food is excellent!!! The shrimp side with the Greek salad is a perfect lunch and will keep me going back again and again.

XPuGCHeeT47dF5h1ZEAhJw.text: One of my favorite places to eat in all of Henderson, Las Vegas and Summerlin! Been coming here almost 10 years and can't believe I've never written a review. The best! Always super fresh, cooked perfectly, and very friendly service!!!

RREHPMUYpCrx6HQXpta1pg.text: Living in new York City for years I ate at countless greek diners as well as upscale greek restaurants. So I know greek food well. This is real deal. Delicious food and friendly service. I will be back real soon..

hyzJ-umkfIVGM27n00mgbg.text: Went back for some Fetta Fries and Gyro, if i can change my previous 4 start to 5 star i would. Had some Greek some other place and DID NOT COMPARE to the freshness they offer here.

sZ-u0qHZu1tsniUTbGS_gA.text: Who needs a Fat or Mad Greek when you can have a Great Greek. The Great Greek really does hit the nail on the head. What was so great about my meal? Everything, start to finish. It was a completely enjoyable experience.   Dinner with fellow Yelpers, Judd and Lynn L., put this place on my bookmarks and it was about time to pay them a visit. With two other Greek food lovers in toe, we came out to try as much as possible. One Mezze Plate, Two Beef Slouvaki Plates, two fountain drink, one bottled water, Rice Pudding, a Baklava, and two secret Greek Coffees (explanation later on) cost a little under $50. There was even left over after I tried to cram as much in as possible. As I write, I lay in bed in a semi-comatose state.   The Mezze Plate is a combination of vegetarian favorites; spanakopita, two dolmas, hummus, pita bread, tsaziki sauce, and two falafels. The puffed pastry was flaky, buttery, and filled with spinach and cheese. The falafels were crispy on the outside and light inside creating the perfect combination. The Slouvaki Plate boasted the most tender and juicy beef. They were drool worthy at medium rare and the juices oozed into the rice. Taste bud overload! With the second plate there is an option to pick between three different sides; rice, fries, and Greek salad. The gentleman behind the register gave us all salads on top of one rice and one order fries. The guest service is amazingly friendly. We were continuously checked upon during dinner as well.   After our meal, one of my friends pushed me to ask about coffee. It is not listed on the menu, but it could not hurt to ask. The same guy who took our order made a joke that it was on their secret menu and it was no problem to make. Now to desserts! The Rice Pudding is thick and rich. The Baklava had great depth and not too sweet. They are definitely one of the best Greek restaurants in town. On the way out, we even got a warm farewell. Thorough is a good way to describe the service.

4jwsDap60yXNdFeasmYUEQ.text: Delicious fresh food, friendly service and nice indoor and outdoor seating. The lamb/beef gyro is huge and perfectly seasoned. The feta fries are simply delicious. Perfect lunch spot.

ESTyVkvQIEhwaNh3UJEwCA.text: This place is awesome, especially for a quick lunch. Portions are huge food is awesome. Employees are friendly, area is nice and clean. Def recommend for anyone in the area that has a small amount of time for lunch.

b5I8aCTFRz5M67aKbx_tCg.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. Food is fresh, delicious, amazing.  The ladies there are so friendly.  Outdoor patio is so relaxing and nice.  Affordable.  Eat there. Today.

fEMIduHTxRFujOvqxuB2VA.text: The Great Greek is a clean, well established semi-fast food eatery. The owner and workers are extremely professional and very friendly. The food is always prepped with high standards with top notch, hand-selected produce. I usually get either of beef/lamb Gyro, chicken plate, Salmon plate and their feta fries. One of the biggest things here is consistency and quality. A lot of other stores start lowering their quality once they have established their customer base, but i have been coming to this place for the past 2.5 years and they have always been top notch.

7i3l2Q7YK6d6LmFgimu22g.text: Good food! I went with bunch of my classmates after an exam and reunion. I ordered the great greek gyro and it was the best!

fybqnFjb8ptoFIvBrhiMwA.text: I've never tried something I didn't love here. Delicious food, great staff, large portions!

2eGIRdJDxYoXvIOSU64sbg.text: This is a great place. Warm atmosphere, helpful staff, and an establishment that is meticulously clean. I wish I lived here so that I could come back on a regular basis. The baklava is simply to die for. If I could give 10 stars, I would.

gY0Rdwq6VgR06nQhkKEU-g.text: Genuinely Friendly and Courteous People Serving Great Greek Food!  Came here on a whim after looking for nearby establishments that maybe I had yet to visit. Don't know how I missed this place in the past. Arrived on a Saturday night close to closing time and was completely expecting some unhappy folks sorry to see me walk in the door. Much to my pleasant surprise I was genuinely greeted with a very pleasant lady whom I later found out was the owner. Spoke with the owner briefly and felt right at home. AT first glance it's easy to see they have good business sense shown by the fact that no corners were cut. The restaurant s done well, super clean and well kept. Even the business cards and brochures were well done, they even have a well made webpage....sorry but these things matter to me.  On to the more important things, the food! Outstanding food for a decent price. I ordered the Yia Yia Pasticcio, a very tasty pasta caserole with a very tasty Bechamel that is served with a side Greek Salad that eats like a meal itself. Also ordered The Athenian Burger that was topped with Feta and Tzaziki that didn't over power the burger but complemented the meat and allowing it to stand on it's own. Our final dish was the Chicken Santorini Sandwhich. The chicken breast used in this sandwhich does not seem to be of the food distribution variety. The Chicken was very moist and tender and was perfectly matched with  the fresh tomatoes and spinach.  Everything was homemade, fresh and made to order. Absolutely would recomend this place to anyone seeking a nice Greek meal kicked up a few notches.

zLpTN515mvwt_6RCi3WydQ.text: Excellent food. Great atmosphere. Great service. The BEST ice cream. My only negative is that I thought it was a tad over priced but it won't stop me from coming back!

vOBdGSyL5sGdBk46XblYGw.text: Best Gyro in town!!! And the Avgolemono soup is amazing! The soup is a must! And Jack is truly an asset,  he always has a friendly smile, and a heartfelt greeting. He remembers people, and and is genuinely glad to see them again.

9HvQse-O3IF3elT3EDsTpw.text: I have read others responses on yelp and decided to give this restaurant a try.  It is a small restaurant and quite crowded.  The food was nothing short of amazing.  The service was up to par for how busy they were.  You order at a counter and hope to find a table, but they do that as first come first served basis.  I will be happy to eat there again.

Y8o0oaVjAsgXYHR0UT-esQ.text: Food is freaking amazing! Eat here alot but...figuring i only order a small side salad with a lamb skewer cooked medium i thought it would be a fast order to call in. Not the case. I had to call 27 times for no one to answer and went inside and nobody was on the phones at all only taking orders at the counter and someone expoing the orders ready. Then waited 20-25 min for my sm side salad a one skewer.  Bummer

4A5wBCMcidC4sbqoSuKKSw.text: Great food and great customer service. Food is fresh and made to order. Meat is tender and very flavorful. This is my go to place!

uIens2rfgB7y6HappGr5hA.text: We have been here 4 times in 1 week, ya feel me ? Pleasant atmosphere,  good food, daily specials, lots to like. Clean dining room and family run. Hit it up

U1cGivRU-i53vMxVVkJR-A.text: One of my Henderson favs. Great service; awesome food; great specials! Great location! A++++++

uc95GzP_ODEaVmpVey4yeA.text: Checked in to this place based on the reviews and it did not disappoint. Not a spacious sit down affair but the food is delicious. Lamb gyro and Greek salad were both amazing.

-U-BizobPQOKim8qtyfCCw.text: This was quite a surprise! Great authentic Greek food made with quality ingredients.  Staff was very friendly, personable, and professional. Will definitely go back!

cZOBXlBmm9RmSaqJZ7OqlQ.text: Been coming here every other day the last 2 weeks because the food is great! Tonight we ordered for pick up and our order was missing the Pita bread & one of our plates did not come with much meat. We usually don't have issues but bummed out about this missing pita haha.

S2BPDu8QfCCvV-Ff-FLdmg.text: Been going here for years and we love it. Never had a bad dish and the portions are huge. Staff is always friendly. The only place I go for gyros.

bdu3_SXwWQhAAtymWFNDYw.text: I'm waiting for Finese who had just pulled into the parking lot and there's only one available table so I take a seat and I'm looking at the menu... and the server comes up to me and says excuse me you can't sit here you have to get up because you haven't ordered yet. I'm shocked and finese just walked into the door. We get in line and order and the server realizes I'm pregnant  and goes oh now I "kind of" feel bad you should get a free baklava. Long story short I'm super offended and I wouldn't force someone who's pregnant out of a seat and he never got me that free baklava.

-6Ex5fp_EPy9mGaCLS5rNQ.text: The employees are always friendly and helpful. The food is delicious! It gets very crowded at lunch time and there's a wait, however it's worth it.

RePPRhgAIpbfjgGBlTGqSg.text: After coming here on the reg for over a year I thought it was time to write a review. This place never disappoints! So many yummy menu items.. you can't go wrong with anything you order. My favorites are the salad, great greek euro, and the rice bowl. The rice bowl would be my last meal on earth if I had to choose one. Every time I have visitors in town I take them here and they love it just as much as I do. 10/10 would recommend

tolcOngKsEVCkrsBKwSdZw.text: We grabbed food here after leaving the Las Vegas airport. The heat was a startling more-than-100-degrees, so there was no way we were leaving the air conditioned restaurant to eat. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table to open up. The interior of the restaurant itself was pretty cramped. The service was alright - we ordered at the counter, and the staff came around to clear off tables every once in a while. The ambience was very similar to that of a well maintained fast food restaurant.   I ordered the rice bowl with falafel. It was a huge bowl, and the vegetables in it were very fresh. There wasn't as much rice pilaf as I assumed there would be, but they say when you assume, "you make an ass out of u and me." The rice pilaf was slightly salty and it added more flavor to the bowl (which was extremely reminiscent of a salad). The falafel was flavorful, although the middle was a little mushy.   Overall, the bowl was really good, healthy, and filling. I believe it was about $11, which I thought was a fair price. I would definitely recommend this place yes

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Great Greek Rice Bowl&#34; or something like that. It was very filling and also delicious, nice!

nExxZL7Yj6YgeUHq6mIGFg.text: Outstanding Greek fare with super friendly caring service.  Had the Gyro Platter with Rice Pilaf & the Souvlaki Platter with Feta Fries, both with Greek Side Salad.  The Tzaziki Sauce is some of the best we've ever had anywhere.  Henderson is truly fortunate to have such a choice for truly Mediterranean Grill!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef Gyros Combo &amp; Chicken Souvlaki Plate with Greek Salads!

TPVureaULLEo4ZLH_qJbLA.text: Love the food! Love the service! Just don't love that sometimes the wait is so long! I usually get the Greek salad wrap with chicken and it is always so good! I would love to come more often but I don't because the wait for food is usually a bit long but if you're not in a rush, this place is worth the wait!!

LYGvO8iyep4s0PqGVudDWQ.text: Solid local joint for a quick dinner. The gyro meat is really good, not scary and blobby like you sometimes get.  Portions are very generous - one of their rice bowls (comes with veggies and your choice of meat) can easily feed me and the 2 li'l kids. Same goes for the dolmades. I've noticed other places shrinking their portions, some all the way down to 3 in a serving! The Great Greek still offers 6 good-sized dolmades in a serving, and they're delicious. Prices are reasonable, about $10 for the signature rice bowl, similar for a gyro meal with fries and drink. Bonuses for being family-owned and having a nice patio.

8pzNPRIdwyE9UtFoRqIE-A.text: Nothing beats FETA fries and a gyro for a great lunch!!!  Been here numerous times and always greeted as a regular and never disappointed with great food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

AhN8AXzLxOmw4tmMmKNNjA.text: Looking for a delicious place to eat while out of town, I stumbled upon this restaurant. It had great reviews and the photos looked delicious, so I had to give it a shot. Let's just say, I was not disappointed! Not only was the service great and very friendly, but the food lived up to the expectations.  The food was definitely authentic but it was also very fresh. Mediterranean food can lean towards the heavy side, what with all the gyro, tzatziki, and rice, but even with those delicious ingredients it did not weigh me down. I got a Gyro wrap that had fresh lettuce, tomato, tzatziki, and feta, as well as a bowl of rice on the side. My fiance got a "Rice bowl" which is essentially a large salad with a scoop of rice dolloped in the middle, topped with cucumber, tzatziki, tomato, meat and feta. We were both really impressed!   The service was on point; though there were few tables in the restaurant and it wasn't a sit-down restaurant, the staff was very knowledgeable regarding who was sitting where and which group of people got the next table. As someone who has dealt with trying to find an open table in a busy restaurant, this was very refreshing to see! Seriously, the staff was great.   I would definitely go back if I find myself in Henderson again!

KbZI4Y4JHX_G7Fb6Woha7A.text: I love Greek food, it is fresh and bright and just makes you feel good about eating it. Great Greek is this food. The portions are perfect sizes, everything is seasoned beautifully and is so so so delicious! The food is authentic Greek and they are happy and eager to please you and let you try something amazing. What you pay fpr the amount is draw dropping! They give you so much for next to nothing!!! Their feta cheese is tangy with a slight sweet bite and whether it comes on their feta fries, new favorite way to eat french fries fyi, on their Greek side salads, you cannot go wrong. And one of my absolute favorite things is that you leave full, but it ismt a heacy I need to be rolled out of here full, it is a healthy full where you know you ate good food that is good for you!! I gained a new favorite restaurant tonight and am keeping my fingers, eyes, tongue, toes, everything crossed until they bring one of these restaurants to St. George!

sUMlis6V7gpM6R6jY2g9Pg.text: I can be your gyro, baby.  . Went on Saturday 2-6-16 at 12PM and placed a to-go order.  $32.20 got me a greek salad bowl with chicken, a greek salad wrap, and some goodies for my baby boy.  After about thirty minutes and watching many who came in after me receive their food I went to the front counter to see what was going on.  I think they lost my order to be honest but shortly after that they had my food bagged up for me and I was on my way.  They were nice enough to give me a free baklava for the inconvenience.  COOL!  .  $10.95 Greek salad rice bowl comes with your choice of meat (I chose chicken), rice pilaf, lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, kalamata olives, feta cheese, and tzaziki sauce, though I received no tzaziki sauce.  Unfortunately I didn't notice the tzaziki sauce was missing until I was already home.   It was still pretty tasty, however.  The rice was cooked well, the chicken was nice and tender, and the salad was delicious even without any dressing. For some reason there was half an avocado on it which is not on the menu and I didn't ask for it.   .  $7.95 Greek salad wrap comes with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, kalamata olives, feta cheese, tazaziki sauce and is wrapped up in a grilled tortilla.  My husband inhaled it and said it was delicious.   .  I didn't like having to wait so long and they kinda screwed up my order but the food is delicious and they gave me a free baklava...soo.....4 stars I guess.  I definitely want to come back and try the feta fries!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad bowl with chicken and avocado. 2-6-16
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad wrap with chicken.  2-6-16

526R5HSYlDcPm1dZN1N5og.text: Yummy food and friendly staff. My favorite is the Gyro Bowl. It is really busy so we tend to get take out.

ii70WHCDdSpyeSENfHJMmA.text: Love this place! Whether I eat there or get it to go, it's always delicious and fresh. The restaurant is clean and the staff is always friendly! I love supporting local places. My favorite thing to get is the hummus and chicken souvlaki plate. I always want to get dessert, but I'm always too full! Sometime soon I'll get just dessert!! I love Greek food and this place will always be at the top of my list!

0hLvPFh_qkYyg7iIBSI9Ag.text: YUM! YUM! YUM!  The Great Greek has become a regular spot for us. I like the gyro's and their feta fries are amazing. The place is hopping, all. the. time. which could be annoying if you have a large party and want to sit inside; space is limited. That's not an issue for us; we have never had a bad experience or had anyone fuss. The only critique I would give is if you are placing a "to go" order, the feta fries are not as tasty after sitting 10-minutes - they are best ordered and eaten in the restaurant!

VFeOIYz86oLtoDk9XaGM5w.text: We ordered through Grub Hub and received a completely wrong order, and I was hangry about it! Moreso because we got two lamb entrees and I wasn't planning on eating it- I wanted the chicken kabob I'd ordered!!   But the manager (I assume) was very apologetic and refunded us, and at my husband's insistence, I tried the food- & loved it all!   Everything was absolutely delicious, from the lamb to the feta tzatziki in the gyro to the creamy rice pudding!!   Because the manager did the right thing, the food quality was able to stand out and my dinner and the night was saved! We (who do a lot of take out!!) will definitely be regular customers!!!

Uid5kEQYUeeLKbN2McMZXw.text: The food quality was great compared to the other Mediterranean restaurants I've been to. When I ordered the Grilled Steak Souvlaka, the meat was cooked as I requested and rice pilaf was properly prepared. I expected to be overwhelmed by substituting the salad for the feta fries, but I thought it went nicely with the main dish. The portion is worth the price. The place was overall pleasant to eat at with its clean space and nice waiters/employees.

3VNjvwihPknoNt8j0idXFg.text: Always fresh and yummy. Love this place. U can eat outside and enjoy the good weather (:

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

9indIwBV5iAryjk9OJUB1A.text: Best Greek food I've had in a very long time. Can you open one in LA?! Literally went here to order meals just to take home for tomorrow!!

C27_lDconMNfbKU7JljBMw.text: This place has really really delicious food. The place is always busy which is a testament to how good everything is. They service is pretty awesome and always friendly! They recently started opening on Sunday's which is a plus! If you love, like or simply wish to try Greek cuisine then this is the place.

AfWdXY901CDwjjIpYqEb1w.text: now i know why it's called the great because of the quality of the food. first time trying their greek salads. it was delicious. excellent customer service we'll be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. chicken greek salad

GfDIGIxFDXQkCgFx9W_8AA.text: Amazing food and amazing service, I'm from New York and the guys made sure we tried a bit of everything. Quality Greek food for quarter of the price, definitely will be coming back soon.

xTb4YOEfgiPoBuStkmlxeg.text: So fresh, so good!  A great fast Greek restaurant.  Small and busy all the time-that should tell you something!  Come early or go late if you want a table-otherwise take out is the way to go.  Gyro meat is moist and flavorful.  Feta fries are delicious.  Greek bowl with falafel is what I, the creature of habit, always get!    I am a frequent flyer here!!

DnqM8K-pDT87GIV42MkUvg.text: This place BLEW MY MIND. The food and service are both top notch. The staff is friendly, efficient, and takes the time to make you feel truly welcomed. The 4 dip appetizer was the best decision I've made recently. I ordered the steak souvlaki, and I knew it was going to be an amazing dish when they asked how I wanted mr steak cooked. They make their pita in house and it was DELICIOUS. I wish I saved room because their baklava looked to DIE FOR. Do yourself a favor and eat here.

k7IDtrQTZFWE7Uy4mAwmWA.text: Fast food Greek done right.  I enjoy Greek food when I have the chance and while here on business this was right across the street and didn't disappoint. Small seating area but we had no problems getting a table. A lot of their business was "to go" so the restaurant seemed slow, but there was food being carried out continually and they were cranking it out. I got the Australian lamb Souvlaki dinner plate with Feta fries and small salad to start. Too much for for one person but it was so good I couldn't stop eating

JGneALJE7kX7pXzZKt3JTA.text: With so many Mediterranean options, we still drive out of our way for The Great Greek! The food is flavorful and fresh, portions are generous for the price. Our favorite items are the bowls, dolma, and feta fries. Yum!  The family style restaurant is small and cozy, always hoppin' but still attentive service. It's bright with contemporary Mediterranean charm and a pet friendly patio. Wins all around!

FoaPxpT50i_DVEd5FnOd4A.text: Would be zero stars but can't do that! Called my order ahead beforehand because I knew they were closing soon. Lady on phone said 15 mins but when I arrived they said they never got a call but I redialed in front of her and it was her number...all she could say was sorry I have no order. That's bullshit! It was her who took the damn order! Drove in a hurry and a good ways to get here on time and they pull this bullshit. WONT EAT AT THIS IRRESPONSIBLE LOCATION AGAIN!!

Jv62BDGuNAKzqi_qJe67XQ.text: Salmon Mediterranean plate, yes so much yes. I have not been to any other Greek restaurant that has anything similar to this plate. Rice combined with a Greek salad and add salmon, this is what dreams are made of, try it you won't be disappointed. I also love the fact that it can be healthy but you can definitely get something a little more decadent here if you wanted. Not me, this is a Vegas staple for my dining delight.

YXEcPErijkP_NC27iIfwgA.text: Fresh and fairly priced. I ordered the classic Greek salad (small was big!) and added salmon. It was delicious! My husband had the burger and said it was so juicy and yum. We ate here twice while visiting from out of town

uXMjxysvujvrJfSZv0T3xw.text: Note:  This is a somewhat identical write up on my review of my other favorite Greek Restaurant (Meraki on Rainbow).  I like them both equally so I figured they both deserve equal reviews (with just some very slight/minor differences).   I rarely eat out for Greek food as I can prepare them myself but when I crave souvlakia, gyros kai pites during tempelikes meres, they are one of the only two places I go to  (the other one being Meraki on Rainbow which is close to work).  I fly to Greece once a year being a Greek resident,  and as such I can vouch for their food as the closest to the real thing (especially how they season their proteins).  I just wish they would use a tad more greek rigani and for their horiatiki, maybe serve thick feta slices instead of the (I guess Athen's or President brand?) feta crumbles.  But hey, am not complaining, re!   Their prices are reasonable, their menu offering is just about right and the staff are very friendly (I also wish they'd greet and say bye to customers in ellhnika:   "Yasas!!!!" .............. Ti nomizete?).    Bravo, paidia!  Tha se dw syntoma!

Vx-DPb4olxt1Zxf9dI8b2A.text: Top notch cuisine and very friendly service. Everything here tastes very fresh. The rice pilaf is second to none!! Prices are very reasonable for the high quality food they serve!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

GrKjUBPWJmRI3mnLv8YmHw.text: The best food in Henderson by far!!!! Everything on the menu is amazing, just order. The baklava dessert is excellent, lemon soup is great, fries are amazing, and we always get a meat plate.

6lK8OmDeCowgbre_VgEvJQ.text: Amazing food! the Feta fries are chronic. Super nice staff. I am never disappointed with the beef/lamb gyro. *Update- this is now my regular place to go because the food is soo amazing. I always bring my family from out of town and it never disappoints.

7jEH_MF3YjuN_RimcxYQGg.text: This is the best Greek restaurant in town. The salad wrap is the bomb. The staff is really nice too.

rGeI0l0JTFRrw1qqskD9EQ.text: To me this is the best place for Greek food in Vegas. I travel from Summerlin to get food here. It is a little pricey but worth the money and the portions are reasonable. I just wish they were open on Sundays.

ReZIUb60iyMwCV01mbbP1g.text: My family and I go there probably once a month we love this place we've gone probably as many as 15 times I recommend this restaurant. The staff is very friendly the place is clean and the food is great.

HdswztND5w2uLz1b5EH2_g.text: Great food when we don't feel like cooking and it's right around the corner from the house. It appears to be a family-owned place and that always is a plus for me.  We have never been disappointed with the quality of the food or service. Keep up the good work.

-U9IO1HW19P_3tcPLGpeuA.text: Great shish kabob especially their chicken. I never get tired of their food and I'm here even on a Saturday

jlM-0DxraMCGQxEsUdSMmw.text: I couldn't even eat the food, the sewage smell was so bad I gagged!!! I mean how can you not smell it while sitting in here eating

CQzxv_dpaBSf6HAX_tCRDQ.text: Haven't gotten my food yet but there is a line out the door and the vibes are just so good. Everyone who works here is so happy and seems to know every person in here by name. It's bright, clean, and popping. Though I had to wait in line awhile to order, I can already tell it's worth the wait. Great environment!

z6g8x87yne7dTsxYAQzn3Q.text: If you read no further, try the Feta Fries!  Cute and Clean little neighborhood restaurant. Menu is easy to follow and service was pretty good. Even though the manager was visibly stressed due to having to correct the kitchen staff on an order before us, she still greeted us at the register politely and with a smile! Picked our order up to-go and the place was still busy at 7:45pm! The to-go portions are huge, neatly packed, but it would be nice if they had included napkins. I would highly recommend trying the Feta Fries!

BhYKhkeAmgAWFMQmb6CLXw.text: Food was really good. The service was also amazing.  She was very aware of us having 3 kids and helped.  Gyro meat was awesome and hummus tasted fresh

qMMUV0R56EmclbP5caD95A.text: Every time I come here the food is amazing and the service is above and beyond! A great lunch spot or weekday dinner. The outside patio is great when the weather is nice if you can grab one of the four tables.

Q8i02UKlOSiiPCrnCkLCvw.text: I can't rave enough about this place. The food is delicious, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the food. We've had the shrimp and the souvlaki, both were tender, juicy, and delicious. The portions were also great. If you love Greek food, affordable prices, and a great atmosphere I would highly recommend this place.

OVL6OJEg11jliwvoCWqI4w.text: I've only tried the gyro here, but based on that I would return to try other menu items. The flavor was great, but the only thing holding me back from 5 stars was the amount of meat in the sandwich. For me, a gyro isn't top of the line unless you need a fork to eat some overflowing meat first  just in order to hold the sandwich. With this one, all the meat fit too nicely in the pita! Also, they put the tzatziki sauce on the sandwich for you, so if you're someone who doesn't like a lot, make sure you ask for it on the side.

HOzhv0IY8uk4JlBA6GYaWg.text: Dolmades and avgolemono were excellent and authentic.  Baklava is not over sweet with excellent flavor.  You can tell they spend the time to make it right.

-TOOrxD8cN13C_PPxmS3jA.text: Awesome food and really nice owners!  I love everything I have tried here but the Greek fries are my absolute favorite.  The falafel rocks and the gyros are the best in town.  I love it!!!

GIUdc2dgklMhWrhbVezOMw.text: Amazing Greek food. Their Turkish espresso was phenominal. Steak scewers were great as well. Jack was awesome and the whole staff there was great.

DswdGfEnowPUVTlbBQ-GDg.text: The Avgolemono Soup and Greak salad are amazing. I would highly recommend this place.
