Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad w/grilled salmon!

CjgoDWHrpz4u_fp_fuvhDQ.text: Don't let the strip mall frontage fool you, this place is unreal. The best Feta Fries I have ever had and some of the best Gyros in the West. Absolutely amazing food and the service is just as good. I'd take a meal here over most places on the strip.

O_2XGnhK7-1wAfVaHAF0xQ.text: Everything on the menu is amazing.  Seriously.  Uh-may-zing.  The lamb gyro, the spanakopita, the salad, the steak souvlaki, the shamali, for all that is good in the world, come here and try them all!   Seriously.    I cannot express enough how good the food is here.  The rice pilaf, the rice is loose and flavorful and filling.  The spanakopita is fluffy and dense at the same time (yeah, I don't how that happens, but yes, just yes).  The souvlaki, oh, hello super flavorful and rich meatiness on a skewer.  The salad, there is something addictive about the dressing, and I really appreciate the olives having the pit.  The gyro, well, this is how most people judge a Greek place, and I can say that it is flavorful (everything in this place is flavorful, you cannot go wrong), sliced at just the right thickness, and just works so well with the tzaziki, vegetables, and pita.    Oh and the shamali, dense poundcake like with an orange infused in it, a great way to end a meal.   I have only eaten on carryout, so I can't speak for the waitstaff, but the lady at the register, she is such a welcoming and kind person.  She really does make you feel like you are in her kitchen and you're a guest.

3ypfHMllRQvtbgBWaOur6w.text: Delicious Greek food on a small scale. It was definitely authentic and rivaled that of our trips to Santorini, Mykonos, and Athens. Great prices and beers from the Greek islands are available. We had the Lamb Gyro and the sampler plate with Greek salad. Everything was fresh and on par. Definitely will return.

OdVy63K5EfQwrw6Odjx6RA.text: HORRIBLE customer service! First time ever eating here and will definitely be my last. This place was highly recommended by a coworker.   We ordered our food on our way there and let them know we would be on a very limited timeframe but would like to eat there and if that would be okay, they said sure no problem! As we entered it was a little busy so we grabbed a table and before we could even sit down this young girl that works in the front came over and said "you can't sit there you have to order your food first and then you can sit." WTH?  First of all, say "Hello" and greet your customers with a damn smile not your rude attitude. Secondly, we did order our food! Don't go jumping to conclusions and assume things....after all, you know what they say about assumptions. I'd recommend you learn some manners!   With that being said, we did NOT end up staying (I don't think anyone would after being treated so rude)  we ended up just taking our lunch to go.   The only positive thing I can say is, the salad was not too bad. But I'd rather go to a place with amazing customer service that has mediocre food, than a place that has the best damn food and crappy customer service with rude staff, ANY DAY!!!

oTlmXSnIdMFgA6bTlaWjAg.text: You just can't go wrong with the Great Greek. Their food is fresh and delicious. If your looking for traditional Greek food this is the place.   If your going for lunch make sure you get there early. The Great Greek has limited seating and although quick are still packed. They are just that good.   On this visit Joel and I both had the Great Greek Gyro with beef and lamb. We also shared some Feta Fries. Definitely spend the extra fifty cents for the fries. They are crispy, tangy and cheesy. Perfect combo! The Gyro was huge and piled with meat. It also had a generous helping of taziki sauce. I looooved their pita bread. I would be happy just having that and some hummus. Which I can't wait to try next time.  If you have a hankering for some seriously excellent Greek food the Great Greek should be your first stop in Henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro with Feta Fries!!!! Get the fries!

RVYORy96KSxGevnVMt2h3g.text: This little place is so good! The food is amazing and flavorful and the portions are generous. We eat in and order takeout and even though they are always packed, the service is great. Salad dressing is my favorite and the Tzatziki sauce is delish. Gyro meat is tender

WY0z7FDIIS0RG_Q3De9nEw.text: This has become are go to spot for lunch and we keep coming back for the amazing food. The bonus is the customer service is great, such a welcoming enviroment.   Our usual orders consist of:  The Great Greek Bowl with Chicken, other choices are steak, shrimp or Gyro for 10.95 and salmon at MKT price  Traditional Gyro $6.95, make a combo for additional $2.95.  Tzaziki extra pita $3.95  Side of Steak Skewer $3.00  We had pretty much everything and we have liked everything they served us. They also offer daily special like Lamb chops plate or pork chop plate etc all at reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Delicious lunch
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional Gyro $6.95. Combo with drink and side add $2.95. Great deal!
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Rice bowl, so delicious $10.95

t7Xy0hq46zqrFPPxm46gVw.text: This place is AMAZING. The reviews are on point. My friend and I having never been, both got the Great Greek chicken bowl based on the reviews, and we LOVED it. The bowls come with rice pilaf which I normally don't care for, feta cheese, diced tomatoes, garbanzo beans, a little lettuce, cucumbers, olives and 5 pieces of delicious chicken. Everything was tossed in a light lemony dressing. They also give you a cup of really good and flavorful tzatziki sauce on the side. The flavors, I can't even describe how good they were. Everything just melded together perfectly. I have been talking about this dish since I left, and I can't wait to go back and try some other items. My friend and I also split and order of feta fries, which were really yummy. I love to dip the fries into the tzatziki sauce for an added flavor bonus.   This is a family owned business and everyone I encountered was super friendly. The place is small, with maybe 10 or so tables inside, but they do have a few extra tables outside on the patio. I just wish this place were closer to me, I would be here often.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken bowl sooo good

-us29muURTCERk5KkIqzRA.text: Hey Jerry, we found out about the Great Greek through Yelp! We were down at the Galleria and I just did a search on restaurants in the area, Greek food sounded good. I'm glad we went...I have been craving those Feta Fries ever since.  Thanks for taking the time, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled chicken gyro with feta fries, of course...

GXut6p0fsVbhAbIhMnj30Q.text: If you want authentic Greek food prepared by a Greek family, go to The Great Greek. Fresh, high-quality ingredients. Kind & courteous staff. If I could, I would eat here everyday.

vh2_ztjrq8oCbyzNGUokNA.text: Very great food and the customer service is awesome best Greek food in Henderson for sure will come back soon.

jD4YtKIAErFnvI6rGDkaCA.text: My wife and I started going to this place shortly after their opening. The food has always been excellent. The only reason I'm giving a 4 and not a 5 star, is they are always busy and service takes a little longer. The price of being good I guess. They should expand.

bGsR9XF1rDFcGMnSjGzoXw.text: The Skinny:  satisfying meals but the overall execution falls short on a few items(3), service: friendly for such a busy place (4), value: it's okay but nothing I would go out of my way for (3).  Craving some Greek food,  we schlepped it over to Henderson to give the Great Greek a try.   First of all, the joint is completely packed during Saturday lunch hours. It is good that the restaurant has counter service because every table is occupied. At the least, you can place your order while waiting for a table to free up. Luckily turnover for tables is relatively quick and the staff clean the tables promptly. I could also see the restaurant does a brisk takeout business which also bodes well.   We placed a order for a chicken souvlaki plate($11.95),  a gyros traditional sandwich combo (with their soup and a drink; $6.95 sandwich + $2.95 combo price), and a appetizer size hummus ($3.95).   The hummus was pretty delicious although it could have used a nice squeeze of lemon to really round out the flavor. The only thing is that the pita served was a little too soft (although served warm) which made dipping difficult. In addition,  we could have used a bit more pita to use for dipping.   The combo sized avgolemeno (lemon, egg, chicken rice soup) soup was very generous in terms of portion size not to mention filling. I found a tinge too salty for my palate and again it needed a bit more lemon to brighten up the taste. Overall,  the soup was just okay for me and I wouldn't order it again.   The chicken souvlaki plate was also quite generous. Served with a sizable Greek salad,  it comes with 2 skewers,  pita,  tzatziki and a choice of rice or fries.  The chicken souvlaki was a trifle dry and a bit too salty. Flavorless, it didn't have that lemony garlicky oregano punch that I normally associate with a kickass souvlaki. I don't think I would order this again.  The Greek salad was very fresh and the dressing was perfect. I also loved their tzakiki which was quite flavorful. Fries were okay.   The traditional beef/lamp gyros was very large and packed with meat. The spicing of the meat was good however it lacked that last bit of caramelization to make it the perfect sandwich.   Overall,  we were stuffed to the gills after all the things we ordered. Some of the items were great,  others were a pass.  Given our experience,  this joint rates a 3 starred review.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Hummus $3.95
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken souvaki plate with tzakiki, fries and side Greek salad $11.95
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional Gyros $6.95

DUujRQB48MuaCHkGW6B7rQ.text: First time trying today and I feel like they bought their reviews or something because I spent $45 on literally a fear factor episode. Everything smelled so good until I bit into it. I got the garlic shrimp and it had no salt or char no nothing and their rice was bland. My boyfriend got the Greek salad wrap and they still put nasty stank hummus in there and we HATE hummus. And the lady recommended the rice pudding and don't get me started on that because that was the most basic smiths brand rice pudding I ever tasted smh. And the best thing I can say was the pita bread and the baklava was whatever.

BGH92Y339XVdcDH3sqVORQ.text: Excellent food, great service!!! Only complaint is that the place is bursting at the seams! It gets quite busy and it's hard to find a place to sit... but then again that just proves how good the food is! This is my favorite restaurant in Henderson!

7Wx_vz4vMENcD_8GCg8U-Q.text: It's Friday at approximately 5:30pm. The place was packed and there was a line. It went relatively fast tho. Place is clean, and bright and had pretty pictures of Greece on the wall.   I ordered the Greek salad with a skewer of grilled shrimp, for myself. For my daughter, Greek salad Wrap w/Shrimp Combo ( Regular fries and a soda) and to share, an order of Dolmades ( stuffed grape leaves) and an order of baklava.  It was busy, and a bit loud, but none of that stopped the hardworking people behind the counter. They were friendly and knew their stuff. They worked fast, and efficiently getting out orders in great time. Everyone worked like a well oiled machine, no screaming, just head down getting the job done.  Kudos!  I took my order to go, the smell was so enticing I almost wanted to just eat in my car on my way home.  Opening the containers the presentation was 5 star.  Everything looked fresh and appealing, with a spring of parsley for an added touch  The homemade salad dressing was sooo fresh!! I could smell each ingredient in it. Just so yummy!  The shrimp were plump and  were grilled perfectly! Not over done or hard in anyway.   I am not a huge dill fan, and many times I find restaurants over do it when they put it in the tzaziki, not here!! The flavor was exactly what I have been looking for. So refreshing.  The Dolmades were just as good too. I could eat them all day.  Baklava was not the best I have ever had, a little on the drier side, but I did like it A LOT.  I like that they chopped the nuts finer than I'm used to.  My daughter loved her wrap and even the fries they use are really good. Other than the occasion joyous moan of happiness  and a "This is soo bomb"  I don't think we said a word to each other while we ate.  I wanted to devour it, but savor it all at the same time. I would have licked the container clean, but I used the warm, soft pita to sop up the dressing.   The bill was a lil over $30 for 2 people, not too bad for fresh food.   5 stars for food and service. But it is a bit smaller, and a bit too loud, but that might not bother others.   Anyway, TRY it! I can't wait to go back and try every single item on the menu. The menu is a not overly made, you don't have to look through a 100 items to figure what you want. It's easy to read, and will cut down on the time of making a decision. Love that!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Large Greek Salad with skewer  of grilled shrimp and homemade dressing, dolmades, baklava.

_eew6WcgAU1jt9gwYqfG8A.text: This place is "off the hook"!!! The food is very fresh, with large portions. I had the Mediterranean Salad and added gyro meat. It came tossed with a Mediterranean vinaigrette dressing, the standard veggies, a generous portion of feta cheese, and a side of delicious tzatziki sauce with a full serving of pita bread cut into quarters. The salad was perfect. If I could say anything constructive; I wish it came with kalamata olives. I paid about $14.00 with a drink, which is about the going rate these days.I saw the Gyros coming out of the kitchen and they were huge!! If you are coming during the lunch rush, plan on sitting out on the patio in the hot Las Vegas heat or just order "togo" or "pick-up" via their website.(thegreatgrill.com) This place is busy; which is a good sign for the freshest ingredients but not so good for seating. Inside the restaurant, they have four 4 tables that seat four and 4 tables that seat two which means the inside seating capacity is only 24. The patio has 4 tables which seat four each. Rents are high these days not to mention the common area maintenance fee that they have to pay, so I totally understand the small restaurant foot print. The staff is super friendly, efficient and the restaurant is super clean . I highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointing.

cLtDQ9oVCso8Ozv7u3KkHg.text: 4 1/2 stars. The Great Greek looks like a fast food joint but don't let that keep ya from checking them out. There was plenty of parking during the evening and the owners were so friendly.   I ordered the gyros meal, beverage and balklava for dessert. All the food was delish. The salad was fresh and the gyros and rice portion was gererous. I was so full I ended up taking the baklava to go. When I ate the baklava OMG,  It was the best ever. I would come back here just for the baklava!  I looking forward to returning again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyros meal
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Salad included with Gyros meal.

aBP6bRsW7zMIjxH8u8Kp6A.text: The food and service is fabulous. Real Greek food. Will be back again and again. Fabulous food. Great for takeout for special events at home. Everything is YUMMY...

ICQYqSofhx8_Ud73nNadSA.text: Wow, what a not so hidden gem in Henderson. The food is fresh with cool crisp salads and hot, tender and juicy meats. My friend goes apes over the Pita bread and hummus or Tzaziki sauce. The staff are always smiling, very helpful and there to serve . The only drawback is the building is a bit small and there is often a short wait to get a table. But when the food is tasty and fresh it's no problem to wait. Also the new Blue Diamond Hwy location is just as good with a bigger seating area and a nice atmosphere!

jMewtt3aqKBe6sZ-ZVkXeQ.text: AMAZING! Amazing customer service and OUTSTANDING food. (Sometimes there is a wait for tables but seriously doesn't even affect my 5 stars) Their flavors cannot be best. Stop by here. You will NOT be disappointed.

uvSCYRdK0x2S5pez6ESfQA.text: Will have to come back another time to try other plates. Food portions are bigger than I thought and even more delicious. Prices are reasonable but my only regret, I walked away without trying the baklava. I didn't have anymore room in my belly and had to pack up my leftovers (which my dad ate and loved). I'm definitely going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro plate and side Greek salad and a Greek salad with a steak kabob!
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch!

mQIOSdQ-7GT1r9y64NUtYw.text: FAVORITE!!! FAVORITE!!! FAVORITE...Greek place I have ever been to! I have tried many different Greek places to eat from Utah, Phoenix, California and Nevada. I can tell you with 100 percent honesty that this place has beat them all!   The staff here treats you like family and are always welcoming. The Chicken Gyro is so so good! The Feta Cheese that they put on it.. whewww heaven seriously! The side salad is amazing with the cucumber yogurt dressing.. Ohhh and I cannot forget to tell you how delicious their Feta fries are. You have to try those no joke!   I seriously could go on forever about how great this place is! If you are in the mood for some great and I cannot emphasize great enough.. then you need to check out The Great Greek! -eGHM1EUVUuDHkPNOD0-oQ.text: I order from here all the time, either take out or delivery. I love the chicken souvlaki combo with rice and I always order the baklava for dessert. The food is almost always made quickly and cooked properly.

3Ap6W2McoExHDb0_vEKyDg.text: I would give this place ten stars if I could. The owners and staff treat everyone like family, and are always welcoming. It's no wonder there's always a line out the door! We have been going for almost 8 years, and have never been disappointed by the food or service, even when they are slammed busy. The greek salad with gyro is possibly my favorite dish in the world. My husbands mother, who lived in Greece, agrees that this is as authentic and delicious as it gets. Please try the hummus and dolmas as an appetizer! The great Greek bowl with grilled salmon is to die for, and again, the gyro meat is the best I've ever had. If you have a sweet tooth, the baklava will knock your socks off!

s1hb_QuZq21xltJ-7qcq0Q.text: The Great Greek is absolutely awesome!  I like the grilled shrimp plate with rice pilaf and salad.  My husband takes the Great Greek Gyro Combo and loves it.  I recently got all vegan (less the fish) and this place will work it out for you.  They will make your salad with no feta and whatever else you need to fit your personalized diet.  The service is good- very friendly people.  The dining area is small but if you can find a seat it's just fine.  It's really great for takeout.  It's really great food!

The feta fries are too bomb as well, add a lil sriracha to them bad boys. This is definitely a staple of henderson and it's good to see they are doing well and growing.

DGqrLlvLM5M37ZJz8mNmbQ.text: I've hit this joint twice and, yes, it is very, very tasty Greek fast-casual food. But you knew that already from all the five-star reviews, eh?  The menu is a line-up of all the usual suspects: Gyros, salad with Greek dressing, pita tips, feta fries, baklava, souvlaki, falafel, pastitsio. Everything I've had is heavenly.  Parking/access is sort of odd; once off Warm Springs, you have to sort of wiggle your way back to it, behind a Jason's Deli. But it's worth it.  A wee bit more pricey that other similar venues I've experienced. And a bit shy, portion-wise. And from that, my one-star ding. But the quality IS there.  The last couple of months, I've noticed a big banner right out on Warm Springs, manned by several folks reading "Labor Dispute with The Great Greek." I am OK with collective bargaining, in that it's a big part of how things are done here in Vegas. But since I don't see any Culinary 226 references on the signage, I am not sure what these (likely) former at-will employees are protesting exactly. Because their signage really doesn't say.  Anyway, if you are troubled by scabbing across a picket-line (of sorts), you have been forewarned.  UPDATE (from current owner Nick Della Penna, quoting his comment below): "The picketing is from the Carpenters Union due to the construction of our second location on Blue Diamond and Decatur.  Rest assured that the staff at Warm Springs is happy with their working conditions and will take great care of you."  [ NOTE: The Great Greek's original Greek-Armenian founder Jerry Gorumian sold the Henderson venue to Mr. Della Penna in January, 2016. ]

EV1G6o7buQFBgd7_rcULWA.text: Great food and friendly service. Got the Mezze Plate appetizer and the Rice Bowl with Gyro meat. Both were super tasty and portions were plentiful. Would definitely come back again.

mBpuzumIbubd9NT1YeX1rg.text: Came to visit a friend and tried this place out. The gyros are delicious! I highly recommend them. The staff was also very friendly and the place is very clean. I will be returning next time I'm in the area.

kgSO01GNCpnikmC4sDv_cw.text: Loved this place!  We have finally found a Greek restaurant worth raving about.    Looking forward to returning as soon as possible.

Nj2ZtE4PwnISkqvhfs_Gvw.text: I found The Great Greek through searching Yelp. Saw the amazing reviews and thought it should be pretty great if everyone else thinks so!  Pulled up and there's a cool patio area for outside seating. The restaurant was busy both inside and out, although a small space overall.   I told the cashier that it was my first time and asked what they are famous for. He recommended me to get the Gyro and showed me the different plate options. I went with the platter which includes the Gyro, rice or feta fries, a Greek salad and a drink.  I decided on the feta fries because...well, why the hell not!!! :). My total was somewhere around $12.00. I felt it was a great deal for all of the food I was getting!   As I was waiting for my food I asked about the baklava and if it was any good. He said that he would give me a free one as he knows I will be back again after I eat their food.  Hmmmmm...ok!  I'll take the bribe!!!   I waited about 7 minutes for my food, despite the busy restaurant, and I took my food to go. I didn't get to my destination for about 40 minutes so my food didn't look pretty enough for a photo but MAN!!!  Flavors were delicious!!!  Feta fries were somehow still warm and my gyro was just so good!  Their Greek salad was generous and the dressing was awesome. I wish the kalamata olives were pitted, probably my only complaint.   The baklava was amazing!  And honestly it really did seal the deal for me. I will be back to The Great Greek and I'm looking forward to it!  Already recommended the place to several friends. Overall, great food, awesome service, and nice spot. I look forward to dining in next time.

S5BanhtxKaevhyUlTji7tw.text: Best Greek food in town.  I love their chicken souvlaki and dolmades.  I just wish they had a little bit more open seating.

Casual dining, outdoor seating as well. Good prices. Vegan foods available.

hHiAyAOKG4OV-E7-9MxD0Q.text: I wish I was a better review writer so that I could do this place justice.  That being said, I'll try anyway.  The food here is amazing!  The portions are large and everything tastes fresh.  I have had the gyro plate, falafel pita, and feta fries.  The feta fries are really addicting.  I am normally super picky about falafel and usually only like it if it is homemade.  The falafel here is quite possibly the best I have every tasted, it is flavorful and isn't dry (the problem I have with most places).  My mom came here with me and said it's the best baklava she has ever had.  This is definitely my favorite place to eat in Henderson.  The woman that works the counter (the owner?) is super sweet and friendly on top of it all.  I highly recommend this place to anyone.

s5EGiGrfpRO0jKhNwltMIA.text: My quest for a good Greek restaurant in Las Vegas has been a long and arduous journey. I am admittedly quite picky, you see I've had the real thing in Greece and it was so delicious and effortless that I refuse to settle for fake American alternatives. This is definitely the pinnacle of Greek food in Las Vegas!  This cute little mom and pop shop is spotless. The decor is surprisingly simple with a few Greek finishes. They have the typical menu and are very friendly. I got a traditional beef/lamb gyro and made it a combo to include a greek salad and a drink. The greek salad was delicious. I am not a huge fan of olives and onions, so I gave half of the salad to my husband, but I was sure to clean up the huge chunks of cucumber and a good portion of the lettuce and tomato.   The gyro was gigantic! The meat and the tzatziki sauce were delicious and complimented perfectly by the soft pita bread and the tomato, feta, and lettuce. I couldn't have been happier. While it definitely looked impossible to eat the entire thing, it was exactly what I did. I cleaned my plate and stole a few of my husband's feta fries. The feta fries have melted feta and herbs and were pretty good, but I have definitely had better. Unfortunately, for the amount of cheese on them they didn't have much flavor at all, in fact I had to dip them in ketchup which seemed like a real shame. The fries were rather thick, perhaps it would have been executed better with shoe string style fries. Other than that, this place is fantastic! I am so happy to finally have a good Greek restaurant in town to curb my cravings. I will definitely be back!

uskT2k5bHP31ge4AfhhiEQ.text: This is my new favorite local place. Yes, I know Vegas has lots of great restaurants, but this one makes me feel like a nice Greek family invited me over for dinner and served AMAZING food!  I've tried a little bit of everything but my absolute favorite dish is the gyro rice bowl. First of all, it's delicious. The meat is always perfect, the rice is seasoned just right, and the portion is big enough you can squeeze three meals out of it.   I've also had the gyro and chicken pita sandwiches, but to be honest, I go for the rice bowl everytime. Also, the lady who runs the restaurant is always so nice and attentive. I love eating here.

bx6rY_KeUI4-zbi-qc639A.text: Awesome food and very friendly atmosphere.  I had the small Greek salad with chicken. The portion was hearty and the dressing light. The chicken had excellent flavor and was not dry. The hummus is probably the best I've had. I will definitely be back soon.

utGKv2vbaX1h3Q3F_0S9Sw.text: Hands down best Greek food in Las Vegas. I have lived here for over 20 years and have tried almost all the Greek restaurants and this is the best Greek food. UHLtdE9uInPd4uYFDr34MA.text: Really bummed...I wanna like this place but after trying it 4 times now...I can say "meh. i've experienced better."   Maybe they hate me personally or something, but every time I go there they take FOREVER to bring me my food. cnwM0TGNdWWf32fSbka8XA.text: My friend brought me here while I was visiting Las Vegas. I wasn't sure how I felt about Greek Food, but after trying the food here, I am on the lookout for a Greek restaurant around me that can compare and I don't know if i'll be able to find one.  First of all, the service was amazing. The staff was friendly and we received our food in a very timely manor. I tried the Great Greek Gyro and Feta Fries... tRPleSKMOGSNYHMx4Rbcsw.text: This is one of my favorite Greek eateries in the valley. I used to go here frequently when I leaved close by but now that we moved across the valley I can only take advantage whenever I'm in Henderson. They have a delicious Greek rice bowl which is my go to dish here but all the other options are good too. I like the fact that they play Greek/Mediterranean music it gives a good mood should you choose to dine in.

1MZ3RIkFTZtr8HVSkwPNBQ.text: The best place in our area for Greek cuisine we have found.  Very small though, so you may have to wait in line to order.

LwUSZZ1G_lPVYoXl7qw6fw.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a long time, but what finally pushed me to go now was a recommendation for their Avgolemono soup. Greek is one of my favorite cuisines since I grew up with gyros, tzatziki, baklava, etc and it can be tough to please (though I don't consider myself an authority on the matter). Either way, I really enjoyed The Great Greek and I just wish it weren't so far away!  I started with Avgolemono ($3.50), a traditional Greek soup made with simple ingredients - chicken broth, egg, lemon, and rice. I had to try The Great Greek Gyros ($7.95): beef & lamb (the other choice is chicken), lettuce, tomato, red onion, feta cheese, and tzatziki all stuffed into a folded fluffy pita. I also ordered a side of Feta Fries ($3).  Side note: You can add Feta Fries and a fountain drink to your sandwich for $3.45. All other combinations (regular fries, rice pilaf, Avgolemono, or Greek salad) plus the fountain drink is just $2.95. I'm not sure how much a drink costs separately, but this is still a great deal!  Gyro is actually the traditional preparation of meat on the iconic vertical spit, but we associate the name with sandwiches since it is typically served as that. Although not the traditional choice of meat in Greece (it's pork), there is a 50-50 combination of beef and lamb that we have come to love in America (also dubbed gyro meat). At least I love it. It's so good. I don't even care that it doesn't resemble either animal or that it falls apart easily. It's delicious. Good Beef & Lamb: Roasted appropriately with a bit of juice, some crust doesn't hurt (yum), and cut about a centimeter thick.   Although their gyro meat didn't have a crust, it was still delicious. I loved the fresh tomato, onion, lettuce, feta, and refreshing tzatziki. The pita was nice as well. The soup was tasty and they generously served a whole pita with it (cut into four slices). The Feta Fries were good, but not amazing. Either way, fabulous meal and good prices! I will definitely try some of their other Greek specialties next time.

-GMVtU9uNMZ637zkqShzBg.text: Been here several times now. Great service, even though it gets crowded. Still pretty quick. Food is fresh and delicious. Love the gyro, and the skewers. Oh yeah, get the Feta Fries!!!  Yum!  My GF who never liked Greek food loves it here. Regulars now.

Swd1nnaSz-6SjtqI4O1NoA.text: Delicious and FRESH ingredients in all their dishes.  Salmon is delicious and perfectly cooked.  Veggies are crisp and SO fresh.  Love love love this place.  Wish there was more seating and delivery!

_Zo45yFuFCMJkZtO4EvvQw.text: Great experience! We were created by friendly, informative staff. The food arrived quickly. Tasty and flavorful, but the chicken was a bit dry. We suggest trying their cheese fries. Overall, great experience!

y6o8iprg51ZxUtt6A4sYJw.text: This place is sooo good! Im from Arizona, cant find nothing similar to it! Best i ever had!!

QPj_olr9S62vaiZIRXOg3w.text: My favorite Greek food in Vegas. Great service, delicious and fresh food. I love the people who work here and the rice bowls and baklava

Lt-El_-AIKh3JXzIvEmmHQ.text: YES. Let's get this out of the way: I am born and bred in Astoria, Queens, NY (Greek hub of NY). I'm half Greek. I can tell you about Greek food. Being out here, I didn't expect to find such a great place to eat, but I did, and it was awesome.   The Great Greek is a fast-food, very casual style restaurant that seems popular for both dine-in and take-out. With my family of 5 people, some of us were hungrier than others, so we opted for the Meal #2: 2 dips, 8 pita, 8 dolmades (rice stuffed grape leaves), Greek salad, rice pilaf (or french fries if you want), 8 meat skewers, 4 desserts, and 4 drinks. It was the perfect amount of food.  The grape leaves were tender and flavorful, the salad was huge and modestly dressed (I like a ton of feta, so I wish there was a little more), there was more pita bread than we knew what to do with, but that was chewy and served warm. For dips, we chose hummus and tzatziki. Both were creamy and tasty as heck. It tasted, though, like the tzatziki was made with sour cream rather than Greek yogurt. It lacked the pungent tang I expect, so it had a softer flavor but it's a personal preference. The rice pilaf was perfectly cooked and lightly lemony.   The meat skewers! SO GOOD. We got 4 chicken and 4 steak, cooked medium. Dude, the meat was tender as hell, well-seasoned, and surprisingly juicy. It's the kind of food that makes you wish you were hungrier so you could eat more. We were all so stuffed that we ended up taking the dessert to go - baklava. But later that evening with coffee, it was delicious.  It needs mentioning that the service was incredible. Maybe I'm just used to rude New Yorkers, but the staff here was very friendly and accommodating.   Overall worth driving to for the great food and atmosphere. Man, I have some very exciting leftovers.

MDjuvQydvRuTbFoLRHQ9qA.text: Excellent little corner Greek restaurant, authentic with a full menu of Greek specialties. Lamb soulavaki and gyros. Probably the best French fries Ive ever had !  Casual. Little pricey but quality food and generous portions. Best of all..... the best customer service Ive experienced in Las Vegas  thank you fellow behind the register!

rNdmn_omRlRucLQC1TuvKQ.text: They catered a meeting for my local Labor Union and it was a hit. Not even salad left over. The gyro kit was perfect so everyone could build the sandwiches how they like them. Plenty of food for everyone. Everything was fresh and it came with lots of tzatziki. Super nice staff. They even fit my order in at the last minute while already having aa bigher cstering order at the same time. That is awesome customer service. We will be coming back for dinner for our meetings again.

ya5uMDdkCWgsB7fIr3LDVw.text: Hnmmm.I'm iffy on this one. Borderline 3 to 4 stars.  So, it's windy as all hell and is raining around 745pm when we get there. There are still people in and eating. A young girl with dark hair and glasses takes our order, gives us our drink cup, and our number.  We order 2 gyros ...The beef/lamb combo, and of course, I had to try the feta fries.  Our food comes... and it's neither hot, or cold. Maybe this is how greek gyros are..? I'm not sure. The meat wasn't even warm...  While the meat was amazing, melt in your mouth barely had to chew it....The sauce and the feta was out of this world... It really didn't have any texture. The little mess of lettuce/tomato/onion was practically non existent.  I WOULD BATHE IN THE FETA FRIES. The fries were crunchy, warm, and covered, but not drowning in cheese. My guy and I were practically fighting over them, and I had enough self control to not pick at the lonely cheese left behind on the wax paper.  My guy stepped up and went to the bathroom.  That's how I was able to see what I'm about to explain next.  The younger girl with dark hair and glasses that took our order was wiping tables, when a cook from the back got her attention... He made some sort of hand gesture towards her. She stops wiping down tables, goes to the cooler that has the drinks in it by the register, pulls out a beer, and walks down the hallway.  She opens the door directly at the end of the hallway, and hands off the beer....  Drinking on the job.....? Is that why you are serving cold food?  meh. Maybe it's just me. I wouldn't mind eating here again, but I don't think I'll be driving by wishing I was inside.  3.5 Stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

6d0OKMJ6CE1XJKjuDrIeIw.text: When I visited The Great Greek for the first time last week, I was simultaneously irritated and pleased and both for the same reason.  The place was packed.  It is irritating because I hate crowds and I hate waiting.  Pleasing because a crowd like that means this place is doing something right.  Need I say more?  Yes, if I am any sort of worthy Elite ;)  I stood in line for a few minutes to place a take-out order.  I settled upon the Mezze Plate which is Spanikopita (spinach pastry), Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves), Falafel (fried chick pea fritters), tzatziki (cucumber and yoghurt sauce), and hummus (pureed chick pea dip).  This plate also came with a small Greek salad and some pieces of pita bread.  Its kind of a great way to sample a lot of good stuff.  The spanikopita was great.  Super flakey and packed with spinach, one of my personal favorite greens.  The dolmades were good.  They are stuffed with an herbed rice. These appeared to have a ruddy tinge presumably from the herbs and oil used.  Different that what I am used but they were very tastey and I would happily order them again.  The tzatziki sauce was fresh tasting and delicious on both the pita and falafel.  Speaking of falafel, this was probably the best I've had.  It was well seasoned and not at all dry like other examples I've had.  The hummus was good and strong with the taste of garlic and oil.  It made me wish there was more pita to dip in it.  Perhaps my least favorite part of this meal was the Greek salad.  The olives, complete with pits, were great as was the dressing.  But this salad had a particularly strong red onion sliced up in it and the entire salad ended up tasting of onion.  Kind of a turn off for me.  I am picky when it comes to onions and this fell outside of my preferred dose of the root.  Waiting the 15 or so minutes for my food ended up being a sort of treat in itself.  It gave me the opportunity to notice how clean the restaurant was even though every table was being used by some couple, small group or family.  I also took notice of the Greek music playing softly over head.  In those days immediately prior to Christmas, I was feeling overrun by Christmas music.  This was a welcome departure to the seasonal norm even if I understood no words being sung in this ancient language.  I was also able to observe the hard and constant work of this Greek family taking care of who would become extended family simply by walking through the doors.  It was like organized chaos at its finest.

X4tTLFXQxIwGebehwY3egg.text: It is wasn't for the staff I would give it more stars. I was very disappointed by the way we were treated after patiently waiting for our order. It's been about a month (6/14/17) but I cannot get out of my mind how rude the guy at the counter was, and his excuse for reacting the way he did was "I've been here working for over 12hrs". I wish I had taken his name, but at that point I just wanted to get out of there. I was really looking forward to this place but unfortunately that one person ruined the whole experience.  The restaurant needs more tables and maybe add a drive thru.  The Greek salad was my favorite item on the menu.

S-oOOCfkyH8UWIZPXacVRw.text: Wa sadly disappointed. The spanipokita is no longer made with filo  instead they are using a berry gummy puffed pastry and flavorless spinach fill. Ugh. Do not order it. It's not Greek and not good

B_y6XUzmXh1gq43XrokYMA.text: The food is really good . My current favorite is the grilled chicken soulvaki plate,even the side salad it comes with is amazing. Another favorite of mine is  the feta fries .This place is usually pretty busy during lunch and dinner. It's pretty hard to find a place to sit around noon,But the food is so worth it and the staff is amazing!

_Y_f2YHll9QMPeLEmmRGmw.text: My husband and I came here on a whim, and we could not have been more pleased. The food is incredibly fresh, and not to mention absolutely delicious. The salad was delightful. The dressing was perfect, and it had all the yummy crisp veggies you would expect on a Greek salad. The gyros were enormous, and the meat was cooked perfectly.  The hummus was wonderful, and the warm pita was delightful. Don't let me forget about the baklava. Hands down the best I've ever had. I didn't want it to be over. Can't wait to come back! Thank you for such a wonderful dining experience.

pVNv8lKrpBxL-TkL3geLeQ.text: I joke with friends that I could easily eat here every day of the week and not have a problem with it or get sick of it. It is by far the best Greek restaurant in Henderson, and I'd argue it may even be the best in Vegas.   I typically order the chicken bowl but also really enjoy when they have lamb on their specials menu (this changes daily which I appreciate because it means the meat is very fresh). The portion is normally large enough that I have enough for a snack later in the day which makes the somewhat high price (in my opinion) worth it. All of the food here is very light and fresh and is a great pick me up after a long stressful day. The service is always incredibly friendly as well. I definitely go there regularly, and look forward to many more meals there.

PwqB83k09ezTVWrJxsYwBA.text: The Great Greek is a great place for eating with friends. The restaurant may feel a bit cramped when you first walk in, but there's plenty of space for seating. I ordered the gyro plate which came with sliced gyro, pita, and a choice of fries of rice pilaf. The gyro meat is very juicy and flavorful, although if you're watching your sodium intake you may want to pace yourself on the meat. The pita is soft and fresh, and the fries are delicious. Their menu has mostly standard Greek dishes, and my friends always invite me out to eat there. The food is priced in the $10-12 range, but the portions meet expectations.  The staff is very friendly. They would periodically stop by my table to ask if the food was alright and if we'd like anything else. There's no dedicated wait staff, but the service is greatly appreciated.  If you're looking for good Greek food, be sure to check out the Great Greek for a wonderful experience.

O-GHQHodeGI6goskSpp_DA.text: There's been a line at the counter almost all the way to the door since we got here. After my Great Greek Gyro with feta fries, I understand why. Will definitely come back!

4fxH9SIJNVpEcMsOqj0acA.text: Great little Greek place! We are visiting from San Diego and found this little gem. Service was amazing and food was right in point. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

CypkujnQyyJwPrmn0ICgMw.text: I have eaten there a few times and it was good average Greek food. If you have been to Greece, you know what I mean. Today I ate there and they surfed me and my kids warmed up and greasy Gyros. It looked like it was cut a few hours back and it was way too long on the grill afterwards. After telling the girl, she said sorry and ran off, never came back.  Don't ask the question if you may not like the answer, daaaah!  We all had a funny stomach all night and I was upset about their behavior. The food was yucky and the service was silly. Running off and not doing anything about it. $66 bucks out the window ...  I am gonna find a better place. Bummer ...

I used to live in Pahrump, now Summerlin & I still make the commute whenever I'm craving something Greek. I have not one complaint. The staff is amazing and always so welcoming. It is a small cozy business, but plenty of seating outside if you have a larger group. :)

UpdePC52ZlFWXbhjtJIcvA.text: I don't hand out 5 stars lightly, but this place earns it. My wife and I just returned from Greece and were craving authentic Greek food. This is the place to go. It's the same stuff you get over there. Prices are fair, portions are generous, staff is friendly and efficient. It's a very casual place, but nice and clean and has a nice outdoor eating area. We got gyros. I've had their kebab before and my wife loves their greek salad. We got a small appetizer -- tzatziki -- their pita is great. There was a decent sized line (no surprise since it's so good), but we didn't wait long. We'll be back very soon. In fact, I almost ordered a second gyro just because it was so good!

DGSHcnlA1UJgOcqURowiLg.text: Good quality of good, prices are pretty good.  Had a really solid gyro, fresh pita, lots of lamb.  Saw several other great looking dishes come out of the kitchen that I might try next time I am over here.

I go every other week for work, and I will literally risk missing my flight to make sure I get my great Greek fix! Best salmon salad of my life! Shrimp skewers are awesome, I'm never disappointed here. I'm obsessed.

YC88enoqkPnQjGYY8qDDCw.text: So impressed!  Food is incredible.  Service is just as great!  Am devouring the Great Greek Rice Bowl with chicken as I type this.  Will definitely be back!!

Q8bn2dTpu8mCbdvl949AZg.text: My co-worker recommended this place when he was training me on the job, I had only had Daphne's in so cal and had never really had Greek food. I was amazed at how good the beef lamb gyro was. Food is very fresh and the service is well above par. I feel like I am in Greece enjoying a great atmosphere and some good food while on my boat. I have been back several times and will continue to go back.   I highly recommend the feta fries they are very good. The baklava is also amazing.

CiuXVGepiz7lDRjXoCSpLw.text: 200+ Yelpers certainly have the right idea about this place.  After spending the day hiking in the Grand Canyon, everything about this place hit the spot.  My party ordered a few different wraps, a rice bowl, a couple salads, and a rice plate.  The base ingredients had flavor beyond what you'd get from your grocery store produce, and that flavor was enhanced by the best yogurt sauce I have had in all my trips to Greek restaurants.  For my own dish, the gyro woke up your taste buds when it hit your tongue.  In short, the Great Greek has a commitment to both price and flavor, something that's not nearly as commonplace as it used to be.

55uJNfAjWDrLak4UqtVGwg.text: Brought my family here for first time.  Recently moved from San Diego.  The slightly higher priced menu was absolutely worth the quality of the food and the quantity; there is no short changing.  The shrimp were tender and flavorful on the salad.  The gyro was jam packed and the meat popped.  The gentleman running the cash bay was spot on and actually made me feel like they were happy to see us.  Would eat here again and was added into the retinue of restaurants in Henderson.  Super happy.  Pretty fast service also which was surprising for how large an order.

nhAM7F3W4kgqAnng8w_WPw.text: Wow...great food! The place was full and had a line of people waiting. I ordered the Great Greek Gyro with lamb and Feta fries. The lamb had great flavor and was not dry and the feta fries were great. Definitely will be back!

The owner is a pleasure to talk with and the restaurant is so very personal and pleasurable. The food is outstanding. The baklava is mouthwatering and excellent. I had the shrimp souvlaki with tzatzaki sauce and had to take half home! Don't miss out on this gem.

gpiAquIKNv75I8BDGXwqsg.text: Great food, amazing service!  First time dining here with my boyfriend and they've definitely earned our business. The entire experience was great! Service was very friendly and accommodating. I didn't get the name of our cashier (he sort of looks like Tom Haverford from Parks & Rec), but he made our entire experience very positive and inviting. He had a really friendly and enthusiastic personality that contagiously stuck with us and made our entire experience great. We chose to sit outside the front patio since the weather was really nice.  I ordered the Lamb Souvlaki with Feta Fries and my bf got the Jumbo Shrimp rice bowl. The salad that came with my meal was very light and refreshing. Our food came out shortly after, and our server apologized to us about the wait and gave us complimentary baklava to take home which was unexpected, but very sweet. We personally didn't mind the wait nor did we think too much about it. Our food came out in around 15 minutes after ordering (there was a few people ahead of us also). If that was a long wait, then I wonder how quick they usually bring out food. Back to the food, we loved everything we ordered and the portions are pretty generous. I definitely recommend trying the feta fries, the fries are SO GOOD and crispy! My lamb was slightly over cooked (I wanted Medium), but was still delicious. Shrimp was very large and juicy. In general, Mediterranean food is very light, so not too much to write home about, but it was enjoyable and delicious. If you have the extra stomach, try the baklava as well for dessert. I recommend eating it with vanilla ice cream, it's sort of like a flaky puff pastry with honey and sliced almonds(?) - extremely sweet imo, but vanilla ice cream helps tone it down a bit.  I've worked in the restaurant industry for years so I tend to help tidy up and organise my dirty dishes to make clean up easier for the workers, but one of the cashiers quickly came out and helped me take away the dishes since I think she noticed me doing it. +1 for attentiveness  As it goes- come for the food, stay for the people. Halfway through eating, my boyfriend is already talking about when we should go back. We will definitely be coming back frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Top: Jumbo Shrimp Rice Bowl, Bottom: Grilled Lamb Souvlaki Plate w/ Feta Fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Lamb Souvlaki Plate w/ Feta Fries (Salad not pictured)

wJreT4R6IaN_gR_8Yg1tYw.text: This is our favorite Greek restaurant. Their prices are very reasonable, the food is always delicious. The chicken k-bob with rice and a salad is my favorite.

O-RMO0cV9xPrB1Ovz03ZyQ.text: This is like a little neighborhood treasure. It was packed and the amount of "to go" food that was going out the door tells you this place is worth it. Fresh and quality Greek food is hard to find but this place has it nailed.

qzqTn6l36YXuHk4wJc0Mfg.text: Love the flavors of their foods. Girlfriends and I like to go here after a workout. Their gyro, shrimp skewers and chicken souvlaki are our favorites!

W4KaRip8_O3UFgth_x8RXg.text: We order take out from here at least once or twice a month, and the quality is always outstanding. The mezze plate is a fantastic deal, and that plus a side of their tasty gyro meat is enough to feed 4 of us.

gemS4oIz39EAoqobwbvEmA.text: One of the best Greek and Mediterranean places in Vegas by far. Ran across this place while losing my paycheck at Sunset Station.  Tucked away in a parking lot, it's a little hard to see or find unless you're really looking for it. There is plenty of parking at theres always a slight line and wait around dinner time. They have about 8 tables inside so it's better to order ahead and pick up.  The food here is well above average. The meat is extremely fresh and all the items on the menu are pretty authentic as far as taste.  Decided to try the lamb kebobs. 2 skewers of marinated lamb chunks, not the ground stuff, served with either rice of fries or for an up charge you can Greek fries, fries with feta. The lamb was succulent and tender. Seasoned perfectly and very juicy. The rice is to die for! Rich buttery taste and seasoned to perfection! They also give you a side salad! Whole combo is a 5/5!  Then we tried the beef kebobs. Didn't do the ground but the chunks as well. Try not to go past a medium when ordering. Smaller pieces tend to dry out. The perfect flavor combination on these skewers!  For dessert try the Greek cookies. Their take on sugar cookies leaves you wanting more and feeling like you were cheated as a child for never having these introduced to you!!  Only gripe is they tend to be temperamental at times. We've had amazing service and then we've had just ok service, all by the same people. But don't let that discourage you! Food is phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek Small Greek Salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Check skewers with rice
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb skewer plate with feta fries

aUMPoNxI05g3kbI3vf-6_g.text: One of the better Greek/Kabob places on this side of town. Everyone is always friendly. Place is always clean and they are working FAST to get you your order.  Their lamb gyro is good and on par with most other gyros I've had. Their fries are normal fries. Nothing super special. I'm used to krinkle cut(which I love) fries at Greek places usually, though. The salad was super fresh, but needed a little more dressing (maybe on the side, as not everyone would agree with me).   All in all, I am here once or twice a month cuz I live in the area, but I wouldn't drive across town for it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro Plate with fries and part of a large Greek salad. Salad was fresh and tasty (although, I like a little more dressing).

gOokctd7KJh9yEmPqAxWkQ.text: We had to find a new Greek restaurant when we moved last month to this side of town.  WE FOUND IT!!  Excellent food, very good prices, friendly and courteous staff and very clean.  So happy to have discovered the best Gyro ever!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. This is the Great Greek Gyro - I want to tell them to change the name.  It is The Most Excellent Greek Gyro!

c4WX_4hLkcA-aI-26SA_Tg.text: Hubby and I went here last Sunday for dinner and I must admit that I may have had way too high of expectations....  We got here at 6:50, and the place closes at 7. We felt like douches but we totally didn't realize that their Sunday hours were earlier.... anywho we planned to get our food to go anyways and staff didn't really seem like it was an issue.  I ordered the shrimp salad bowl and hubby ordered the lamb gyro with feta fries.  Luckily I checked the bag because they almost sent me out the door without any sauce for my bowl.... smh. The guy threw in an "extra" for this near miss, but to me you should automatically get two containers anyways- they were both tiny compared to the salad size *cue eye roll*  When we got home, keep in mind we're 5 minutes down the street, I was surprised that the shrimp were basically cold. Maybe that's how it's supposed to be, but I thought they were supposed to be fresh grilled?! They didn't have any olives in the salad, about 3 bites of rice, feta was barely there.... nothing like the yelp photos.  The same for his gyro- looked nothing like the photos- sauce was super light and so was the feta cheese....   This place isn't cheap, and I have no problem paying for a great meal, but this felt really basic and just blah.... hubby did say his gyro was good, but keep in mind I also had to share my sauce with him because his gyro just didn't have enough fml. I resorted to Caesar dressing instead..... don't know if I'd come back or not....

nrrCy4iV3ae3JMDw4A93MQ.text: Consistently great Greek food, Wonderful service, Eve ( spelled Ive) always greets you with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. A special rack of lamb, Greek fries, steamed veggies, you can&#39;t go wrong with any plate

J7Oa1cCUlfYLDuSHYPwumg.text: My husband is Greek, we love this place. It's our go to for True authentic Greek dishes. You can't go wrong coming here. The food is top notch & fresh. The location is perfect. Has indoor & outdoor seating. Clean, great vibe & the staff is amazing.

8mlZrjVW3gF6kw-up17NVg.text: The most amazing food!  The lemon soup is always my go to and the dolmades are always fresh. The space inside is small but they do a good job of helping you to get seated and keep people from saving tables if they haven't ordered yet. I make sure to bring my friends here when they come to visit.

2KKP5vyzcRtZJ55IT-WjBw.text: We had to grab something fast before softball, but I did not want fast food.  My wife suggested Greek and we stumbled upon this place.  The Gyro was the best I've had in a very long time.  It was loaded with meat and the tzatziki was delicious!  Veggies were fresh and crunchy and amazing!  I will definitely be eating here again.

They have an amazing Greek soup, made with chicken, rice and lemon, you gotta try it, definitely one of my favorites.  There pita and hummus is super yummy!  Prices are very reasonably and everything my family and I have ordered has been delicious!  There isn't a lot of sitting, so be sure not to go during lunch time.  They do have some extra seating outside, but on hot days, it's not the best place to sit.  You won't be disappointed!

qAqwKDD2qdJ5yB1Z0w5yDg.text: Excellent!  Ordered soup, Greek salad wrap with chicken and great Greek gyro with feta fries.  Staff is friendly. Very clean. Can't wait until next time to try the lamb burger and the rest of the menu!

u50MzcLzeeYP7lI9Wf2jEg.text: I lalalove this place, the Greek food here makes me so happy and my taste buds delighted. The customer service is pretty great too.

lkmiVXGrrUpXJdmsmbFVNw.text: Love the food here. They offer a great selection. Started coming here when I was in school and still come to get my fave Greek food cravings satisfied.

Tve6otInb9nAbB-adD6i4Q.text: Best Greek food around! It was amazing. All the flavors were there and the service was great! I highly recommend you give this place a shot. If I lived near by I would be here every week. My wife and I both ordered gyros with the feta fries. Delicious!

m9XQ2aNnOjtcdSnS4RjLaw.text: This is as good as it gets. My husband and I have loved this place since we first arrived in Las Vegas two years ago. I would drive across town for this restaurant, but lucky for me it's around the corner from home. They are awesome in food and service.  We've had a variety of items from the menu and everything is very tasty. My favorite pick is the steak souvlaki plate. There is more than enough food with this dish. It comes with two skewers of tasty steak, a salad, pita, and the choice of rice or fries. I typically choose feta fries because they are crazy delicious. My husband is a fan of the gyro. Another one of my favorites is the pasticcio. You can't really go wrong with their food since everything I've had has been delicious.

VA0Fjo4exdRV09EJlgHBwA.text: I'm addicted to the lamb rice bowl. The food is great and people friendly. Being as clean and organized as it is says alot on its own. Employees always happy and manager keeps plates spinning like a pro. We are regulars for a reason.

b8c2iWrzJ4W-20AGjwebWQ.text: Best feta fries ever. They melt the feta on top. Their meat is delicious as a matter of fact everything I'm tasted Devine. Must come here.

g3WJAkw5kL7yMAO5ZPCxAQ.text: We found this place on Trip Advisor as a top 10 places to eat in Henderson, and it was spot on! The food was fresh, fast, and delicious. I suggested to the manager on duty that they should look to franchise out to AZ, so fingers crossed The Great Greek makes it to Peoria, Arizona. We will definitely be back next time we visit Las Vegas!

uMRtLPvreuPCZ8CqNd_Nzg.text: The food had good flavor but my chicken kebabs were so dry I could hardly chew them :(

YqQKXEbgJMkxAnecpYOI4w.text: When you're in the mood for a gyro this is the place. There really good and the size will fill you. The price is the norm about $11.00. Good service. The sides are good too.

BDxOHpVwtH5DDi7JO8sRdg.text: Today was the first time I visited the Great Greek and I am pleasantly suprised with the food, although it's a little small dining area I did not mind due to the fresh tasting delicious food.

Apm_sV4rJHUy2L8CH6Q0tA.text: Good food, but very limited indoor seating, which was a must since it was winter, and yes, it does get cold in the desert at night!

nXTuomtLunsboTFDNMWGpw.text: This is my favorite Greek food in town and actually ever! Everything I've eaten there is delicious! I love falafel but, often find them dry at other places I've tried . At the great Greek they are always soft, fluffy and full of favor! The service is always fast and incredibly friendly even when they are really busy.  The Tirokafteri is a must try , trust me! Also I love that you can get cucumbers instead of pita which I awesome when I'm trying to cut the cards.

7WMO3XoBCpZzeNApfZgimw.text: OMG this place is heaven. The traditional gyro with the feta fries is so good and my girlfriend had the Falafel pita with the feta fries it was so delicious it should be illegal for reals. Its very busy during lunch and dinner but believe me its worth the wait. The staff is friendly which is a plus.  The Great Greek just earned 2 forever customers. I will tell my friends and family about this awesome slice of Greece.

eFWqN4Hq8lITIJPtFoFg3w.text: The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill is a small take out place with a few tables inside and a few outside.  The service was fast and friendly.  I ordered the Mezze Plate for $12 it included spanakopita, 2 dolmades, 2 small falafels, 4 pita triangles and small dipping cups of hummus and tzatziki.  The food was very good.  My only problem was that the spanakopita was made with puff pastry instead of the traditional phyllo but it was still very good.  The value for your dollar isn't great but the food is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Mezze Plate $12

xvlKhlU3l8mEMjrxYFbWNA.text: This is my second time in the area and this place is 100% worth a repeat visit. Let's face it, there are tons of places to eat in the area, but I felt I would be disappointed if I didn't come here!   The staff are super friendly and it's very clean inside. The menu is simple and easy to navigate. You order at the counter and they deliver the fresh meal to your table.   They sell wine & beer but I came for the  Avgolemono Soup $3.50, Classic Greek side salad with falafel $7.50.  Fountain drink= $13!  Did I mention how nice the staff is? Everyone here seems to enjoy their job and takes pride in their food.

vG3F27F2jO_v24qnQG5q9w.text: Salad looked fresh, but they don't know how to cook meat. The food at this restaurant is all rushed.

yb_pa3OsRG9Rez3RFRQGQw.text: Wow wow wow.   This place is great.   Clean dining area great service and Super Great food.  I would strongly recommend this to anybody looking for a great lunch or dinner

PVsqQ4jhxa6-BGY2XvBV8Q.text: 3.5 stars   Kind of hard to access their parking lot if you're not familiar.   Came during lunch on a Friday, it seemed busy but not too busy. There's indoor and outdoor seating available. You order up front and your food is brought to your table. The line to order moved fairly quickly and we got our food in less than 10 minutes.   We ordered two lamb/beef gyro combos (side & drink) with feta fries ($.50 extra) for about $25. The gyros had lettuce, tomato, red onion, tzatziki sauce, and feta cheese... A LOT of feta cheese. The gyro meat was moist and had good flavor. It was also sliced thicker than I'm used to. The gyros also came with a couple of small pepperoncini peppers.  The feta fries were tasty; battered fries covered in feta and another white cheese (mozzarella?). They were pretty garlicky as well. I wasn't even able to put a dent in the pile of fries as the gyro had me stuffed.   The food was solid, but nothing absolutely amazing. That being said, I would come back if I was in the area or if a companion wanted to go.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb/beef gyro &amp; feta fries

JvhYv7kbRfxXwJG9Q-95Aw.text: Ive now gotten take-out here a few times and ordered meals for multiple people at work. And I have to say they have exceeded my expectations both times. The food is delicious and the stuff is fantastic! Thanks again honey bunches!

f1DBEQNDDprTsMXggEVGJA.text: I have been going to this place for a few years now and it is a consistent and always a 5 star experience. It is setup as a fast food place but the quality of the dishes is of a home made meal. I have had every single item on the menu... Yup every item. My favorite is the beef shish kebob. It is hard to get good lamb in the US so naturally the beef one is better. If you like feta cheese I recommend upgrading your side of fries to feta fries. The place gets busy around lunch time so do not expect to get there and be out in 5min. Good food takes time and the key is having everything made upon order and not a month prior... One overlooked item is Yia yia's Pastitsio and it is amazing!!!

phvBUJfNpBbAXnRRpDm8Qg.text: We had the gyro after a day of golfing and the feta fries with a shrimp plate and it was absolutely to die for.

nWjYhjAC7aB7QXKykBaB8Q.text: Excellent food! Mix up on our order, but overall extremely pleased with taste and authenticity of food and customer service. Will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas.

9b7oSViDNhsSkqAYhayqhQ.text: I searched Yelp looking for Greek, this popped up and was near. Good decor and food. The staff was pleasant and place was clean. Was a nice small quality restaurant. Will be back  If in town you should try this place.

7T_ai2sC5B4XdrYvm8p6EQ.text: This place should be renamed "cucumber heaven" in my opinion lol. I haven't had this type of food before so when I saw a lot of things with cucumber and tzaziki onthe menu I knew my order would be customised. The lady who took my order seemed friendly but she might need a q-tip because my order was eff-ed up. I ordered the Athenian Burger and when the lady said it had the tomatoes, salad, and cheese would all be mixed together in tzaziki I told her to leave all of that salad stuff off and just put feta cheese on my burger. The wait for my burger was long and that was okay but when you bring me a burger that is obviously a frozen patty and put the salad on it that I asked you to leave off something is wrong. I did say something but it would have been a 15 minute wait for a new burger so I just said I would take the salad mixture off of my burger and deal with it. The burger was terrible. Then I tried the Feta Fries that I ordered and hot damn they were good! The fries were great but the gross burger and my lack of taste for cucumbers will not bring me back here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Patio with tables to eat outside
