EdmyzPQ2xI6ShKlKT3qUrw.text: I crave greek food every now and then. I'm so glad this place is right in front of my house. My favorite is the really warm pita bread with hummus!! I can eat pita bread everyday. :)

Q4kEWxzJIBRDyaNhdvsxTA.text: I discovered the Great Greek about 3 months ago and have been back every week since.  Easily the best Greek food I have found in Las Vegas, and possibly even the US.  Every dish is outstanding, and the specials are always great as well. 4 to 5 star presentation and taste and 2 star prices.  Definitely a must go.

dEbrbgwx55QLCpnwa3QHsw.text: Amazing Always. Try to stop here every time while driving through Vegas. Family was looking for a place with real food on a road trip and we love Greek food. Very happy to find these guys and they never disappoint. Staff is so friendly. Now I just need to make it for the special days of pork chops and lamb chops.

36t9XsZ6Z_Y3_DocGZ1n1g.text: Really tasty gyro meat, most places make it so greasy but this was fresh and tender, soft pita bread and a great Greek salad , would go back :)

pLsH8BVVC0OeJqJIHSb3gA.text: Great find!! This is a perfect spot for a quick and tasty meal.  Don't let the fact it's in a strip mall keep you from trying this jewel of a restaurant.  The food is great and the staff is very friendly.

H3udU6Bu8wZehMDHIDB7Xw.text: This is easily my favorite Greek restaurant. Their gyros are amazing and their feta fries are way too good! The only downside is the seating. They have a maximum occupancy of 35 inside, plus a few tables outside. More often than not you have to fight for a table if you plan on dining in.

5_MQdqtfr-AaVMDkdIKuBA.text: It's a good place.  I've been there about 6-7 times for lunch.  I always get the Gyro and feta fries, so I'm probably a relatively terrible food critic.  I do like the friendly staff and fresh ingredients.  One of these days I'll try something else.

tpoCPo7-kBZEyoEdSp5qaA.text: This place is wonderful! We came on a weekend afternoon for lunch and it was packed! The family is authentic and friendly. You can tell they care about their customers and food. The gyro was delicious and so were the fries. This is our new gyro place in town.

UNiV1bMp4EvZDJGes0UENw.text: Great gyros, nice portion and full of flavor. Plates come with good portion of rice and salad. All of it's was great, would definitely return!

HCZkZmW95TOYfgbMbsUf_w.text: Ordered takeout, The food was very flavorful. Ordered fries w/ feta but they forgot the feta, but that's ok bc the fries were hot and crispy.  Will definitely be back.

K6N4xpx32IMDOxJ5gNyavg.text: Ate there twice while visiting Las Vegas. Excellent service, great food, and generous portions, will definitely return when we are in the area.

2nEX2mlYJ-WQCWsyOMdiVA.text: We are visiting from out of town and stumbled upon this place.  The staff is amazing as well as the food!   We had the humus,  geek salad wrap, feta fries and baklava.   They were all out of this world! We are in town 1 more day and are considering coming back. It is a little pricey but well with EVERY dollar.

JfFkAZz7tspueTuBjvAo7Q.text: I guess GREAT sounds better than FAIR Greek Grill, but that's what it is, fair compared to the Greek in Houston, Chicago, Denver, etc.  The Gyros were flavorful but dry and some pieces slightly crunchy.  The salad wasn't very Greek: a sprinkle of Feta and 2 kalamata olives drenched in a way-too-oily dressing? Come on.  The tzatziki only tasted of yogurt, no other flavors, so thank goodness they had Sriracha.  Fries were standard.  The pita was good.  I didn't get Baklava because it wasn't shiny as all other Baklava I've eaten has been.  The woman at the counter seemed bothered by me despite my 20% tip paying at the counter.  She didn't even give me a water cup.  She just wanted to chat with a couple of regulars.  If you don't know Greek, it'll be bomb.  If you do...this place will disappoint.

6Qkd6Vof6qLXhkWjhoMSGg.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about this place but I can honestly say the best part of the food was the pita my gyro meat was cold and the fries were not seasoned. The chicken souvlaki was okay but tasted like it was old. The salad was just plain with some feta cheese and dressing plus this was kinda expensive. You do get a lot of food for the price but you won't eat most of it

W5xLyjGhZ7x0YTfWKRh33A.text: The Great Greek offers up so much flavor, that Flavor Town has a new capital building.  HANDS DOWN, the best fries in this whole town... Feta Fries. FETA TO THE DOME! The Pita is warm and fresh, the Chicken and Gyro are delicious.  The Salad portions are perfect.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  You will most likely have to wait to find a table, as this place is on the small side, and the secret is out, but defintely worth the visit.

c0IWKdNJiUs1aT5YbLEU1A.text: So good. Been there a bunch of times and Everything that I've ordered from here tasted awesome! I do however wanna try their desserts, they looks delicious but I'm usually too full to try them.

DqutQav4XPlVXn6_ECQnvA.text: If you are in Henderson and want a great Greek meal you need to go here. I love a good pita and that sauce I cannot spell. The folks here are super friendly and will also give you a soda while you wait. Price wise it is affordable and filling. Good portions and great staff. Go here if you have not been. It can get busy so be patient. Not a large space but they have outdoor seating if needed.

bmTjKfGmJ5qIlIkrtFN5CQ.text: Starving, famished, desperate, and craving some Greek food, I stumbled upon The Great Greek and was so please with their delectable fresh offerings. I ordered the Chicken Souvlaki plate with rice. Bascially it's grilled chicked skewers over a bed a rice. It comes with two slices of pita bread and a small greek side salad. With a small drink the whole meal cost maybe $13 which is a little pricey for lunch, but it was defintiely worth it. The chicken was so tender and juicy and the biggest suprise to me was the rice. Usually at most restaurants they just throw some rice on the plate so it looks like you got a lot of food, but oh no, I feel in love with this rice. For some reason the rice had a hint of a lemon flavor and it was just really delicious and comforting. I could have just eaten that rice by itself.   So enough of me gushing about the rice.. but bottom line.. if you're looking for some fresh Greek cooking, come try The Great Greek. You won't be disappointed!

xqZaqhc71EbAC2BBkBABeA.text: Only 4 stars because they are a bit pricey. But other than that....let me tell you about the extreme measures I would go for just a drop of the lemon rice soup. It has such a fabulous taste! Get extra pita bread with it and make it a meal. Dip it until the last bit is gone. The hummus is pretty good, too.

YXFgAUoO4QlBEbG7He46bA.text: I just love this place - it is like coming to see family here.  Food is great, and how I love all things Greek (I am a complete Malakas when it comes to Greek and Greek Traditions).  Best Dolmas in town, and the Pastitsio always makes my day).  Opa ela ethw tora fella arsenoko!!!

fk-QwB7XaeZpxBFcYOIcLg.text: I've had my fair share of Greek food and this place was great.  I had the Gyro plate and it was too much to eat in one sitting.  My wife enjoyed the Chicken Souvlaki and the kids had chicken skewers.  Nobody left the place hungry.  Get there early though because the restaurant isn't very big but it was packed at 6PM on a Tuesday.  We ordered some baklava to go for later that night and it was awesome.  I really like baklava but am often disappointed at restaurants because the phyllo is soft and mushy because it has been sitting around too long.  The phyllo in this baklava was light and crisp and the filling was so sweet, even maybe too sweet if that's possible.  If you are looking for good food in Henderson you can't go wrong with The Great Greek.

seLamk-vfnGEepQKkB5kkw.text: On our way to San Diego we stopped for the night in Henderson, NV. A group of 10 of us were lookin for some inexpensive dinner so I hit up yelp. While it was a bit difficult to find even with a GPS, we eventually found it and were not disappointed.   The woman behind the counter was a jovial Greek woman and another Greek man (son I presumed) was running around helping. She expalined the menu and after much deliberation we went with two family dinners for 4, which included a huge gyro, salad, dessert, and a drink for each person all for about $43. Very reasonable. The other two got some sort of salad, one got the shrimp. The portions are large and the gyro was very tender and tasty. It also had feta cheese on top, which was a nice touch. I tried the shrimp, which were easily jumbo shrimp and very flavorful. The gyro was by far the best part of the meal and the feta fries were also very good. We couldn't decide what dessert to order until a lady behind us in line said their rice pudding was delicious. We ordered both the rice pudding and the baklava. Both were very good. I can only take so much sweet, so I couldn't finish the rice pudding but it was very good. The baklava was one of the best I've had. And I've tried my Greek friend's mom's baklava straight from Greece. It had the perfect flakiness and combination of sweet with the nuts. I'm not a huge dessert fan but the baklava and rice pudding I would order again. Definitely a delicious, affordable meal and I will go again when I'm in the area.  Side note they had raspberry iced tea which was a plus if you don't drink soda :)

f7FgzYr7OnL46af7XLIkKw.text: This place was awesome. We were near the galleria and searched up food places in the area, and this place popped up. I read the reviews and hey who doesn't like good greek food? So we decided to try it out. Glad we did. We walked right in with no wait even though the place was poppin. The staff was friendly we asked him what we should get and he told us about the chicken bowl. It had everything you could think of in it. Kalamata olives, feta cheese, fresh tomatoes chicken on a skewer, rice and mixed lettuce with a tasty vinaigrette. It was soo good. I recommend you try this place.

plPIZkdCMmnwln12LVSGvQ.text: Love this place! Friendly staff and by far the best Greek food in Vegas! Get the gyro plate!

9l4z_5giYoie-70jl9a3qA.text: I went for lunch and the restaurant was exceptionally busy. I requested the gyros sandwich and a side Greek greens. Everything was extremely crisp, truly delectable, served rapidly and with an inviting state of mind.  I'll be going by again soon!

Dq8Q_llAwNUS1xmTqB2k8Q.text: Best Greek food, in town. I live on Ft. Apache and Blue Diamond, and I will gladly drive to this place for the best gyro in town. The food couldn't be fresher and the tastier, it is literally perfect. After having married into a Greek family, I can say, without a doubt, this is the best Greek food, I can eat, outside of homemade that meets all the requirements for True, fresh, Greek cuisine. Just writing this, makes me wanna drive down and eat it, again!

K7v5_69sdZDkGw_Lc3kMBA.text: Filthy disgusting place! The owner is rude and I'm going to call the health inspector. We arrive and got the greek salad, skewers, and chicken pita. My boyfriend split the salad with me and when I was about to eat it a black hair was in it. My bf went to the owner and she said, "must be the wind, so what do you want." My bf said I'm not eating this so she said ok and took the salad back and said she would make a small salad for him not even the entree salad he purchased!! Then he asked how come she's keeping the salad back there he returned she said oh she's going to reheat the chicken when the hair was mixed with chicken and the salad. My bf said no he's not eating that and she starts arguing with him and my bf said he wanted a refund. He got the refund. She got upset and better yet she told the chefs to hold on to the salad so yet another customer who orders it would have it! We have been here multiple times and honestly the food isn't as good as it was before and the owner is a ruthless old hag. WILL NEVER RETURN! Unless you want to eat hair and deal with it.

NaB56ILoT4T6vebuua6s8A.text: Small busy but every time I go there, the people that work they're are so friendly. The food, oh my I get the chicken rice bowl and that is so great tasting and filling. For me it's enough for two meals. I recommend this place to everyone no matter how far they live, it's a must place to go.

4xxm_vsnFeCZ0hhcttYK7Q.text: Me and the hubby went here the other day for the first time it was amazing. Service was outstanding,  food portions were big, food was super good! Cant wait to go back

XZ6sLpv4Mk660jW8aKPAEA.text: Read good reviews about the place on yelp and it didn't disappoint me or my wife. The service is very welcoming and the food tasted equally better. Would definitely  recommend this place to all my friends.

twQj6wlSOp1zjaHrBLDMwA.text: The Great Greek has to be my favorite Greek restaurant!  The freshest salad ever, all ingredients are nice and fresh! Gyros are great! Always juicy! Never dry! The pita bread is so nice, fresh, and soft! Nice place to dine! Even though it's more like a to-go fast food place, but the quality of the food are no less then a fine dine in restaurant.

XzeOc9es6aZkw3D6oTyAqA.text: Food was delicious! All that I expected from a gyro combo and more. The Greek salad had lots of flavor and generous amounts of veggies & feta. I highly recommend the feta fries. They are delicious! The customer service was excellent & very inviting. We'll def be back for more Greek goodies.

QjRIE69P7-XjGs06U-7XRw.text: We decided to try this place one day and I didn't leave disappointed at all. Everything was delicious and amazing. The service was really good and it was a cute little restaurant. This place is defiantly worth going to. If your ever in the area defiantly worth a stop. For sure I will be returning!!

KeXe043L6qnhIzA2CBQEDg.text: Oh so good. I think their veggie wrap is the best I have ever had. Really nice people too!

0CRBQuUEQlJfCKKpnowPuw.text: Best Greek food in town my family and I drive from Summerlin to this location the staff is friendly and the food is outstanding very busy around lunchtime which proves the great food here will be back very soon.

N7JPKFGwaX4T2eP3Ti3iAQ.text: This place is the best. Everything is very fresh and good. Even the vegetables that come on the side are good, and I seriously dislike vegetables.

96Gl8eQcWyvuUESHKOirAA.text: We were blown away by the excellence of this Greek place. My mom got the shrimp entree; succulent mild shrimp over rice, topped with a scattering of raisins and sliced almonds, and served with greek salad; it was fantastic. The pita bread was the best we had ever had. Good hummus, too. I tried the famous rice pudding (far too sweet and heavy for me - Paymon's Mediterranean Cafe on Maryland Pkwy has the best) and the baklava (just okay). Staff was entirely Greek; family-owned place, with the requisite blue and white everywhere. Made me smile with the predictability of it all. In a good way. The wife-side of the ownership came by our table and chatted with us; very pleasant. There is another Greek spot very nearby; I had a hard time deciding which to try. It may be good as well, but I'm so glad I picked this one! It's not fancy, but there are tablecloths and they do serve wine and beer, with a couple of imported Greek beers.

VrEDdUV9-6BXV6hr-3nZxQ.text: This place is amazing! I love their rice bowls, and their damaldes and baklava are the best I've ever had! If you're looking for a great meal for a really reasonable price this is the place to go!

qxqpAPzSfEnHLhuAMEGJ9Q.text: Loved it! Really good Greek food, awesome and fast service, good prices!! My favorite Greek restaurant in the valley!!

cK1nbqS9AG7qlvSsvyFzKQ.text: Very good service, prices, and food.  I had a lamb gyro with rice and feta fries and a piece of baklava. The lamb had very good flavor and was not dry at all, as is the case sometimes. The feta fries had a great balance and were not overpowering. The baklava was a large piece and it was delicious.

ol8qwBGfhnJrCXvbAkqRTA.text: The food, beverage and customer service is awesome.   If you are in the Henderson NV area, don't hesitate to stop by here to try some greek food.  I recommend it.

OjM8_Ly_sa577Ldg6OslMQ.text: By far the best Greek restaurant I've been to. The staff is awesome and the food is delicious.  This is my spot!

9LjCMmqGSHsQA0QRv4_DIQ.text: This place has the best greek food I have ever tasted! I always order the steak kabob greek salad. It definitely does not feel like I am eating fast food. Their baklava is really good too!

k4hUahjIuuYey0qFYEz_uQ.text: If I could give more stars, I would!  I arrived right when they opened, just a minute before actually and within 10 minutes, EVERY table inside was full, on a Monday!  For a quick restaurant type of environment, the service and food quality was amazing! Not to mention that while inside, it had a feeling of community/family, everyone was talking and it felt cozy.  There is a small outdoor patio with nice tables and umbrellas which would make for a great place to grab wine/beer in the evening. They have a decent little selection of each.  An overall great experience, would absolutely recommend to anyone!

eqW5hPK09f20bwQBPtwdTg.text: I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food so we decided to try this place out for lunch on a Saturday.  The place has indoor and outdoor seating which would be nice on a warm day. (we sat indoors as it was not) Very casual dining atmosphere.  The food was very good and the price was very reasonable. I had the Gyro sandwich combo with soup and a drink and it filled me up.  The only downside that prevented me from giving 5 stars was that the Baklava that I ordered never came... The brought out all our food except for the baklava but since we were so full we forgot about it until we got back home... so partially our fault too I guess??  Either way, good food, good service, good price = Will be back.  Good to take friends, family, coworkers, and a date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro combo with rice

R_y8NXJLG_ePwbupgsEn7A.text: While traveling on business we stopped in for lunch, and what a great choice it was.  We had the Beef & Lamb Giro platters.  They came with the Greek salad as a starter and french fries.  The giros where excellent, served with lettuce and tomato.  The Tzatziki sauce was very good as well.    Appears to be a family run business and they did a really good job of serving and keeping us happy.  Don't miss this one!!!

dQcoC9RfeeIH_VixYCsTeg.text: I came late to the party because I didn't know Gyros could be this good!! I was so used to going to that other Gyro place on Eastern, but now I realized I settled for mediocre food there. Well Thank you Great Greek and my Yelpers for opening my eyes to what a Gyro should be. The presentation was wrapped in a pretty and neat package. Tender seasoned meat sliced perfect, with a tzatziki sauce that actually has taste (I always thought tzatziki was a bland yogurt sauce) and the freshest feta cheese, lettuce & tomato. Nice touch with the pepperocini on top to add a little zing. Bite then drizzle juice on the gyro. The bread was soft and allowed the gyro meat to shine without getting in the way. The perfect vessle to hold this delicious creation. OPA!! I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Rice Pilaf with Greek salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Pasticcio
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek &#34;chicken soup&#34; with rice...very soothing.

Us-RE7tic4lngcBZ4dZFQw.text: Great food, friendly service. We were passing through town & this place sounded like it would hit the spot and it did. We had gyros, rice pudding &  baklava ice cream. Everything was so good & fresh.

UL9q7-NP1XiLVinmiTQYBw.text: I love this place. The soup is wonderful. The mezze plate is excellent. Everything is freshens clean. Staff also seems to really care. Super swell!  Note-it's got a to go vibe but I hope it'll continue to grow into a full size restaurant. In the meantime they've updated the decor and it's lovely to eat in.

dzV4exqQnxWKFIs2OcqU9w.text: The food is EXCELLENT!! The store is very clean and great atmosphere, and great customer service. Sometimes the food takes awhile like over 20 mins because they are so slammed, and sometimes there's nowhere to sit because it's kind of small and gets easily overcrowded. I wish they had more space and another location on the west side of Henderson. My wife and I love this place and it's probably our favorite food in the whole city. We usually get the bowls with gyro meat. Portions are very generous. Too bad it's always such a long and drawn out event whenever we want to go here. We usually only go if we are in the area and if there's no line out the door.

3wR00XdOPtgC0uWUig7OIw.text: Best gyro in Las Vegas! I say that with confidence because I strongly dislike lamb yet LOVE the way Great Greek serves it's gyros. If you are in town you have to visit this hidden gem outside of the city. The only thing I dislike is that it is closed on Sundays (hahah can't complain much about that though, they are open 6 days a week!). The rice is amazing too I have to have an extra order of rice to go! Overall a great affordable Place to eat.

Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

lYVJ_aWcvJzOEEROK6A9fA.text: Always a great Greek meal. Love the Gyros, not a huge fan of the feta fries, but their plain fries are great. Try the dolmas-very good. Always busy so be patient for a seat.

VDHg-poblIpewaE99aJaSg.text: Best Greek food around! This is a regular spot for me, family owned and operated, you can go wrong with this place. I love the Greek salad and Greek fries.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Large Greek Salad with Chicken
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Large Greek Salad with Steak and Shrimp

9CI5op8DxEqNgrNpTK2Chw.text: The first time I had this 2 years ago And it was great I had it last week and ordered the same thing, and it was disappointing.  I was just sitting here with some coworkers in my office and we were just talking about this place Mixed reviews I guess it depends what you order and when.

k3CupuJ8RDHyxaG9Y5JAyQ.text: The Great Geek is a prefect mix of classic Greek Diner to fast, on-the-go. The gyro plate was on fantastic - and be sure to try the hummas & pita! I'm definitely trying the Feta Fries next time!!!  The owners are pleasant and hard working! They have customer service down-pat!

4YO0cycainc0L1j9GuRspQ.text: Delicious food and friendly service! I enjoyed a chicken gyro with feta fries. The chicken was tender, the tzatziki tangy and flavorful, the veggies crisp and fresh, and oh the pita bread!!! Fresh, delicious pita bread. I capped my meal with a slice of baklava which was also very good. I'm no expert on Greek food but this definitely tops any of the places I've been. Highly recommend!

uQZYQYj65wKpEGlm61kAFw.text: Must try the feta fries and the gyro.  We came during the lunch hour and it was pretty busy, so not the greatest place to grab a quick bite during lunch. I still want to go back and try the plates and dips. A bit pricey, but the quality is really good.  Employees are really friendly, which is always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro and feta fries

YYg3XftkMfWp06XoumZR0w.text: My forth time here and everything is super good...I am transported  to Greece everytime!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Super awesome family run location!

S_a8PzM8JAGgzpftBEF5uw.text: Absolutely awesome, great food and service. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. Open and airy.

nTcd4VXECyysjl4x6R4Nrg.text: This place is great.  I wish I would have found it sooner. The chicken gyro is the best. I never had walnut baklava, but after reading the reviews I decided to try it.  Boy am i glad I did. It was delicious. At first I was skeptical, because I hate walnuts. I am glad i tried it. The food was so good I ate there 2 days in a row. I am going to have to control myself, if I don't I will be eating there tomorrow. Normally I would be embarrassed eating in one place so many days in a row, but it's worth it. See ya tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Baklava ice cream. ..Yummy!
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. The great chicken gyro, cookies, and salad. Yummy

HdESPDWf58wxzNi21h4W_Q.text: Excellent food. Excellent service. Seems to be family owned. They were all very nice and genuine.  I feasted on the gyro plate. Very good portions. The food came out hot and delicious.

ZpCYOZomZWHEezgLSM23Lw.text: Tiny spot but amazing food. The Greek fries or feta fries are beyond amazing. Even my picky kid was trying to steal my fries. This place is a must if you are in Henderson.

xvOCCoR_0x5OURg-n2np4w.text: By far the best Greek food I've had in the valley, and anywhere else for that matter. I've never been to Greece though. Limited menu compared to most Greek restaurant's, but everything on the menu, and I've tried 98% of it, has amazing flavor! Fresh ingredients, good size portions packed full of meat and not just a salad on a pita. Prices are comparable to any other place, but worth every penny. The staff push this place over the top! You can definitely see and feel in their demeanor and attentiveness that they care about their product and are appreciative of your business. Can get packed during peak hours, but worth the wait. Closed on Sunday's, but I'm cool with that. It's sooo good, I'm salivating writing this review! Make sure you live near by because once you try them, you'll drive completely across town to get your fix, no joke.

fn4LAL63RYdsWi3NDjQyQg.text: Had the Great Greek cater a second event for me and as with the first time, it was fantastic!! Nick is especially helpful and nice to work with. He was able to make some vegetarian modifications which my guests appreciated. Everything was delicious as usual. I actually think the catering food is better than the restaurant food. The biggest crowd pleaser was the salmon kabobs. I really appreciated that the catering order was cooked the same day and everything was fresh and all the meat was moist. I also appreciated all the serving utinsils that came with it. From start to finish the entire process was easy and one less thing I had to worry about!

Wf6xoLKzLsAL_Ydsp1zQ0A.text: When I go to Vegas we always have to eat at Great Greek. Everything in their menu is delicious, you really can't go wrong.

I2W0PD1mgILwmrAGNly-_A.text: Love this place! My boyfriend and I split the gyro and the chicken plate. Everything was amazing and the prices are really reasonable for the amount of food you get. I had a glass of wine with dinner as well and I think we only spent around $25 or $30. We were going to save some for leftovers but ended up eating everything because it was so good! We will definitely be back!

-GBAm0hcQpem6rAG4ymDRQ.text: Best Greek food in Las Vegas and Henderson. Needs to be bigger but the inside is clean and service is great. Food is fresh and made to order. I go with my parents and brother so we get the family meal which is 4 gyros, a big thing of French fries, a big Greek salad, and 4 desserts.. AWESOME

E4Y6A-uBEaVAUSLbOgT2qQ.text: This place was awesome. The food was delicious and the customer service was awesome! I ordered the lamb gyro and the rice pudding and both were delicious. My sister and her husband are both vegetarians and they left full and happy as well.

JA7rblyzZb1DXG8HZ1IgDw.text: This is by far my favorite greek restaurant in Vegas. Easy take out and great service!

_q6x8RUQNsrzPBypT9AF8w.text: I have eaten a gyro wrapped in tin foil off the coast of athens, and I'm telling you, one bite out of my plate here in Henderson, I was taken back in time.   This place is not only delicious, and authentic but its reasonably priced.   The lady who owns the place is super friendly, everytime me and my wife go in, she remembers us and preps some hummus and pita for us.   I love this place.

x3VlCI-RzzjzQEfkSoyo7g.text: This place is so yummy. Really enjoy eating here. The foods great the service is great. The great Greek is just great.

ag7DwMPv275OP_MmTADV3w.text: After wondering what I should eat for dinner other than In-N-Out, I remembered reading about the Great Greek.  I decided to order a gyro meal to-go.    The lady at the counter is super nice.  After explaining to me the items on the menu, I went with what I know best, the gyro.  I shared the meal with my bf and it actually was enough food.  The gyro was tender and flavorful, the salad consisted of fresh ingredients, the fries were freshly fried.  Definitely a delicious meal.  We will return to try other items on the menu...

T-84nGPwF3V80W1DIscs9g.text: The food was tasty.  The atmosphere OK.  Price was reasonable.  The Gyro platter was good.  I thought the sauce was a little bland (could have used more dill and seasoning).  The feta fries were good.  Food easily deserved 3 1/2 or 4 stars.  Customer service pulled them down a star.  The reason:  When they were taking my order, they asked how many were in my party (I was alone) and they told me to sit at a 2 person table (a reasonable request since they were almost full (a testimony to their good food), but when I finished placing my order, only a 4 place table was available (someone had sat down at the place they had pointed out to me).  The only table left was the 4 place table, so I sat there (outside was too hot).  When my food came out, they were clearing a recently vacant 2 seat table and put my food there, and motioned me to re-seat myself.  I felt they could have handled moving me a little better then to put my food at another table.  If they had asked me 1st, it wouldn't have been an issue, but somehow the way it played out without a polite exchange of communications made me feel there was an underlying lack of customer commitment.  I will go back, because the food was good, but hope this review will help them sharpen their customer communications skills.

xLaVRhkem1O3AsCpiZxsOA.text: The chicken gyro and avgolemomo soup are absolutely delicious. I haven't had Greek food this authentic and tasty since I moved here from So Cal.

nnuOm9MyzopySkytMaYRCA.text: I forgot how much I liked this place.  Have not been in a while but it was awesome as usual. There are a decent number of Greek places in Vegas and this one is the best one I have been to.   For 11 bucks I got the gyro plate. Fries, a Greek salad and the gyro of course.  Food is good, staff is friendly and the place is clean. I'm a big fan.

7WvV_6DXQEWUSYlAwPbXBQ.text: My go to place for gyros!! I can't find another place that comes close! The gyro meat is so tender and I love how they put the feta cheese on them at no charge. The sauce is very flavorful as well. Greek salad and feta fries are my two favorite sides. I definitely recommend trying this place if you haven't already done so. You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro combo with feta fries... YUM!!!

qYXK_6mLWrwbF6VaBaqcBQ.text: This is hands down, one of the best Greek restaurants I have ever been to! I lived in Europe and have been trying to find a restaurant in the states that has the authentic taste I miss... Not to mention, the friendly people that work there, the filling portions, cleanliness and good variety of options on the menu!   If you don't live in Henderson but are in the Las Vegas area, or even just visiting, this is worth the drive!

KX8dAe3UqW41jABlG88OwQ.text: I have been meaning to try this place for quite a while now after seeing the reviews. Well Thank you fellow yelpers! You never let me down! I had the chicken gyro with a side of feta fries. The chicken was delicious! Very moist and flavorful. Just the right amount of ingredients on a soft fresh pita! The fries were tasty and not at all greasy! The staff here is so friendly and I had great service! I have been looking for a good Greek place on my side of town and I finally found it! Adding this to my list of favorite restaurants

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Gyro so good!

lVeLTlgNp8gK4IwbdRH_gA.text: The food was OK but having tried a lot of the other Greek food in the area I definitely think there are better options

THPL9cCOd1v495fNTVxlrQ.text: Can't wait to try more from their menu!  I needed appetizers for a gathering after work.  I ordered the Four Dip Combo:  Tzaziki; Hummus; Lebni; and Melizanosalata.  The Melizanosalata with roasted eggplant, garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice was my favorite! But all four were super delicious!  It came with warm, yummy pita bread.  They were a big hit!  Just because I can't pass up on dessert, I also got the baklava.  OMG - it was perfect, not too sweet, just perfection!  I arrived right around 5 pm, just before a huge rush!  :-)  Will be back for a full meal!

qcfwMZhOyU0l210iHR3xUQ.text: We arrived in Henderson after a day at Bryce Canyon. We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and we quite hungry. Thanks to Yelp I spotted great reviews for this Greek Restaurant which turned out to be across the street. We came to the little restaurant that had some tables inside but chose to sit outside as it was on the cooler side inside. My 2 children ordered the large Greek salads that came with hot, toasted pita wedges. My husband and I each ordered the chicken souvlaki platter that came with small Greek salads, rice pilaf and the pita wedges. The chicken was really flavorful and my picky 17 year old proclaimed, "that's the best chicken I've ever tasted!" The salads were delicious and very crisp and fresh! My daughter also ordered a baklava for dessert to eat back at the hotel and it was gobbled up. ( she loved it and normally doesn't like nuts). We loved our meal and wish they were by our home in Phoenix. I also have to add that the woman who took our order was super friendly and cheerful. The food was quickly served nice and hot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

9u3sDpqQcgh0fYDVHchLlQ.text: Henderson has some pretty stiff competition in a very small area: Kyklos, Greek Bistro and The Great Greek. Personally I prefer Greek Bistro and Great Greek because Kyklos is good and priced around the same as the other two but sits in the Galleria mall so my mindset is fast-food Greek.   Where to start! The hummus and pita was very enjoyable, great flavors and not overpowered with lemon as some other places do. The chicken and steak shewers with rice & salad were incredible. The steak was nice and tender, the rice was perfect and the salad had a perfect blend balsamic vinegar dressing. The chicken gyro was quite tasty but thought it had a tad bit too much tzaziki sauce. I walked away so stuff that I was popping Tums later that night but that experience hasn't prevented me from wanting more. The cashier was incredible, which I'm sure was probably the owner or owner's wife. Oh bring a jacket because I was freezinggggggg while we ate so the food got cold, thus the reason for knockin off a star.  Great place for Greek food but I like how there's the Greek triangle near the Galleria mall. If you don't like this place, try Kyklos in the mall or Greek Bistro by Sunset!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken gyro with side of rice
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Chicken Souvlaki

H8y10tN3nVzLxSRT0yCMxw.text: Upon arriving in Las Vegas today I enjoyed a simple, well crafted dinner from The Great Greek. True to other's comments the feta fries were unique and tasty. I was a little worried the fries would be soggy with the added cheese but they were crispy to the last bite. The gyro was warm lamb with cool veggies. A little double flavor with the white sauce on the gyro and feta fries. Knowing that now I may have gone with the falafel. All in all a delightful meal if you have a few minutes to wait for fresh made food in a small restaurant.

c0I4J-hDa10mojCuKtu6vA.text: Dropped by for another gyro.  The wife had the shrimp platter.  The fries were kind of gross tasting tonight.  I think the gyro would taste better if the meat and pita were grilled up a bit.  I want a slight char to my meat and the pita is a bit doughy.  The shrimp were a tad undercooked.  They were slammed, so I chalk it up to being too busy.

uHNehoh3mnsfCYgWwWTDWQ.text: Hands down THE BEST GREEK FOOD IN VEGAS!!!!!!! Need I say more? What are you waiting for, go check it out.

vMD63lYcjjnpaU85GCFylw.text: Ample portions with quick service, The Great Greek was an excellent lunch for our family. The warm pita is delicious as well as the hummus. If we lived in the area, we would be regulars. The service was high quality especially for a restuarant where you order at the counter. At one point during the meal my son asked for sauce off of my plate, and within two minutes the sauce appeared, even without me or my son having to ask. Great service and good food for the cost.

fmm33MBUuCWbij2HIsIykw.text: best gyro ! love the feta fries.  mom and pop place, always try to support local!!  make sure your call in orders around dinner time, bc it gets busy! they recently just renovated to make it bigger...

Ii1wmbZ1F6fxkxnVUxQn_Q.text: Since I moved to Henderson I've been looking for some good falafel.  I found it at Great Greek.  When my wife was out of town I ate there 3 times.  Their grilled shrimp also delicious, get it with the feta fries.  It may be a little pricey, but it's to die for.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for s great Gyro, baklava, or anything Greek head on over to the Great Greek.  You won't regret it.

Q73553cV95FuPJIW-sBcKw.text: This tiny, family-owned & run Greek joint shouldn't be missed if you find yourself anywhere close to Stephanie & Warn Springs. The same family who owns The Fat Greek on the west side also owns this place. The Fat Greek has a larger dining room and includes a bakery counter (the family, as I understand, is actually mostly Armenian and whips up some pretty incredible Armenian baked goods). The Great Greek Grill is a smaller place without the included bakery, but it's clean and light (mirrors along one wall and windows along two other walls help it feel larger & brighter). Service here is always patient and with a smile; you can tell they really care about keeping loyal customers. I can vouch for the fact that their hummus, tzatziki, spanakopita, Greek salad, and chicken souvlaki all have great flavor. I don't like dolmades, so I can't really help you there, though I can tell you these are longer and skinnier than most I've seen/tried. Unlike most Greek joints, this one also offers avgolemono soup, which I enjoyed, but since I don't have too much experience with different incarnations of it yet, I'm not sure how it compares. I love their chicken so much that I haven't tried their actual gyro meat, but nothing I've had there yet has done me wrong.  (Note: Evidently there's a duplicate page out there for this place, listed under its full name, The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill. I'd posted this review under that listing first (there are 5 other people that reviewed under that one), and now I'm posting it here as well.)

8_8eOnoM99QZjf2rxt_kNw.text: Great food and service! I'm in love with their chicken skewers :-p

B9e6-bTqY9p7leuncLRL-w.text: We love this place! The food is fantastic and staff are wonderful. Go get a great Greek wrap asap!

1A6WIUblBPPB3SLq6OKOmw.text: spectacular food and service.  chef worked with the hubs during his wynn days.  now he's got his own place, serving up his food - the way his family has served it up for  generations -- and you can taste the love.  great flavors.  simple, honest, fare.  Our only complaint is that tgg is not open sundays when my chef is usually home - so we have to go on those random week days when he is because he loves it, too.  we usually leave happily with buddha belly accompanied by a serious food coma.    greek salad is not to be missed -- best in town by far.    and for me with celiac, I eat here with confidence knowing I'm safe and can just relax and enjoy the food and my husband's company -- that's the best part.

4V73acMfH-5DYV_6zkSG2Q.text: I am usually really generous with my stars and giving the Great Greek 3 stars is me being generous. I wasn't super impressed with the food here. We got one chicken and one steak Gyro and although huge in size, there is too much feta cheese on it to really get the flavor of the meat and the rest of the sandwich. We also got a Greek side salad and overall it was ok. I will not be coming back to eat here because at almost $20 bucks for dinner, I would rather make something at home.

JP1U-PznM8HyAV5XkH9OBw.text: This is our second time ordering from here. The service is awesome I love the fact that its a family owned business. The food is authentic and tastes sooo good! Last time we had the Greek plate 1 beef/lamb and 1 chicken. This time 2 Gyros and they were fantastic. You have to try the grape leaves and feta fries!

wJl6SwAuRr11uPNRpCYd6Q.text: I love Mediterranean food; and by far this place is my favorite. You can tell they don't cut corners on ingredients and quality. Finding a seat may be a bit of a challenge during lunch and dinner hours as they get busy.

oIjNN9Bc86OtEqRklDGL6A.text: This place has amazing food!  Me and my girls hit this fabulous Greek spot almost every Friday night after yoga class.  The salads are fresh and delicious!  They also have many delightful vegetarian options.  We don't eat Greek anywhere else.

nCJjnPx91j0h0k-m7cTLuw.text: Yummy...awesome food, great service, fun atmosphere. A wonderful place to go with a group of friends and just relax and cpmmunicate.

rvu5zOAyf7ibOORq4xWIOw.text: I will get the only complaint I have out of the way first....my wife and I had planned on eating in (today's date) but upon opening the front door a rather unpleasant smell hit us. I assume they were boiling and peeling eggs and it took over the entire place.   So we got the food to go and it was really great. The giros are top notch and the feta fries are out of this world. Will be going back but please guys.....no smells next time!

KSx3JRKeRykUWJBP6gqlEw.text: Someone recommended The Great Greek and boy was I impressed! I had the grilled marinade shrimp with extra pita bread...sooooo good! The restaurant was clean and the service was food.  Will definitely be going back.

Fd1N3nMsgKBz20QlHWTooQ.text: We were there once and we loved it. Order was quick and easy. We ordered soup and two entrees. The soup was tasty and hot, as well as the big plates. Everything was fresh and looked delicious. We ordered the skewer meat plates and they were yummy. Will definitely be back there when we are back in Vegas!

23HEohBbCUVbJcJNIEjxQw.text: This is my VERY favorite Greek Restaurant in the US hands down. The Greek fries are yummy, the hummus is so very fine!  Literally. The lamb is seasoned to perfection and the serving size is huge! Worth every penny!

gaNV5emvv5zSrT2OaWSppw.text: I know everyone raves about the Gyros, but the Souvlaki plates here are incredible. Skip the Feta Fries and check out the rice pilaf. You won't be disappointed.  This place has great service but small dining room. It's perfect for grabbing some food to go.

B1XPcu2AUCQCu5ZwCuirVg.text: I absolutely LOVE the food here! The chicken gyro is outstanding and the hummus appetizer with FRESH pita is out of this world.   I find it odd that they don't serve Lamb, but since I don't eat Lamb I'm not highly disturbed by this fact.   The food is consistently delicious but the establishment is consistently FREEZING! My suggestion would be to get your food to go and enjoy it in the comfort of your own, temperature balanced dwelling.

Gid08STC_mKyMeS_hN3hxg.text: The Great Greek is a great casual restaurant for a get together with friends. All of their items are super delicious, but my favorite is the gyro platter! I've been coming here since opening day, and any time I'm in Henderson, I'll definitely be back. Their service is a little slow (as in you should probably sit down and eat in) so if you were hoping for a fast in and out joint, this place might disappoint.

CA-I1lt0Lk2YTolH4cgtYQ.text: This was such a delicious meal! I had the Gyro and feta fries and I was shocked with how good it looked and tasted. I will definitely make it back out here some day :)

WWoEqlXvM8yukwyTAiesvg.text: So good and you can tell the food is made from quality ingredients! Our favorites are the gyros and the feta fries, which are definitely worth the upgrade. The tzatziki sauce is really good, as is their Greek yogurt dip. I love their pita bread, it's so fresh and soft! This is our go-to place when we want Greek food!

ikcVFZo89s_prL_OsOrrVQ.text: Go! This place is superb. Everything is fresh, the family that works here really care that you're satisfied, prices are fair, and the portions are huge. We had a felafel gyro and lamb gyro. Fabulous. If you feel like outdoor dining, no problem. They have tables with umbrellas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Really great prices &amp; food

x3jd1yfbUxFlrDxYRoZtRg.text: One of the nicest people, clean places I have ever ate at! Great prices and totally worth checking out. YUMMY! I ordered the gyro meat combo and their fries are yummy too!

pVhJyfjey5qBbW24yu4ugg.text: Fantastic Greek food, especially love the feta fries!!! Took away one star due to the employees sitting outside the front of the establishment in the outside dining area smoking, other than that I have no complaints!

-Jil1FTsYhF2r8B3zsvxww.text: Everything on the menu is great. I've been there for lunch several times. My But I do avoid going there between noon to 1pm. The restaurant is small and it does get very crowded.

26u3FMW8IckrDM2gLHchxg.text: Deserves every star . Hands down the best and freshest Greek food EVER . You gotta try it !!! Try the feta fries . Yum

GmUmcSL5JFXmMDJW205BAw.text: We've been coming here for years and normally have had wonderful service and food, but after tonight I don't think I will ever go back.  Three of us walked in and saw an open table and one of us sat down.  We were rudely kicked out of that table to accommodate another party that was ordering right a head of us.  One person of that party  had already sat down at another table and they were in the process of ordering.  Our party was in line to order behind them.  The staff RUDELY told us we couldn't sit there because we hadn't yet ordered (as mentioned our party was in line waiting to order next).  Both parties were 3 people and we were told to sit at a small table for 2 so the other party could have the bigger table.  It was made to be a huge rude deal.  I've never been treated so rudely at any restaurant.  If seating is that important here maybe they should get a hostess to seat you.  We walked out and I doubt we will be back.  What a disappointment.  They just lost the 3 of us and all our friends that have been coming here for years!  I see they are building a new restaurant on the SW side and I was going to recommend it to all my friends over there, but not after tonight!

VH9MIBiM95emn8DeiscWbA.text: This place is great! Had the garlic shrimp, comes with choice of feta fries or rice pilaf. Comes with a Greek salad, pita and tzatziki.  Very fresh and taste great! I highly recommend this place. Looking forward to trying other things on their menu.

dhbvXJ9_QMjgc9QIOHWTOA.text: Great gyro plate... Tasty feta fries... Very clean. Little on the expensive side but they give you a ton of food.

nba5v2QadJBcwZPSzQ48jQ.text: This is the best ever! I have been all over town and I am so glad we have a local place this fabulous.  Impeccable service with great owners that take it all seriously unlike most places in henderson. Friendly service and very clean restaurant.    Everything was fantastic! The gyros, the rice, the salad. The Steak was so tender, the soup addictive.  We've been twice already and may make a weekly indulgence. :) Do not pass this place up!

vpAVdGkg1Qu4EC8Wi8TecQ.text: Like Ellie Goulding's song "Lights," Greek food never gets old to me.  On any given day falafels and gyros can keep calling, calling, calling me to lunch or dinner.   Been wanting to try out Great Greek for a while, but it's a little more east than I usually travel.   Tonight I found myself in the area and decided to call in some takeout.  I went with a lamb gyro with feta fries on the side, and asked for a side of falafel because I simply have to try some at every Greek restaurant I go to because it's in the title of my list here on Yelp for Mediterranean eats.  When I arrived the food was ready and waiting for me and I was happy to see Dr. Pepper on the list of fountain drink options because as you may know, Dr. Pepper is the unofficial non-alcoholic nectar of the Gods.    I did have to drive about 20 minutes until I got home, so please take that into consideration for the food review that follows.  I immediately went for some feta fries which were pretty standard french fries covered in, you guessed it, feta cheese.  Because of the drive, the feta cheese had sort of started to congeal a little, but it had no effect on the taste and I found them delicious.   I will say for a quick comparison that I do prefer Yanni's Gyros fries where he adds garlic, feta and hot sauce, but I digress.  Then came the gyro.  With the first bite I knew it was something special.  Tender, flavorful gyro meat with the standard lettuce tomato and onion SMOTHERED in tzatziki and feta.   I think it had more of these two ingredients than any gyro I've had elsewhere, and to me that was a good thing.  Between the fries and the gyro the meal was fetariffic!  Sorry about that.  Lastly I tried some of the side of falafel, and was a little disappointed in those.  They weren't bad by any means, but I feel like I've had better in many places like Hedary's and the Fat Greek for example.  The texture was good, but it just wasn't as flavorful as I like.  Prices were reasonable and service was friendly and efficient.  If Great Greek were closer to my work or home I'd make it a regular visit, but for now it will remain a solid choice when I'm in the area (which is almost never.  Step your game up Sunset Station!)

ANxy8k67FrXFgeTaalUTgA.text: Amazing food. Yero & Yero salad were of the highest quality ingredients, fresh. & tasty. Excellent service.

Ep5LrfYdLcPxo9-BIphjZg.text: While in town for my husbands birthday we decided to try this Greek restaurant for lunch. We have a vacation home nearby and heard good reviews. We arrived at 11:15 am on a Saturday. By 11:30 there wasn't a seat to be had. It's a small place with limited seating but the food is outstanding. We ordered hummus, Gyros and a baklava. The staff was friendly and attentive. They acknowledged by name several regulars who came in. The hummus was delicious. I have never had a better Gyro. The taste of the meat was so flavorful and abundant. Feeling bad for the standing room only crowd, I suggested we take the baklava home for later.  We were stuffed from all the other food. We got home and I couldn't wait any longer to dig into the baklava. It's by far the freshest most tasty baklava I have ever had. It nearly sent me into a sugar coma but it was well worth it.  We will be back in April and will be ordering lunch and dinner a few times.

Z3MSXd3XiazTMsy2EvHfeA.text: Amazing food, fantastic service. Would highly recommend. The best gyro that I've bad, and the Feti Fries are to die for.

7IQK6fjRnwbKRrvhGcYXuA.text: Small place with a pretty big wait but I understand why. I got a falafel rice bowl to go without the yogurt to make it vegan and it was so amazing. My BF got some kind of burger and he was equally impressed. The people at the counter were super nice. Everything tasted really fresh and I will absolutely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Falafel rice bowl

_j4ocgg67iaY9IHRYtqt9g.text: If I could give more stars I would. This place... oh this place. I have to admit I eat here at least once a week. I have never, ever had a less than perfect meal here. The only downfall is that the place is so small!  That being said, they are so organized that even when the line is out the door with the greek food addicts like myself, they always make sure people get seated in order if they choose to dine there and the wait is never too long. I am surprised with the magic that these people create in such a tiny space.  The staff is so friendly and they work their butts off!  The presentation of the food is like fine dining and the price is outstanding. If I ever win the lotto, I'm getting these guys a great big spot... next to my house. :)

TE802kwjCTI_Qvl0I0iDIQ.text: Just ate here and we are leaving so happy!! Everything we ate was so great and the service was excellent as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad wrap &amp; feta fries

2RBzRtgtm2zeQHHk5LBC_g.text: This is my new favorite Greek spot!! Portions are very generous and the food is quality. Plus they have some of the best dolmas I've ever had!

FlqLkQQlGd1sGfYI85-kcA.text: This place has the best service and the best food. We come here atleast twice a week. The staff knows us already and we love coming here !

vbX8YmakOTT8PNBuxanqvg.text: The food is really good here, but finding a seat is sometimes hard! They are busy and the restaurant is almost always full! The staff is helpful and extremely friendly which makes the atmosphere fun and enjoyable! Portions are appropriate for the price too!

MKvvitsFGzuFl8w_fPdf4A.text: It's hard to find good Mediterranean and Greek food here in town, this place always hits the spot! Menu is simple and food is amazing!

mQ6vBXGyc48bPCRoQR8VNQ.text: I love this place. Lots of vegan options: falafel, eggplant dip, hummus, grape leaves... My omnivore bf also loved the steak gyro. But what really sets the Great Greek apart is the staff - super friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

IhJ9uC4TTfjLM6nLAiXa3A.text: We were looking forward to eating here. I stood in line while my husband and kids secured a table. We were asked to give up the table because "whoever orders first gets a table".  This was broadcasted over the entire restaurant. We got up and left immediately as that's the first time I've ever heard that. I will be sure to never come back to this restaurant and I will tell all my friends about the rude way we were treated.

QCk-l9fHOJ63Ff4IqeizCA.text: This place was packed I went at 430. So it was dinner time I got the gyro platter with feta fries to go. It came with aside salad also. Feta fries were so good never heard of them before the fries alone were nice and crispy. The gyro was good but I didn't get any onion on it and I asked for everything on it. It had what looked like pica digalo. Just tiny chopped up tomatoes with looked like cilantro in it. It was still tasty though.  Last complaint is they cut the pita in half. This makes it really hard to eat. But it was still good

ELGihmp-_hbkSzQbjmQvpg.text: If this place had a drive thru I would eat here every day!  I will not go on and on about the delicious food. because it is delicious.  One thing I really like is the outdoor seating. Not many places as cute as this in Henderson

hOs-cWoq_0QCy0SOqq6Qwg.text: Fabulous!!!! I work in the area and I been going to Kyklos in the Galleria Mall for years! Well today I thought I'd give this place a shot! Loooove it! I ordered the Rice Plate and chose chicken as my meat. Glad I did! Everything is so flavorful!! I thought how good could can rice taste, it's rice? WRONG! It's so good!! They put a scoop of rice in the middle, salad along the outer edges and your choice of meat on top. It is the most favorable Greek food I've ever had! Everything compliments each other. Not a fan of garbanzo beans which are in the salad, funny? I don't mind them! All the flavors compliment each other! Oh I will be back! Yum!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Rice Bowl! Get it!!! You won&#39;t be disappointed!

jvOTkOA0VqO3WElbKM4Ndw.text: Visiting Las Vegas for the first time and The Great Greek came highly recommended to eat at, glad I did this place will surely not disappoint you. Great family atmosphere and very friendly, will be back on my next visit. Order the chicken rice bowl!

psDSLeSf5W9Dkn0YveZqyg.text: Excellent food. Service was excellent as well. We had a great meal (4 of us). The works; dessert included. This maybe one of the best Greek restaurants I've ever eaten at!   It's not a large facility. Though they have outdoor seating. It's likely crowded at the busier times so keep that in mind. But even if one had to wait a bit, it's worth it.

LElH2j2DbDGiZ3rxgniSnw.text: The is place is awesome my fiance and I come to the Great Greek every other week. The food is super fresh, the staff is friendly and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good moderately priced meal living in Henderson.

kx_4x2kiIa2kBBkurzdS1Q.text: Awesome food and amazing service. I either order yhe steak souvlaki or the shrimp skewers with the feta fries. The gyro plate is also really good as well. If youre really hungry, try some of their deserts!

3kL06V3t5WrGU0UZCS7YkQ.text: By far, the best Greek food in the valley. The feta is mild and delicious. It is always busy so be prepared to wait for a table but it is well worth  the wait. The gyros are delicious. The salads are superb. The staff is nice. It is just good food period.

WeipRNouFNWSBTfMKBMFrQ.text: Not very good service. I ordered the Greek salad wrap, 15 minutes later still sitting with no food. Went up to counter to inquire, older woman told me chicken takes awhile to cook. I told her, my order has no meat in it. She just kept saying, it was the chicken. I told her, no meat! She said it would be out in a minute. She brought my friends food and then we waited another 5 minutes for my meatless, cold salad wrap..  She dropped off a piece of baklava without a word. Sorry to say, not a big fan of nuts. Our fries with feta came next (we have now been here for almost 30 minutes) fries are plain, no cheese.  Won't be back, definitely won't recommend

B-9r7yqhVdNX9276DUToEw.text: Enjoyed a small Greek salad with a chicken skewer. Salad already had dressing but it was the perfect amount. Chicken was flavorful and not dry at all--will be going back

BROsGrfklmoTLPZoBzmN6w.text: I rated above 3 stars for being a LONG time customer of restaurant  i rated much higher but now quality of food & customer serve has gone down : we ordered food Tuesday this past week my wife ordered as usual from our car outside we waited 15 mins as informed i went early to pay as it was getting busy as usual ( too busy i guess) as the young lady took our order ny wife told her three time what we wanted and she repeated it back wrong my wife told her again as i picked it up she stated what we ordered but as we got hone it was wrong ( SURPRISE) we got shrimp skiers instead of steak I wish I am allergic to seafood so my wife had to eat both tramps without wanting to she called back to the store and the girl said that first you did and apologized and she did apologize that she missed heard and then she told the manager a whole different story as we asked to speak to the manager the young manager comes on the phone was no help whatsoever he was like didn't know what to do how to fix the problem all he said was come back and wish if we were right next-door would be fine but we lived a ways away and wanted to eat our dinner  (so bottom line we will go ELSE WHERE FOR OUR GREEK FOOD. ( also rice was SALTY) THANKS NICK FOR UR KIND COMMENTS & CONCERN ( i wish the manager was as well he was VERY UNCARING OR HELPFUL.

K9NNvGvCK4IUtvUzufRUBA.text: My favorite place to eat in the area. They have the best Greek salad and I especially like it with steak. The staff is also very friendly.

Portion of the bowl was humongous so I had to put half of it into a to-go box. Overall, amazing Greek restaurant and customer service. Will definitely come back here whenever I'm visiting.

xUxoloJ6vs9yE8h8azcjVg.text: Spot on joint it's where we go when we want something special thank you for existing in Henderson

aHQNyswkBOxqs2MnUG0s8w.text: First time at the Great Greek. Food deliciously fabulous. I had the lamb gyro special. It was the best I've had!

pvyJ4iMljx-VlKx-ewOYUQ.text: The gyros here are bar-none the best in town.  I have not had a better gyro in town.  The shop is extremely small but they are good at turning tables quickly.  I enjoy their food thoroughly.

YfXHBWJFWClVdR87_xLUjg.text: It's a tiny space that is well lit, with a charming little fountain in the outdoor patio.  10mins before opening for lunch on a Wednesday, there's already a line outside.  I was in the mood for Moussaka but had to settle for the grilled shrimp with extra Spanakopita, while my friend had the Beef Souvlaki (grilled skewer).  We were extremely happy with EVERYTHING.    The Spanakopita was light and satisfying, the skewers (esp the shrimp) were cooked perfectly, and the accompanying sides were all faultless... from the fries, tasty rice pilaf, salad to the pita and tatziki (yogurt dipping sauce with cucumber).  These large, composed plates are a treat, an in-between fast food and fine dining.  They have great service and sell wine here too!  So if you're craving for great greek grub, the drive to Henderson will be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach, cheese, filo dough
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Spanakopita
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. side salad

4psKny7qRnknkIRE1b19eg.text: I am sitting here now, waiting to pick-up my order to go, happily anticipating them calling my name. I have already been here several times, and it is superb each and every time. This is the best Greek food that I have ever had. Luckily, I live right down the street, so I get to visit as often as I want. I highly recommend the gyro meat, it's beyond delicious!

rBVD7_BIjBIIxkDvN3Edcg.text: Super tasty Greek food, had my first meal there last week and definitely won't be my last. Worth the 15 minute drive from my place!

h8PzhGw6j_39Mv-Kge0_qw.text: Great place. I come here at least twice a week to eat. Local restaurant, family owned. I enjoy the food, always fresh, authentic Greek. I highly recommend eating here! My daughter came to visit from Florida, every time I tell her Im going here for dinner, she is so jealous that she cant be here to eat the food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

HZxuemrSpB5RjqwtpZts4Q.text: Always delicious! I have been to this place too many times to count! It never disappoints. Even when it's slammed the service is northing but great! Love coming here!

wWD3zpCXEaKOk28mx0-5WQ.text: I'd like to give this place 3.5 stars, but I guess I can round up.  It is a clean little restaurant in a strip mall, with a nice outdoor area complete with fountain. That said, I didn't expect world-class Greek and a wine list.  I ordered the Greek bowl with gyro meat, hubby ordered the gyro with side salad. Then, we sat down to wait.  After a brief wait, we got our order of dolmathes. They were skinny and soaked in oil and, frankly, not that good. But, I'm addicted to Mezze Foods' dolmas, so it would take a miracle to find any worth comparison.  We sipped iced tea and proceeded to wait for dinner.  And wait...  And wait...  And watch both parties that came after us get served...  And wait...  And, just as I heard my husband's stomach actually complain louder than he was whining, the food came.  Lots of it. Fresh and tasty. Absolutely no complaints about food quality - yummy. Plenty of feta and meat, nice crunchy greens, good dressing.  One thing I will say, particularly to those who complained of "too much" cheese on their food: No. Such. Thing. Weirdos. Loved that my salad was nice and cheesy, much like my hubby. :)   But, worth the wait? Meh.

i-KaTc0A-5u1T9GCa42_0w.text: We've had take out from here numerous times and never been disappointed. It's our go to place for good Greek food when we're back in town visiting relatives and friends.

3s8tpf06jtolD0xvbbvl6g.text: I eat at The Great Greek at least once a week, and as a business owner I witnessed an awesome employee tonight. Brittany did amazing job with a costumer tonight under a tough situation! Their food speaks for itself but this employee is a total asset! Stop by and say hello to her!

TbOHujC70ePx9_KhTiUEpA.text: This place is definitely one of my favorite Greek restaurants in town. Excellent customer service with great food. My boyfriend found this place on yelp months ago and since then.. we order from here every time we crave their gyros, tzatziki dip, & fresh pitas. This place never disappoints us whenever we come in.

RD5oe6F7zFxG9IBL4ipCHw.text: Simply put: great food with fast and friendly service. Absolutely great Greek food. I had the great Greek gyro with the feta fries. You must try the feta fries. Also the soup is really good. Everything is fresh and delicious.

KDPYmQQ9uOjePpe1Ukdv3A.text: An unassuming, spartan dining area in a fast food type setup, but oh boy, is the food good. We went with another couple and each ordered something different. It was all delightful. The gyros, the lamb kabobs, the Greek chicken, and the salad was amazing. The staff is friendly and upbeat too. Good Greek food is hard to find in the valley, but this place is one of the best.

qbM8VGbo81qR3fn1jEWKog.text: Sadly, my knowledge of Greek food comes from My Big Fat Greek Wedding and a killer hangover from a few too many shots of cheap ouzo and pine sap Retsina to wash down "Greek" takeout in Hawaii.   With those credentials to back me, here goes.  The Great Greek makes very good, tasty Greek food.  Simply put, proteins are juicy and properly cooked, breads are fresh, everything is flavored with fresh herbs and well seasoned.    Dolmades (grape leaves stuffed with rice dill and other herbs) a real surprise.  Dense, moist and herbaceous, the leaves so tender you can eat them.  Lamb and beef gyro and grilled chicken gyro are real standout.  Juicy, well seasoned, sliced beef and lamb or chunks of chicken , atop simple veg, bathed in a zesty tzaziki, piled with a tart goat milk ricotta all enveloped by a fresh, warm, fluffy pita.  Grilled steak souvlaki, no complaints.  Deeply flavored, juicy tenderloin on skewers over a fluffy rice pilaf.  A squeeze of fresh lemon to brighten up the dish.   Done.    Finally, desert; baklava.  What's not to love, flaky filo, butter, sugar, walnuts, cinnamon all bathed in honey.  Friendly counter service.  Clean dining area.  Reasonable prices.  Poker Pro Tip:  Give a bud who lives in the area a ride to the WSOP. On the way stop for lunch.  For days after "hey, you want me to stop at that Greek place and get you something?"  Heck yeah!  Ponder if you must, is the food so good because it's different from our norm or is it the difference from its norm that makes it delicious?  It's all Greek to me.

t2J9TswsQCnaWgMlvzLPlg.text: My husband and I were ready to eat at the Great Greek for lunch. While he was in line to order our food I sat at the only table that was available, then one of the employees came up to the table and told me I could not sit there and that I had to give it up for the people who ordered before me. Is that correct? Can they order people not to sit at a table? In addition to being hungry, we were now upset and walked out. I think this was rude and uncalled for. I've never experienced such a thing at other restaurants. This is unfortunate because we have eaten there before and enjoyed the food but this experience has discouraged us from returning.

gKDdcveIUv98XrErvpxCuQ.text: This is by far my favorite Greek place. I usually order the Great Greek chicken gyro combo with fries. The chicken in the gyro is well seasoned and cooked to perfection. It's topped with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions and a generous amount of tzatziki. The gyro holds well if you order to go, the fries not so much. The staff is very nice and the service is fast.

bwmEtdzvubhcUGXu36w8dA.text: PERFECT Greek food.  I got a chicken santorini sandwich the other day, but I substituted pita for the roll it normally comes on.  It was THE BEST THING I EVER ATE, hands-down.  The Great Greek continues to impress me!

OEthHO06cd7iWKXDECArkA.text: I can confirm that the food is excellent and the people are friendly. My chicken gyro was way more tender and flavorful than what I have come to expect from normal Greek joints. Excellent, in fact. And since my order took all of 10 milliseconds longer than my server deemed appropriate, I got a slice of complimentary cake! Yay for Great Greek!

zKDrhgIhrcsgRRSueBrFuA.text: Finally...a "good" Greek restaurant on this side of town!!! I met a friend there for lunch today because it was highly recommended. Looking at the menu, I knew I was in trouble and if I liked the food, would probably have to come back at least 20 times.   I ordered the avgolemono soup and the dolmathes. Both were very good. The soup was similar to my dad's, it has the right amount of lemon, not too much chicken and not too watery, not too thick...just right. The dolmathes were tasty and easy to eat. They weren't too vinegary like some places and the grape leaves were nice and fresh where some places are all tough and stringy. I also tried my friend's spanakopita, which was by far much better than other Greek places around here. Not only is the food better, but the prices are also much better than the other Greek places out here. Being Greek, I'm obviously picky about my Greek food. Next time I come here, I'll try the pastitsio, then I'm trying a burger because the Greeks make the best burgers and we need more good burger joints out here.  The service is very good. They are very friendly and yes, when my friend at the table behind me dropped his napkin, the owner was immediately over with a replacement. Now that's service.

3yTKoz522ybVn2_EilOswg.text: I have eaten here twice and the food is sooooo delicious!!!  I highly recommend that anyone looking for quiality Greek food should take a trip down to The Great Greek on Warm Springs.  Opa!!!!!

4mST9rC772CfvOEOkQb2ag.text: We were traveling from the Bay Area to AZ staying in Henderson along the way.  Great Greek was recommended by yelp and we were very happy with it.  Some of  the best Greek food I've had anywhere (including East and West Coasts) and, as is usually the case, at a very good price.  Various nice touches in well know dishes.  Excellent pastry (filo) on the spanakopita that was a part of my mezze plate.  Kebab chicken (is the yellow from tumeric?) was particularly moist and tasty.  The wife (very discriminating) and son were pleased as well.

bqRDrglnwExJmZwGWfqgJg.text: My wife and i were intending to go to jasons deli which is in the same shopping center. Too crowded so we decided to try the Great Greek Im glad we stumbled on this gem   Great food with wonderful service.  Clean.   We both had grilled chix skewers with rice and greek salad.  Very good flavor.  My wife also had the rice pudding which she loved.  Staff attentive and polite. They clearly take pride in their shop, and focus on excellent customer service.  Cant wait to go again.

MqxMfUIiiPrVv_JebWI4ow.text: I usually always get the gyro, feta fries, and my gf gets the chicken souvlaki. Their Greek burger is not the best (had the fatty taste - not very appetizing).

g5gQA-bzqGkSJyqL9X8r6g.text: Sorry, I am GREEK, this will be considered MCDONALD's Greek Version. Save your money, it is mediocre @ best. I did tried twice, just to make sure I was given them the benefit of a cook off day. I guess it is o.k. if you do not know any better.
