qsfkNhsYEmxviUl7yRqEgA.text: Thee best Greek food in the state! The Hummus is to die for. Always very fresh food and an awesome staff!

q6xEFzk9skCFTZ9lJHeE6A.text: Great food!!  But again had to park to find no seats and a line. Had to eat elsewhere again.  Empty store right next door. Expand please

hkLCH_Kas9HZdXrA_ASIng.text: Consistently great food. Always busy and the service is exceptional. Fresh vegetables and meat cooked to order. Love it!

VtGClVFkHndykdZvp1Ia1g.text: Holy smokes! What a treat. Beef/lamb gyro was delicious but the feta fries were even more amazing. The owners are so friendly and warm. We felt like family. Don't let the strip mall appearance deceive you. Super-cool for dine in or take out. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll seek this out again.

LS4p34eD7z5-lwaFgaxRqQ.text: Came here with a friend for lunch a while back and it was packed so we went to Jason's deli across the way. This time I found a seat I ordered the Great Greek rice bowl which is a 9" bowl with a base of rice pilaf covered with Greek salad and two skewers of chicken. Everything was phenomenal. I really enjoyed the quality of the food. I ended up coming back the next day and ordering the falafel and tzakiki sauce. The falafels were some of the best I've tasted no exaggeration and the sauce actually came with a pity bread which the menu doesn't mention but was a pleasant surprise so I had some pita falafel sandwiches with tzakiki sauce fantastic. I will try everything on the menu eventually and I will also bring my girl here cause she loves this type of food. Oh yea the people that work there are awesome friendly and attentive I really like this place keep doing what you're doing guys n gals!

Sfg43oYjkGNWa0ABzvh-dw.text: Went for the first time last week and was very impressed. The food was fantastic. Would have loved a few more small pieces of pita with the kabab dinner, but it was nothing short of fantastic.

NHhDag7cummuYxZkBNHHcg.text: Best Greek food ever ! I always call ahead to place my order to take home and it's always ready when I get there , always busy but service with a smile , friendly family owned and food is so yummy ! I have tried the rice bowls , the chicken , shrimp, gyro meat all are great. The pasticcio is amazing , to me it's Greek lasagna enough for 2 to share with a salad , the great Greek gyro is always fresh and delicious!

NxjW-QZpGLfGfUO2WB4pbA.text: The GREAT Greek is worthy of its name would love to have this restaurant near me! Definitely worth it.

MrZIl7OfCGVZQNPjPQXQQg.text: It Really Is The Great Greek My husband surprised me one day when he said he wanted Greek food. I couldn't argue with him cause the idea sounded great to me! When we arrived at The Great Greek the little restaurant was very clean, inviting and the help was exceptional!! The place was a little busy but nothing to extreme. We ordered some Dolmades (grape leaves stuffed with seasoned rice and fresh herbs). These dolmades are some of the best around. The grape leaves were fresh, with a little crisp to them. The rice and herbs were well balanced. They came cold, even tho I prefer mine a little warm, but after a few minutes they were gone so it didn't matter! We also got a side of Hummus (garbanzo beans crushed with garlic, lemon juice and some olive oil). It wasn't bad but I've had better. For the meal we got a Falafel Pita (stuffed with falafel, hummus, lettuce, red onions, tomatoes and mint yogurt sauce, served with a side Greek salad) and a Gyro Plate (tender slices of Gyro with tzaziki sauce, pita, rice pilaf and a side Greek Salad). The Falafel was so soft and done perfect! I couldn't have wanted a better falafel! The combination of the falafel and all the other ingredients made for a healthy satisfying meal. My husband said the Gyro plate was really good as well. The meat was seasoned well! Although, I didn't try the meat, the rice was very tasty! To finish up the meal we got some Baklava (layers of filo dough, walnuts and cinnamon with honey). Seriously, the best baklava I have ever had...in my life!!! I would be very disappointed if I found out that they didn't make this in house. I've had plenty of homemade baklava, which has been very good, but this one tops them all! Overall the food was amazing, fresh and made to order! We have since been back and we will continue to go. So, if you want some great Greek food, head over to The Great Greek!!! You won't be disappointed! inapplesworld.blogspot.c...

c4lKK1oqD52HdbNPezQTbA.text: I had ordered The Great Greek Gyro with Grilled Chicken and Feta Fries. It was delicious!

sWC8yxvNQDzjoaRC9mGkag.text: I eat at this place regularly.  They have even catered a couple of events for me.  I have to say that it is the authenticity of the food and the service we get from Gerry that keep us coming back here!  You have to go at least once...You will be hooked!

NoHoAqW9_F990gyG0YWXmQ.text: There is love in this food. Family owned, casual restaurant. Worth the 30-minute one-way drive from my house. If I could only eat one thing for the rest of my life, it would be their Greek salad with chicken. The olive oil dressing is perfect. Also love the perfectly cooked gyro meat, the tzatziki and the feta fries!

Ljto4Hd5lI8oM4gQsVCLwA.text: I just moved out here (from Orlando, FL) 10 days ago.  In those 10 days I haven't had a meal that I would classify past substandard.  Not only did I just eat the best Gyro and Feta fries that I've ever had, It's also the best meal I've had since making the move.  I will definitely be coming back here weekly.

OPtOv8vCJDr8KtYqWvcR-A.text: If you're looking for fresh, flavorful Greek food.....look no further. This is without a doubt the best I have ever eaten. There is nothing on the menu that I didn't enjoy. I have been going there since it opened and it pleases me to see they are getting the recognition they deserve. Jerry and his mom Alice are always gracious as well as all of the other counter staff. I return as often as possible.

YjoJvrJPCpGAfOWiSZ_-Lg.text: Delicious. Love the gyros and the feta fries. A little pricey. Great customer service

x2fnKRDTHpbn32KQD2Wr5A.text: I ate there today with my kids and grandmother. She in in the early stages of dementia and acts out with unprovoked hatred and anger at the worst possible times, today at lunch was one of those...The food we ordered was all DELECIOUS! Service, unbelievable, they could not do enough to try to accommodate us. They were challenged today with an elderly customer who at first glance is a bitter old bitch, they were understanding and patient and no matter the insults being unjustly screamed-she complained about EVERYTHING, the yummy food, clean tables, great service etc. the young man and woman remained professional, kind and attentive. I would go back based on their authentic food alone but their customer service went well beyond amazing.  Thank you!!!!

5QembIW9UL6XPjygpcHw8w.text: This place is amazing!!!! The owners are really nice and the food is delicous. This is one of my favorite places to go with my husband.

LdsxCV3SiEC0K2HCWkgbFw.text: Had a great lunch here today! loved the food and service. I will definitely be back.

_Wv8AVW5ksCxffyuosu2jA.text: This is 1 of my top 2 Greek places in the Southwestern US.   Good: 1) the portions; 2) price; 3) taste; and 4) service.  Ok: 1) limited seating.  I had the falafel pita (that comes with fries or salad...salad was good), a side of dolmades, and a baklava. Wifey had the gyro plate. They gave us feta fries by accident and it was on the house. The lady at the front of the house was super nice, patient and took the time to explain the menu. It's a little outside LV but definitely worth the trip.

WoipXJ066REZCwhwuQniAg.text: One word. BOMB. 1st timer at a Greek mediterranean restaurant all though I had Gyros b4. Found out I been pronouncing it wrong this hole time but let's get to the point. Food was excellent, friendly service, definitely a Henderson crowd favorite. If u want to dine it, it's hard to find a seat during prime lunch hours. But 5 stars all the way.

QU8FPbXnuoHv-vIlktRBcw.text: Gimme a bucket of tsaziki and slather me up!  I have been absolutely craving Greek food for the past few weeks.  Maybe it's the upcoming festival season.  Maybe I'm getting tired of of my wife's cooking.  Uh, maybe I better shut up.  Whatever the impetus, I was determined to give this place a shot.    The lady at the register was really nice, despite having half the dining area overrun by my two monkeys.  They don't have kids meals, which posed a bit of a challenge in ordering, so be advised if you do have kids.  As a workaround, I decided to order the soulvaki plate with one skewer each of chicken and beef, with rice and a salad (about $11).  My wife opted for a gyro pita ($7.50) combo that came with fries (hey, don't judge) and a drink (add $2.50 for the combo).  +1 drink for me and our total was just under $25.    The food came out reasonably quick and smelled delicious.  The salad was fresh and refreshing, with just enough dressing for taste, not drowning in it.  The beef I ordered medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  Some steakhouses can't even get that right!  I don't know what kind of beef they use, but it was really tender and the seasoning was pitch perfect.  The chicken was also cooked ideally and oozed juices when cut into.  Of the two, the chicken was my favorite - whatever is in the marinade makes it sing.  The skewers sat on a bed of really tasty rice pilaf that seems to have some tang to it.  Add to that some of the best tsaziki sauce I've had and you're in business.  I could have slathered everything with it.    The kids were shoveling my rice and took about a third of my meats, so thinking I would be left hungry, I ended up ordering a third soulvaki chicken skewer ($3) and a side of rice ($2.50).  Of course, as soon as I paid for the extras, my kids say they're full.  Typical.  So what's a dad to do except scarf it all down myself?    Unfortunately, I ran out of tsaziki because I shared it (rare for me) with my wife, who, of course, didn't share any of her gyro pita with me.  But $0.75 for a side?  Yikes!  No matter how good it is, I can't justify paying that much for a small container.  The only thing more disappointing than running out of tsaziki was the fries.  Yeah, I know, who the heck orders fries at a Greek place?  Well, blame it on the kids.  Also, the pitas don't taste home made, but that's not a big deal to me, I'm just giving fair warning if that's a must have for you.  Despite the hardships I experienced, I overcame.  I used some creative ordering, decided never again to share the most cherished items on my plate and made a note to self to always leave the family at home.

1S-c5blO6kGnIFIUYTs4hg.text: So fresh and delish.  My husband and my favorite lunch spot on the weekend.  Closed Sundays :(

WYQoO5QuY0KRYnB-KYjdjA.text: I had a chance to try this place out and decided it was well needed.  I ordered a gyro platter, which I figured would give me a solid impression of the overall quality of the food. Their gyro meat is tender and moist, always a good sign for the hungry patron. Diced tomatoes complimented the meat well, which was PLENTIFUL. They served it on that standard white flatbread that you see at a lot of places. Not my favorite choice of bread but it was not problematic. The tasty cucumber yogurt sauce was authentic, as expected. The salad was pretty delish-- it had that ever so tasty olive in it and that yummy vinagrette dressing. Their rice had a nice wholesome taste to it but I wouldn't have minded a bit of extra seasoning in it. The fries were good but also could have benefited from some additional seasoning.  I'm very much looking forward to trying some of their kabob dishes and specialty salads in the near future.  Final verdict: good quality, authentic greek food, served in plentiful portions.

Mvo7rFJtLZMjXPC6fMGWFA.text: We love this place!  It is a very clean family owned restaurant and the pride in their work and food shows!  I am a VERY picky eater and have an allergy to cheese and I feel that they always take that seriously when I tell them No Cheese on anything of mine.  Thank you!  I also can't say enough about how good the food is here too.  I love the chicken kabobs and the shrimp ones are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!  I am a huge fan of their Greek Salad and their gyro meat as well.  We get carryout about 3 times per week and would eat here more often if we could.  :)

UeOJxs7o0Q-mhf5CPIpBOg.text: 4.5 stars. Very friendly service, fast to bring out the food and excellent gyros to boot! Highly recommend you check this place out as it's definitely one of the best gyros I've had in Vegas.

7yuoY5nqW7h5ptYlfKcMpA.text: They have the best Greek food here, everything we have tried is awesome.  I highly recommend getting the feta fries instead of regular fries if you get a side order.  The only thing is the kitchen seems too small for the amount of orders they get.  I have waited more than 30 minutes for my food on more than one occasion.  Beware, they get very busy.  I suspect that people got tired of waiting for their order and started calling in their order, because the entire time you are waiting you see tons of people coming in to pick up their large phone orders to go.  No matter what, the staff has always given nothing but the best service and the food is always consistently good.  I am going to phone in my order from now on instead of popping in for a quick bite, because that is almost never the case here.

RzyHWxclpv3taoOsJoO1tA.text: Always really fresh and awesome food , I can't help but to order the same thing .... I  CRAVE it! It's the best Greek place ice been to in Vegas !!

i8hwMfCZ7d91hBf77WJPaQ.text: I ate here for the first time yesterday, the food was AMAZING!!!  I could not believe how large the portions were for the price either.  I had to take half of my lunch in a to-go box.  The staff was extremely nice as well.

_pKj4LHfeisS1bMpUWitOA.text: YUM. Go try this food!!! This is some of the best Greek food I've had, and I've tried a lot! The avgolemono soup was awesome and definitely ranks high up there on some of the best I've tried. The tzatziki was just perfect, and not overly garlicky. The marinated chicken skewers were d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s.....tender, juicy, savory, and just delectable. The rice that came with the chicken was also amazing...buttery, flavorful, and so so good.  It looks like a family run place, and they're very service oriented. Very nice ambiance too--casual and modern, but still inviting enough to stay and eat. Highly recommended!!!

BYDq2g3EaM0nO4sfJI61Vg.text: Stopped in on our way back from Hoover dam. Friendly spot. Generous portions of Greek salad. Tasty gyros. Loved the feta fries!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

JrnG8aAMS3_n9-q8-rHrZA.text: I moved to the area about a year ago & instantly was in search of a good Greek restaurant. I stumbled upon The Great Greek and haven't gone to any other Greek restaurant since! The food is always fresh and the staff is always nice and welcoming. I recommend the Greek salad with gyro meat - such good portion sizes and soooo delicious! I love this place!!!

qytiSNHzZI4F2HQtr2IdNw.text: This place has some of the best Mediterranean food in the area. We usually get the chicken souvlaki plate, but the gyros, soup, and the falafel are all really good. They only thing about this place is that it's small, so seating can be hard to come by. Worth a wait, though.

BDWQspM9D3dzQC3K3FzP6Q.text: Doing some business in LV this week, and couldn't wait to come to this place. If the food is half as good as the reviews, this could be my favorite Greek restaurant.  The place is small... 4x4 tops and 4x2 tops, so make certain you arrive, eat, and then leave so someone else can have your table.  Good news... The Great Greek delivers! Ordered the Greek Salad (Large) with a beef skewer and it was fantastic. Quick, fresh, awesome!  Here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes Return? Yes Advocate? YES!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Greek for lunch!

T5rzoz_teBqlMGdWou0CZg.text: We lived in the Henderson area for about 2.5 years now and haven't been able to check this place out until last night. Well let me tell you didn't disappoint! It was so good! Haven't had some real good tasting home since we've moved from the east coast. Definitely will be returning for some more!

mKJlz7B_bskwIYZj1TMb6Q.text: I have eaten a lot of Greek food in my life, but this place stands out. The Spanakopita was amazing. The Gyro was amazing! And the Baklava was on another level amazing!

JS8frnyjzpisrhzIziqrRA.text: Absolutely amazing flavor and attractive service consistently. The Traditional Gyro is my go to lunch!

ynusGwzvlKrxDtx2iMXrNQ.text: YUM...YUM....YUM!! Food is always amazing and the price is so reasonable for what you get. This is my go to for tasty, good quality food!

u59EunTwG5TW_ycoGGWxlw.text: Great pastitsco I have had, since the ladies from the greek church. Very delicious food and large portions so plan on a to go box. Best greek food I have had in las vegas.

Mfq5FZ0rFkYhXp9JLpWKGQ.text: Better than average veggies.  Hubby loved the rice bowl.  Falafel in my salad was the best I've ever had.  Great crunchy outside, but nice and thin so you get a lot of the moist yummy inside.  Juicy lemons on the side were delicious.  Loved the eggplant dip.  I wish they had whole wheat pita and brown rice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Large salad with falafel
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Rice bowl with chicken

bvW2iJBGTRFg2yLKvv3pWA.text: Found this place by chance while visiting in the area. I will be back the next time I'm in town. Reasonable prices and amazing food. It was the BEST!

-Mgwycby_ERbMHQIOhXraw.text: Don't let the setting fool you, the best Greek you can find - even when traveling with a self-proclaimed "food snob".  The staff ladies were friendly and prompt, even when busy. Everything was fresh and tasty. Will be making the same stop the next time we are in the Vegas area!

tyesQ--UVv2xh-ZA6rjYjg.text: I'm not from here so I'm sad to say I won't be able to come back. This place is awesome! The staff is super friendly and very helpful. I'm he restaurant is very clean with a bright cherry atmosphere. They have a patio for outdoor dinning or you can sit inside the restaurant. They serve wine and beer along with fountain drinks and an assortment of bottled drinks. I had the avgolemono soup and a lamb rice bowl. I wasn't expecting the servings to be sooooo big! Everything was fresh and delicious! Eat here and you won't be disappointed!! Promise!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

mB6bkw3dOqTBeXmAkKaR8w.text: The food is very good however the wait time was ridiculous. They forgot our order. We were literally sitting 3 feet from the front counter. You would think someone would notice two girls sitting there with water cups and a table number and no food for over 28 minutes. Five tables that came in after us got served and had almost finished eating before we got our small salad. After going up to the counter to find out the status of our order, there was no apology, no offer of a free drink, free dessert, or how about a piece of pita bread while you wait for us to process your order? Totally unacceptable.

uUtb3I7X5oJRxW02OxsU7A.text: Um, so, this place had the best Greek food I have ever tasted in my life?! I was overwhelmed by their menu because I wanted everything. I even had trouble ordering because my mind was trying to process all the goodness lol. It all sounded soo good, they all looked delicious and fresh. I ended up getting the gyro wrap and feta fries. The wrap was superb, FULL of fresh veggies and meat, and topped with a load of feta YUM! I got a chance to try my friends garlic shrimp skewer and that was delicious as well--perfectly cooked shrimp. Hummus was wonderful and didnt have that over the top sourness to it, which I personally like. And the staff was so nice and helpful! Cant wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

VaxEkGQ54-YmzrWwgYLgvQ.text: This is the only Greek restaurant I will ever go to. I have been going her forever now and the people are so nice. The customer service is amazing and they remember people. The food is amazing and i've never had a bad experience. Always delicious and I would recommend to everyone.

Dtl4MqZRdWMNZ_CmE0WMbQ.text: Amazing! Such. Great service, even better food! So fresh, so crisp! First time here but I will be returning. Inside and outside seating. Great menu selection. Easy to read. With plenty of customization options.   We had the two kabob plates with rice, warm pita, and a side of Greek salad. Huge and delicious portions. Chicken was cooked perfectly. Grilled  crunchy but soft on the inside.Rice well cooked too. The salad was my favorite. Just the right amount of every ingredient with every bite.    We opted for sitting outside since it was nice that day. They brought our food to the table. Had a great time. They are well priced and with the amount of food you get its well worth every penny.

g_R-lYGhP6FF-wA2y4A9AQ.text: I am always on the hunt for great Mediterranean food....and great is what this place is! Upon walking in, there was a line and a few folks on the phone on hold, so I had a feeling we'd hit the jackpot. It's not super easy to find and is located next to a couple other restaurants, so I'm sure you have to serve something top notch to stay in business here.  I had their world famous rice bowl which had generous portions that left me feeling full and satisfied. Their rice isn't typical, and is cooked to form a very soft, tasty texture.  Whatever they're doing, it's delicious and worth a million bucks!   Joe C. had the gyro plate which came with a massive salad and a bunch of delicious feta fries. The friendly ladies and the made to order business model makes it my favorite Greek place in Henderson!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro rice bowl - yum!

-rIjSwKyDFCSUSShZxFhyA.text: While visiting Henderson with my family on vacation, we stumbled across this little gem.  It's a little hole-in-wall place but is absolutely huge on quality and flavor!  My daughter had the gyro plate and I had the lamb souvlaki plate...both were absolutely delicious!  Quite frankly, everything from the Greek salad to the rice pilaf was outstanding.  We have a few Greek restaurants that we frequent back home in San Diego...but none come close to being as good as this place.  If you're staying in Las Vegas/Henderson and you like...no, love Greek food then you absolutely have to try this place.  We can't wait to come back!

87i-yl7Pmz39ZcIv7pErPw.text: I was passing thru town on a cross country trip.  Got a Greek salad with a chicken skewer and feta fries.  It was absolutely delicious.  Tasty and filling.  And the service was outstanding.  I would eat here anytime!  What a find!

D9vepbsh8og-MM0MT-Vblw.text: Recommended by my sister in law... And she got this one dead spot on...  Some of the best Greek I've eaten in a very long time.   Recommend everything!

DgNhfjq53y_JXbFLBLzMTQ.text: Great rice pudding. Their salad is good and gyro was decent. I will definitely try this place again. It was clean and had very good customer service.

V37I5-1vkbgtlHksYqNBOg.text: I love this place; great, fresh food & friendly workers. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because they do not have vegetarian options. I asked if they could make vegetable skewers & they said they couldn't, while other places like Crazy Pita (even though they don't have veggie options) will normally accommodate me & whip up some veggie-friendly meal. So I will love this place a little bit more when they get some veggie options. So please do!!

tlYIqLZIeCwDM4bXk6JV5Q.text: I was literally stunned by such a great food in a completely randomly chosen place. On the way back from Hoover Dam, we were looking for something to eat without going into Las Vegas. The photos looked quite promising so we decided to give it a shot.  Now, food is excellent. I mean it. I got falafil plate along with a rice and a side of greek salad. Rice is not overcooked, more on the al dente side, and salad tastes absolutely authentic. Tzatziki sauce is absolutely remarkable, paired perfectly with both my falafil and my gf's shrimps. She got a side of Feta fries, that melted enough to stratch, but did not made fries soggy at the same time; excellent timing.  The only single drawback, the table we choose wasnt clean when we took it, however, I dont think that's something that might affect 5star rating. Although the place is quite small, staff is absolutely dedicated and very friendly. If I was living or working in the area I would definitely visit this place quite often.  Thank you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Shrimp Souvlaki
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Falafil Plate

MFMF1Z3jNoZ5rr9L23bcYw.text: Is it just me, or are there more Greek restaurants in Vegas than there are in Greece? For that reason, it takes a little more for your typical Greek place to stand out, especially when it's more of a fast casual order at the counter type of place. I'm happy to report, this place is one of the better ones.  Gyro meat is cut right from the spit and is moist and well seasoned. Pita bread is pillowy soft. The feta fries are incredible, somehow managing to maintain their crispness under a delicious load of melty cheese and spices. Definitely worth ordering.  Unfortunately I didn't get to experience that great customer service everyone seems to be raving about, but the staff was fine and functional. It was busy and they did have someone front of house to make sure the tables were clean and ready for the next customers.  All in all, worth a stop for a casual and tasty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro wrap with feta fries.

wyUjOWQ7V8svRD5_T6E0sA.text: I've had a few good meals here in the past with friends and felt this review overdue. It's also fast for to-go orders and the tzatziki sauce is great. Humus is also fresh and delicious. Gyro plate is always good. Service is fast when dining in and out and always very nice.

aTzUKj8w8gqpJ_oPDQ-D4Q.text: The food and service were outstanding!! We both had the gyro salads and the meat portion (in the small size salad) was incredible. Dressing was a really good flavor and pita bread was delicious!

4nbbUPfjALzzWZfunRwL0A.text: This is a simple, yet a passionate Greek food business operated by the best customer service oriented staff. We have been here several times and it has always delivered consistent, quality, fresh, and delicious food along with superior service. We ordered Hummus, Melizanosalata, Grilled Garlic Shrimp, Pasticcio, fresh salads, Rice pudding, and Greek cookies. Every ingredient was FRESH and delicious for all the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Excellent 1/2 pound Angus burger n delicious feta fries.
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Garlic Shrimp is always perfect n delicious
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Pasticcio is like a beef lasagna, delicious

w3FCGuCDKhRfKeQPbxOWvg.text: Gyros sandwich has zero flavor, very stingy with the meat. They load it up with tomatoes and onions. I will not be going back to this place!

1N-KLb_9q0Vdz6u0cgrLBw.text: When it comes to Las Vegas, they have no shortage of Mediterranean cuisine on offer, both in and off the Strip. However, when it comes to Greek food in particular, everyone and their mother seems to have their own definition of what's good or not. For me, finding my favorite Greek place came about as a sheer accident -- I was in the area when I found out about the Great Greek back when it opened a few years ago. I stopped in to try the place, and I've been hooked ever since. Needless to say, this is one of my personal favorite restaurants in town, though it's only now that I'm reviewing this place for Yelp.  Ever since that fateful visit, the Great Greek has since expanded to Centennial and West Henderson, though for me the original location behind the Sunset Station has been my go-to spot for Greek food whenever and wherever! During this visit I came with my mother, and so this review summarizes both her experience and mine. We ordered the tirokafteri as a starter, the lamb souvlaki, the steak and shrimp mixed souvlaki grill, and baklava ice cream for dessert.  During our visit, we had a few issues that came up that made us wonder if their service quality had dropped -- the first is that our food took far too long for us to receive, even after people who ordered after us were getting their food before we got it. Another issue is that my mother specifically wanted her Greek salad as a side to her meal, instead of it being served at the start of the meal like it normally was. Instead, she still got her salad but there was no side that came out with her order when we FINALLY received it. After we talked to the servers at the time, they put in our order as a rush order and also provided additional rice pilaf for my mother, which was enough to placate us ( though we still had another moment of one of the servers asking if we wanted our ice cream so soon after getting our food. Really? ).  Anyway, to the food itself! Of course I've been a regular here for quite some time, so I know that the food is good. But to just state as such wouldn't be convincing: the tirokafteri was the perfect blend of creamy, salty and spicy, and was perfect with the pita bread. The lamb was juicy and perfectly cooked and the rice fluffy and flavorful -- my mother also mentioned that her shrimp and steak were among the best skewers in town. Of course, there's also the dessert -- the baklava ice cream was cool, sweet and refreshing, with large pieces of baklava clearly visible in the dessert. I believe this is house-made? Either way, I have never seen any other dessert like it in town!  The Great Greek is always popular to a ridiculous degree -- even with their expansions into the southwest and in the northwest, their Henderson location still remains busy, with lines sometimes stretching outside the door! That and this review should be hopefully enough to convince you to go despite any potential service hiccups -- your new favorite Greek spot is waiting!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. The shrimp and steak skewers. Also good, though my mother dug in before I got the picture...
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Baklava ice cream. 5/5 -- perfect for anytime, really! GET THIS, THANK ME LATER.
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb souvlaki with rice pilaf, tzatziki and pita bread. 5/5 -- just a spectacular plate of food!

kxnM-niaAyrq4YCHsm1pVA.text: This place is the most friendliest restaurant I have ever been to. We were so happy we passed by. We had a lovely time; the food was absolutely delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. We were so happy we passed by .

eJLiW1O58ShyWC91Ty78DA.text: Family operated. GeT service. Food tastes great and good portions. Definitely recommend the feta fries.  Its one of my go-to's when treating myself to solo time or one on one time with one kiddo.  Kids plate have plenty of food as well. No one goes hungry.

Sue-LpmeT7vxWcjkL4ljTA.text: I must say I eat at this Fabulous Restaurant or take out at least once a month. I am always satisfied how good and consistent the food is. The service is always spot on. If I could I would give them six stars, I would. I recommend this Great Greek Restaurant as one of The GREAT Las Vegas places to dine.

tuNJg57DIbe8G9ZOKiJ4bA.text: I tried the steak entree plate that came with a side salad, pita bread, 2 skewers of steak, and their yogurt sauce (forgot the name).   I think my first mistake was that I order the steak "well done" as I hate raw steak but I hadn't realized that it was sirloin steak. The steak was chewy and honestly I almost choked on it. The side salad and it's dressing was really good except I bit into an olive not knowing there was a seed in it! Good thing I didn't break my tooth!   The food was just okay.   On the other hand, I order a piece of baklava and oohhh my goodness gracious, I'm not even a sweets lover, but dayum this dessert was top notch! The top was flaky and as you got to the bottom of the piece it would get more and more sweet. But not too sweet as I believe it's sweetened with honey. It was like. So. Good. I was supposed to share half with my boyfriend but I ate the whole thing! Whoopsie!  So my advice is to skip the food and just buy the baklava! Next time I'm going to try the baklava ice cream because that looked really good too!

W6jBT61GmquuwopeonQtfA.text: The food is really good, staff are very nice and helpful, the place is clean. The only think I didn't like was the I ordered grape leave and they do serve them there cold. I prefer my warm. Which I would recommend if you are going there make sure to tell them on the time of ordering. Beside that everything was great!!! I will definitely will go back to try another dish from their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

q6DzGVt4nfg9j65AfKiiLw.text: I've been here exactly three times in the past two days, that's how much I'm diggin' The Great Greek.   They have ah-mazing vegetarian options. And while I usually go straight for the falafel at greek places, I find it pretty lacking here. I found it too dry and kinda bland. I also generally go for hummus, but I found it pretty unmemorable. HOWEVER, their salad wrap, greek salad with grilled salmon, and tzaziki sauce are amazing options I definitely recommend. And grabbing an order of feta fries is a MUST. Ridiculously crispy and simultaneously fluffy, these are fries are seriously delicious. The quality is decent, the taste is great, and the price is just right.  Also, while the service is friendly, you may not get your food super fast since this place is poppin'. Expect a lil' wait since it's made to order and enjoy the fresh options The Great Greek has to offer.

5qK4iAFEaMsa97Ucz-Ky0Q.text: As I step up to the cashier,  "Hey John, your salad is 15-seconds from coming out--15 seconds later--boom, here you go" I come here so often they know my name now?!  Update: Jack and Felicia are pretty awesome.   I come back to The Great Greek every Friday when I work on this side of town. They do every thing right at this location. They are friendly, fast, considerate and the food --is absolutely fantastic--  I always order my typical large greek salad, with gyro. I order online so when I show up food is good to go. Sure enough, by the time I drive from my office to the restaurant my food is ready. I commend the staff at this place because they are always so busy but they always get things out in a timely manner.    My order is always to-go but I end up sitting outside to eat. The girl who works on friday afternoons always stops by and asks if I need anything else. This is wonderful, she acknowledges that I might not be "dining-in" but she still cares about my experience at their location. Kudos to you for great customer service.   The restaurant is also very clean. The bathrooms are clean (yay). The staff at The Great Greek takes pride in where they work obviously. They may get busy but they definitely get the job done right and well.   Thank you guys! I'll see you on Friday haha.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

FjZqP0hceaelFVTVzaIHhg.text: Always had good food here, however the last time I got take out, I asked for extra taziki and was told I would be charged. Which I thought was weird since we were not given one per entree. The lady behind the counter said her manager would be mad if She gave me extra. Really?! Then when I got home, a fly flew out of my to go container. With all the other Greek restaurants around, I won't be back.

z7xCzZ-GWHC6R5eGa0Pp5w.text: Food was great & good size portions very tasty and the people who work here a very friendly. I recommend this restaurant highly. Try the Gyro and the filet mignon you won't be disappointed.

FVko-6D21-LT0-86wltw1A.text: Overall: The Great Greek serves up good Greek food, and everyone seems to know so don't be surprised if there aren't any seats!  Food: 4  Grilled Chicken Souvlaki: The chicken was moist with a nice grilled flavor. The rice was fluffy and separated, just how I like it, but it's not as flavorful as the rice at my favorite kabab place. A lot of places seem to skimp on the quality of their pita bread, but their pita bread was fluffy and soft.  Grilled Steak Souvlaki: The steak was tender and moist. I enjoy the grilled flavor on meats, but they took it slightly to far and some edges were burnt and bitter.  Both our plates were on the saltier side (in terms of meat and rice), but it became well balanced when eaten with the light tzatziki and acidic salad.  Service: 3  The restaurant is quick service, so you order at the counter and servers will bring out your dish if it's eat in.  The servers were nice. I didn't realize that there was feta cheese on the salads so I didn't specify no cheese during my order, but they were still nice enough to exchange our salads for us. Even though it's quick service, the staff was nice enough to stop by and ask us about our meal occasionally.  However, the cashier did seem to have a little bit of an attitude. She made a face when another customer ripped open a packet of sugar and ate it alone.  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant is fairly small but super busy. As a result, it may be difficult to find seating inside the restaurant. They do have some nice tables outside with umbrellas, but I'm not a fan of sitting in the heat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Side Salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Grilled Steak Souvlaki Plate
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Grilled Chicken Soulvaki Plate

CfFgF8fFoq7jmwcPFF-EuQ.text: Now this place is good!  I had always been a fan of Greek Bistro down the road but since ownership changed, I haven't been going as often.  I stopped in here for lunch one day and got a gyro meat rice bowl, baklava, and a fountain drink.  The bowl consisted of rice pilaf, gyro meat, tomatoes, chickpeas, onions, tzatziki sauce, and lemon and it was outstanding.  The amount of meat that came with it was a welcome sign and boy was it flavorful!  The baklava, while good, wasn't as good as others I've had before.  After adding the drink, my meal came out to about $20 which for lunch is quite pricey.  If the prices were a bit lower I could easily see myself eating here weekly because I enjoyed my meal that much.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro Greek rice bowl.

ZjzdYiTvc2uhGqIc9J1TEw.text: Whole visiting Vegas we took a detour and were introduced to this spot. What a delight!  Legitimate and tasty Greek classics. We had hummus and pita, chicken and steak souvlaki, rice, feta fries, along with desserts. Everything was amazing.   This is an order at the front restaurant and have a seat. But they cook to order, bring out your food and clear your tables so don't forget to tip!  Now more about the food:  hummus and pita were great, the steak souvlaki was perfectly cooked and the rice was good. The feta fries were my favorite. Never had anything like that and what a treat. The desserts were also a hit.   I can't wait for this place to open a big sit down restaurant.  Do it!

DSadYzLMCcLLfYdqGJaBZg.text: Love this restaurant because the people there are genuinely nice, the food is served hot, and the food served is always delicious!   I highly suggest getting there for an early dinner or late lunch! It's a smaller restaurant and always busy during normal eating times, so I normally take our food to go when the tables inside and outside are taken. The wait can be a bit long, but they're sweet enough to offer cups for water while you're waiting! (I suggest ordering ahead, which I always forget to do!)   Food:  Everything I see come out looks amazing and everything I've ordered so far has been delicious. The meats are normally tender and juicy and all salads are crisp and refreshing! (Hate when you bite into a salad and don't get the crunch or texture you hope for!)  I normally get the Great Greek Gyro or the Gyro plate because the meat is so tender and juicy! Add the fries because they are always the perfect amount of softness with a slight crunch! Add the hummus and pita bread for appetizers! YUM!  Overall, I'd say it's a delicious place to eat at or take food to go from.  Short, simple review for a simple food turned up a notch from this restaurant!

VeY5qqLT742dzLr89AW0qQ.text: I went there once and that would me the last time. The management is very rude and extremely un organized. Do not waste your time and money to go to this over crowded zoo.

wfLOF3dvLPgm8YCKIyoxqQ.text: Crazy. Good. Food. Seriously, the best gyros I've ever had, and being a former Chicagoan I've had quite a few. (Gyros, that is.)  The pitas were so fresh, the meat was flavorful and juicy...and the tzatziki...oh what a tzatziki it was. If I could have rolled myself in it, I probably would have.

qhOrYD4-DfGACHbp-b8Pmg.text: So let me start off by saying that I used to manage a small family owned Greek restaurant back in Florida, and in my opinion, we had the best gyros I've ever had. Coming from a large Greek family, I've tried a lot of different gyros. But today, having eaten at the great Greek for the first time, I have found my new favorite Greek restaurant. It's a small, family owned place with beyond amazing customer service, perfect atmosphere, and some of the best Greek food I've ever tried.  I've also never taken the time to actually sit down a write a review of a place for Yelp, but this restaurant was so good, I wanted to be able to share my thoughts. If you're looking for a place to eat, please go here!

uIPAoOYD-ojZ8zs5canMRg.text: This place is so stupid good it doesn't make any doggone sense. Like, seriously... Yes, it's the bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Rice bowl with chicken - Boooomb!

S2XW-OYhXoPjoCY-W3db1A.text: waited for 20 mins for food as people who ordered after me were getting their food they ordered. dont go here unless you want to spedn your whole day waiting for food.

yyRTDi1PTSTvh3l-GZK7tQ.text: Just ate the the great Greek for the first time and had a great Greek gyros with beef/lamb. The meat was clean, the feta and sauce taste fresh and light. I'm happy I stumbled on the this little gem. Can't wait to come back to taste other items on the menu. The staff here was very welcoming and fun to talk to. If you are in town make sure you come out and try this place.

linQ5eT8XnrZklR-KE-l_g.text: This is usually my favorite Greek restaurant but the last time I was there was so disappointing. I got there 5 minutes before they opened but they let me in and took my order. More people came in and started ordering. They all started getting their food and I'm still sitting there waiting for my order. After waiting for 25 minutes(20 minutes after they are open), I asked them how much longer it was going to be. They said because I ordered before they opened, they didn't have the chicken prepared yet at the time I ordered so they were still waiting for the chicken(that makes no sense they start prepping at opening time and not before?) I asked if it took more than 20 minutes to cook chicken so she said she will check on it. I got my order almost 10 minutes later. I don't think it should take 30 minutes for a Greek salad with chicken and rice bowl with chicken. Specially when a party of about 10 people came in after I did are almost finished eating their food that they ordered after I did. I only gave them 3 stars because I like their food. Otherwise, it would've been 1 star

vhS4gpIuZDD2ThH3bRT95Q.text: I love the chicken rice bowl here! So amazingly clean and yummy. Chicken is so tender. The young guy at register is always so nice! Great customer service!

RipLvMNyrbBF4eFN-ICFDg.text: Since my last visit this place can keep 5 shiny stars. The are definitely worthy. Service was great last night and the food was delicious as usual. Went for the same steak souvlaki plate to share. Meat was tender and delicious. Feta fries were crispy , savory and melt in your mouth. We tried the soup this time. So comforting.  Definitely don't get a huge lemon flavor but it's there. It's so comforting and hits the spot. I can see myself coming here in the cold months and ordering 2 bowls it's so good. We also tried spanakopita which was good as well. Crispy phyllo dough with spinach and cheese the bitterness of the spinach could have used some more cheese IMO but nonetheless still yummy. Last but not least we had some Baklava .  Oh my gosh ! I thought I died and went to heaven. This was absolutely delicious. Layers of phyllo dough and ground walnuts and honey. I heard they only use honey and not sugar. I'm glad because I can't handle things that are overly sweet. This was perfect. So delicious. I will be back great Greek. Next time I will try and order something other than the steak. I've stuck to it because it's just that good.

The wait staff advised that everyone loves their gyros, however, he also was able to recommend a delicious salad/rice/any type of meat plate which o chose. The lamb was seasoned to perfection, the salad was fresh with an abundance of veggies and the rice was very flavorful. I couldn't finish the whole plate.  Can't wait to finds self stranded and hungry on Henderson again!

dZ-rDT1ENYnnaSj3DiYGNQ.text: Stopped by around 6pm and ordered The Great Greek Gyro ($7.95) with chicken.  Unfortunately It took somewhere between 20-25 minutes to get my food!  This would have been okay at a sit down restaurant but at a order at the counter sort of place I feel that 25 minutes is way too long. Seemed a little unorganized between the kitchen and cash register which really shouldn't have been going on considering there were only about 4 tables full and a few to go orders placed.   I was pretty HANGRY (hungry and angry) by the time I got home but after my first bite almost all was forgiven!! Delicious chicken with just the right amount of feta and tzatziki sauce! Probably the best gyro I have ever had so despite how long it took I have to give the Great Greek 4 stars and return again hoping for faster service. During the long hiatus before I got my food I also noticed that they had a great beer selection (Hoegaarden, Guiness, IPA, Stella)  so maybe I will come back for a sit down with a gyro and beer next time.

xHlOgpq5SjwkPS8OTU62XA.text: Very happy with last few times. I changed my times to not go during their busy lunch times. Now Togo orders are perfect. Great food as always.

lxKlfQxiQU4WOnxwYoMAGA.text: We love the Great Greek! The service is always fast and the food delicious. Having Celiacs it's not always easy to find delicious gluten free meals when I go out to eat. We eat here about once a week! I love that they really listen and don't put the pita on my place because of my allergy. Some restaurants will accidently put it on and then remove it but I still have a reaction to it. I've not once had this happen at the Great Greek and they always take special care to make sure the pita is not any where close to my plate! I love the steak souvlaki on the plate of rice. The side salad is comes with is a traditional Greek salad. After starting with the salad I usually take half my meal home and enjoy it all over again the next day!

No personality, acted as if she was doing us a favor, from the get go as soon as we walked up all we got was attitude instantly. As a person in the food and beverage industry this is no way to treat a guest at your establishment. Will not be returning here any longer.

g5tVSfUdH-N9OGIyoWrDXg.text: Came here for lunch a couple of days ago. What a nice surprise it turned out to be. The location is very clean and inviting with large windows to let in the sunshine. The staff was very friendly and quick to bring out the food. I had the grilled shrimp entree. The shrimp were huge, and perfectly seasoned. Delicious!! It came with a nice Greek side salad, and the entree came with a bed of rice, a side of fresh pita bread, and tzatziki. My husband tried the Great Greek Gyro. It was huge!! Came stuffed with a generous portion of beef/lamb and very fresh lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese and tzaski. Ordered a side of Feta french fries that were to die for. Never had anything quite like them. The fries were crisp, fresh and hot. Definitely give these a try. To end the meal we ordered an amazing "Mom's" rice pudding. this dessert was fresh still warm and topped with cinnamon. Some of the best I've ever had!! If you like Greek food. definitely give this place a try. It is delicious food, with reasonable prices and huge portions served by a very friendly staff.

Other than that everything was really really great!!  Clean environment to eat & enjoy food!  Good portion  Fresh and delicious salad Amazing Hummus and pita ( pita was warm... omg so good) Very friendly staffs   Don't hesitate to try here! It'll be worth it!! RECOMMENDED

Hop_6SvMwLLKUZ7TYVutWw.text: The food was great and the man that help us was awesome but I wasn't intending on spending $55 dollars for lunch in the mall food court that's all.

K89A3oQZNUOzjQ0e_avCPQ.text: Again, Amazingly delicious every time. The best greek food in town. Always fresh with deep flavors and great prices. Doesn't matter what location I visit. Both the same quality and service.

qZWmmr-1mUK4bWph7YDYSQ.text: FUN local place with impeccably fresh and authentic tastes of Greece.   Order at the counter, and be prepared to do as the locals do:  when the restaurant is full get your food to go or ask to share a table.   The line to order can stretch out the door, but moves quickly and efficiently. Lots of cooks in the kitchen on a Friday night -- we saw 6 -- cooking as fast as they  could in a kitchen we could see was stocked with authentic quality ingredients.   Kids meals re the perfect side for smaller tummies but don't dumb down for Americans: choices are 1/2 gyros, 1/2 souvlakis and other smaller portions of Greek favourites -- no chicken nuggets or grilled cheeses. TWO THUMBS UP FROM US!!   One of us had the beef souvlaki and asked that the steak be cooked rare, and IT WAS!! So many Greek places seem to be unable to cook steak rarer than medium, so we were excited! The steak was tender, deliciously seaoned, and did we say RARE??  The cup of Avgolemono soup comes studded with rice and chicken, served with a quartered pita on the side. It is easily enough for a light meal, and was so delicious we took what we couldn't finish back to the hotel to finish with breakfast tomorrow.   A side of falafel arrived fried perfectly, not greasy at all, and spiked with cardamom for extra YUM.   Two of us got the Great Greek Original Rode Bowls -- large Greek salads with a scoop of yummy rice pilaf.  These salads were made with perfectly crisp fresh leaf lettuce, seasoned chickpeas, small diced red onions, tangy pitted Kalamata olives, and a meat (chicken or beef souvlaki or gyro meat)  or fish of your choice (salmon or shrimp) or falafel, all dressed in tangy and lemony Greek dressing. DELICIOUS!!   We got an order of fresh homemade Koftiedes cookies to go.   We HEARTILY RECOMMEND this restaurant -- Henderson locals have a gem in this place!!
