OswlM1InGeJ1KUG9AoaEFA.text: Fantastic food, the service was fast and very friendly.  We will seek them Out on our next vacation to Las Vegas

YVqnZse8R_ITxeIURKSV1w.text: I cannot believe I have not reviewed this place before. We have been coming here for literally years. We only moved to Henderson about one year ago, but this place is close to our office here that we visited many times before and we used to only eat here. Solid, authentic, tasty Greek food. I LOVE the chicken lemon soup. The Greek salad is good too - they use good, real feta unlike other places. I usually get chicken skewers that are yummy and juicy too. The crazy fries are amazing - the French fries are very tasty and the crazy fries have feta on top that melts and tastes like a dream. Ok - I am done now. Just thinking about this place and my mouth is watering

WnVaJhIsUyQVRPBCW3Zjmg.text: I love love this place the food is amazing BUT if you order to go becareful, the foil container they use to put the salad in sliced my thumb! Would hate for a child or anyone to have to experience this!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

ulUvAyJ_vi_Q75QN5BLmtQ.text: Hands down the best restaurant in Nevada. The customer service is always on top. The food comes out hot and prepared beautifully. I come in multiple times and have never had an issue with my order or stay. If I could give the restaurant and food 100 star rating I would!!

CYbwWkAQKSltKrdNgdvQNQ.text: This place is our family go to place for Greek food! The hummus is very creamy and the gyro great Greek bowl is my go to item. It never disappoints.

SWd4tvGNEFYUyYGBj5wveA.text: Nice clean place with excellent food.   It is well  worth it to make the trip...especially on a nice day where you can sit outside with a gyro and a beer...hey, it's not Greece, but, close your eyes, and let the food make it so...

pQc7W-srKRMscJSGXqrJOA.text: If I could give 6 stars I would. My wife and I dine here several times a month and are never disappointed. Everything is always fresh and well prepared. If we have any complaints at all it would be for them to add humus and tabouli. Would also like to comment on the great service. Thanks guys.

ZfCScgLL9wh6ewJIMB9vIw.text: I admit it, I cheated yesterday. And unfortunately it wasn't worth it! I was on the way to Greek Bistro, my usual gyro place when I drove past Great Greek. I remember seeing many great Yelp reviews so decided to give them a try. It was not busy when I arrived around noon.   The girl at the register was all business. Not unfriendly, but not friendly either. I ordered the Great greek gyro with the infamous feta fries and a drink. It was around $12.50 for the combo. I received my order in a decent amount of time. The pita was good, nice and soft. However the meat was really dry. I thought the feta fries were completely overrated, maybe I had a bad batch? The fries seemed under cooked to me. The meal was okay, but definately nothing I would return for.   I will stay True to Greek Bistro as I think their gyros and seasoned fries are much much better.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great greek gyro with feta fries

Qd11QhFj1dV_Bw7bPcWSqw.text: Another stop at The Great Greek while staying in Vegas. This time around I stayed on the strip and let me tell you, the 30 minute drive is worth it!!   Chicken gyro today was delicious  see you next time!

e0sn37p6ZvK6zMHlgXfkOw.text: Great food, great service, a little pricey. Tried this place just to check it out.  I like Mediterranean food as I am from that area and have been there several times.  I know what authentic Mediterranean food is, although I dont really care if it is, as long as its good.  This place was busy for lunch and everyone seemed to be enjoying their food.  You know its good when you order something, and see another persons food come out and youre like "damn, I should have gotten that too".  Its an order at the counter place, like McDonalds.  My only gripe is when places like this charge fine dining prices.  My lunch combo was $17 after a 15% tip for a walk up order.  Inside is just basic.  A tv, some tables, and thats it.  Ambiance level 0/10.  Service was 10/10.  Every guy in there, and I dont know how they do it for a fast food place, seemed genuinely happy to serve the customers and had a great attitude.  I notice things like this because its rare, but this place would not be the same without these guys working.  They are great.  Food was excellent and tasted great.  Not authentic at all, but I didnt go in for that.  I went for good tasting food and this was great.  Portion sizes were super small.  $4 for fries and it was like those little kid condiment trays.  I would say I got 10 fries.  Those 10 fries are probably the best in the county though.  They do the double spray potato method on them and were crisp to perfection.  No joke, best fries anywhere in town.  My gyro was also super small.  For $8, it was just a kids size pita.  Again, the taste was great.  I got the lamb, my girl got a steak kabob which was excellent.  Hers was really small too.  I am a baklava fanatic.  Its one of the only deserts I like.  I get it in every Mediterranean country I go to and I get it a lot.  $4 is steep, but they are bigger than traditional baklava.  Not authentic and harder to eat, but the taste is the same.  Despite it not being authentic, I really enjoyed it.  Great consistency, great taste.  Overall, this place is overpriced but the food and service is worth it.  If yo are on a tight budget, you might not have the same experience.  If you are looking for a romantic dinner, go somewhere else.  If you are looking for 5 star service, and really good food, give this place a try.  I will probably come back just based on the service.

krC43tft0JJC4SDoeP971w.text: I've been here twice in the past few months, and definitely plan on coming back in the future. The staff is friendly, the food is excellent, and the prices are reasonable -- especially given the portion sizes.  The only thing that keeps them from getting five stars is the slow service I had on my past visit (I was wondering if they were growing the potatoes for my feta fries) and the "well done" quality of those same fries (i.e. almost burnt cheese on top). That said, they were still delicious and my gyro was excellent.  If you still have room afterwards, try the baklava. It is very good with a good amount of filling, not all filo dough like some places.

vttoR8O9QGc3ci7rIHpHKg.text: Great place! I got the Gyro Plate and some dolma which was just what I wanted. Still hot and served with pita and my choice of rice or fries, which I enjoyed the rice. I got a side salad with my order and it was super fresh and crispy. Mind you this was all through Grubhub, so I never expect it to be so fresh. Yet it definitely was. I'll be going in to check it out furthermore.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

1h6rd2sNmm_YELaWbwdmUw.text: Wow!  Just Wow, I eat a low carb diet and was able to substitute the pita bread with veggies (cucumbers) ordered a salad with lamb- everything was super fresh!  Loved the lamb, eggplant dip!!!  Thank you for having cucumbers for a substitution!!! The staff was super nice and helpful!  Place was busy at lunchtime, looks like this is a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb salad, cucumber-yogurt  and eggplant dip with cucumbers instead of pita.

_IgXGY3xkMVVBIJFUK7iFA.text: Another favorite Greek restaurant for me! The dining room is a bit small but there is an outdoor patio which will be a good option once summer is behind us.  The service is always friendly and the food is great!

UY2RWyIhseo6BW1XvTT6bQ.text: Food is always amazing, by far the best in the area. Staff is super friendly. Gets pretty busy during lunch hours. Unfortunately the last few times I have ordered they got my order wrong.

eENCg_rKdWaNGX5tUU2gDA.text: I had the rice bowl with chicken and Hummus. It was so so good. This is my new favorite place. Great customer service and the food came out very quickly! Thanks again

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Hum us
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Rice bowl Chicken Rice Bowl

hIAKT0AAWvgZtmAiUMJGyg.text: Came here on a Sunday after church to get some lunch. The place is pretty small so we got the food to go ,to eat across the street at taco because my son wanted Taco Bell and I want to eat my food some where with good Air conditioning and less Cramped. The  food here is ok the Chicken kebabs where dry to steak was ok. The stuff I did like was the fries and the salad. Over all this place is like a 3.5. That's just My opinion on food I had from other places. Don't think I'll be returning here since there are so many places to choice from all over the places in Las Vegas.

B0a0SyNy0hVjV17Fde4-yg.text: Our go to Greek Restaurant! Friendly staff and fast service. Food tastes great and their serving size is good for 2!

_4o7bqTX8A8ePvYvQw9OWw.text: Love this place. They never disappoint!  My husband and I are from the east coast, so finding a Greek restaurant that makes delicious gyros was not easy. Great Greek fits the bill

319Q2I6Su07iApK9nX-6cQ.text: We've eaten there for lunch and we also used them to cater a work lunch. The restaurant is clean.  The staff is great. The food is fresh and tasty. The restaurant is small so you may have to wait for a table. But the food comes quick after you order. The chicken, gyro meat, pitas and hummus, fresh veggies/salad, rice, tzatziki are all delicious. Our catering order came on time and everything was there that we ordered. (Yes we have problems from other restaurants that cater).  I definitely recommend them if you crave Mediterranean food. I will return and we will use their catering services again as well.

n6LUKmQQWuiG6XHbetGQyA.text: Fast food at its finest! Always fast & friendly service, restaurant is always clean, food is repeatedly fresh and delicious! Indoor and outdoor seating with a fantastic staff who Always seem happy to be at work.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro with fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Falafel plate
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

KgntryuwbrhIjjiTonM78Q.text: When visiting Las Vegas/Henderson, we visited The Great Greek two times in two days! Had we been there longer, I guarantee we would've gone again. The chicken gyro wrap was great and also the traditional gyro was great too. The salad was fresh and came topped with a generous portion toppings and pita bread. I wish they had a garlic sauce here to put on my chicken pita. The employees were friendly and the food comes out fast. It is busy at lunch, so I recommend you call in your order ahead of time, but they still get the food out quickly.  Next time I am in the area, I will certainly be going to The Great Greek.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Small salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken gyro

4-fh-C-NlRcvY9B3Jm0PoQ.text: We came here on the recommendation of the Hampton Inn staff where we were staying since it was just across the street.  It is a fast food establishment (one of three in the Las Vegas area).  On the night that we came it was quite crowded so consequently indoor seating was limited.  Service was friendly and reasonably prompt (about 10 minutes for our food after ordering). The side salad was very fresh and crisp. The Gyro meat was delicious although a little salty.  The falafels were okay but a bit dry. Overall a decent fast food Greek restaurant and We would try it again if we are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Falafel Plate and Gyro Plate

QVh5P5rlj4mRnjcnEmof-w.text: Get him to the Greek,  is what my stomach should have told me sooner. But foreals this place is quite amazing. Gave this area a shot based on the high praise received by a family member.  I have to say they are right.  You definitely wont leave hungry. I am quite new to Greek dining so i wouldn't be able to identify the staple dishes. All i kmow is the steak souvlaki plate they have is amazing. The folks behind the counter are very friendly,  place is clean. Just neeed to get some suggestions on what the best Greek dish to try for my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak souvlaki

C0MRXs9Div8geHsLbkY-dw.text: ATMOSPHERE  Open, variety of seats, quiet. Medium size facility. Great location. Great meet up spot  FACILITY I can't really give this place any less than 5 stars. It's located in small strip Mall. It shares a parking lot with multiple businesses so parking can be tricky but there was plenty when we were there on a Friday night.  INSIDE The inside of the restaurant is very clean and everyone is super friendly.   OUTSIDE They have an outdoor seating if you want an outside view. We chose this option and the weather was beautiful.   SERVICE  Friendly, efficient.  FOOD Great food, amazing service! We are from California and depend on Yelp reviews when out of town. This was a no brainer and boy, we were not disappointed. First time dining here with my girlfriend and they've definitely earned our business. The entire experience was great! Service was very friendly and accommodating.  I ordered the Lamb Souvlaki with Feta Fries and my gf got the Rice bowl which was much more than rice. Garbanzo beans, onions Feta, cucumber, romain with the steak for protein. She said it was a perfect bowl of food!! The salad that came with my meal was very light and refreshing. We ordered baklava to take home.  Very tasty. We personally didn't mind the wait nor did we think too much about it. Our food came out in around 15 minutes after ordering (there was a few people ahead of us also). If that was a long wait, then I wonder how quick they usually bring out food. Back to the food, we loved everything we ordered and the portions are pretty generous. I definitely recommend trying the feta fries, the fries are SO GOOD and crispy! My lamb was perfectly cooked (I wanted Medium), and was very delicious. Steak was delicious, and also cooked perfectly. Very tender. If you have the extra stomach, try the baklava as well for dessert.  ONLINE ORDERING  Can order online and ahead! I saw a Grub Hub driver come in and take the food away.  STAFF Friendly  SUMMARY  Fresh dependable menu items served by friendly staff.  We had great customer service and all things addressed were quickly answered and taken care of. Awesome job to the manager and staff of The Great Greek!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Rice bowl with steak
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Side salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb Souvlaki

uLSkJkETP_0swK4O88fBfA.text: This place is AWESOME. I haven't had a good gyro since I lived in Chicago, until today! The service was good and the food came out very quickly. I will definitely be back, and will bring along anyone who will listen to me.

gCojrfg6mBbZxt9OU4dCnw.text: The beef and lamb were very tender with great flavor. I don't normally eat Feta cheese but it was delicious! Same goes for the Feta fries which you can get in a combo, although the gyros alone should fill you up. The interior design coincided with the culture of food sold, which I thought added a welcoming character. The dining area is a little tight, getting to the drink foundation can turn into an obstacle course as you weave between tables and people when their busy. Tables were wiped down nicely however my seat had remains of feta cheese from the previous diner. When we defaulted from two entree combos to one combo, the cashier offered a water cup which I thought was a kind gesture.

zu7vfP7UhEkGG1UVRArTFQ.text: I recently tried to attempt the Keto Diet and this place was somewhere I can actually eat. Chicken breast and salad?! I'm there. I met a couple friends here and they were able to order really quickly.  Driving up, I noticed that this place was packed. The outdoor patio was also packed, this to me is always a good sign!   I tried the chicken breast kabob salad! For $7 this serving is huge, I can't believe I had left overs from a salad. The chicken was juicy and bursting with flavor. The salad consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, olives, onions and more! My friends ordered the gyros with chicken with friend fries in the side. They stated that the gyro was delicious and that they would order it again.   Would I recommend this place? Yes! The prices are just right and the proportions are huge! Give them a try - it's always good to step out of your comfort zone!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

dzC_03zdQFeXl8SrUhFrrw.text: I have been here several times and I truly believe it's the best Greek restaurant in Henderson. Last night my husband and I got the  falafel pitas with a side Greek salad and the feta fries. Everything was fresh and tasted amazing! This place never disappoints which is why we choose to come here for our Mediterranean flavors. Not to mention the price is very reasonable for the portion of food that you get. The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly. I believe the owner took our order last night and he was very helpful and so very polite. The restaurant feels very family orientated and I like that. There is plenty seating on the inside and outside and the decor is pretty. All around a great place to eat and will be eating here in the future.

_sDq8S4IXNUn2c11NgUYGg.text: My wife took me there for the first time and told me they have the best Gyros, she was right, I absolutely loved them. We had two older gentlemen almost going to fist fight over our table while we were eating . They were arguing over a table, That shows how good it is when you're fighting to get seated. My only complaint is that I don't have one closer to me in the Southwest, but the drive is definitely worth it.

jmL7ReMMDqGtgoLYSNMZiw.text: Excellent Greek Food!    After searching around on Yelp for places in my neighborhood, we found the Great Greek.  Most of the reviews raved over this place and I for one can not disagree.  We got in around 3pm on a weekday and this place had a lot of patrons dining at the time, always a great sign.  The food, cleanliness of the dining area and service were top notch!  We started with our orders at the counter.  We explained that it was our first time here and the lady who took our order was very friendly and was kind enough to give up some recommendations on things to try.  We placed an order for a Hummus App, Great Greek Gyro with Lemon soup side and the Chicken Souvlaki with a side salad.  A lot of food for about 27 bucks.  The Hummus which was very good, not the best I've had but very good for the price was out fairly quick.  The Chicken Souvlaki was excellent with the rice pilaf.  The Chicken was very tender and had a great taste.  My wife had the chicken gyro which looked amazing.  Her soup which she was kind enough to let me try tasted great.  Very unique on the taste, the lemon soup can really bring together a great meal.  My salad was good but I really had wished I got that soup, I guess next time!     As a lunch or dinner option, you can't go wrong with the Great Greek.  The menu is diverse and food tastes great.  Decent size portions for the price will probably have you coming back for more.  I for one will be adding this place as one of my regular stops whenever I am in the mood for excellent greek food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Souvlaki and Salad
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lemon Soup

Sb65Q9rMjKxAYZpCHaV5xg.text: I always love coming here. I have brought friends and family here many times. Everyone loved it. The food is high quality and the service is great. Every employee from the kitchen to the register is constantly working for the customers. This isn't a fast food place. Food is made fresh every day.    I will order my food a head of time for pick up. It's great when I am in a rush to get back home.

SR4GG6cnFFRLPG5bthygSw.text: and I did come back! but to a different location this time, the brand new one- and it definitely lived up to it's name, it's great Greek:) the food was absolutely delicious and so fresh, even on a 120 degree day, service - fast and attentive, everyone seemed to be enjoying their meals, we for sure did! will gladly come back:)

Iizmulutepi9OlFHXH69Mg.text: I went to this place the previous week and I'm still thinking about it. I got the great Greek gyro combo  (beef and lamb) with a salad to go. I was expecting typical gyro, but I was wrong. The sauce and the feta cheese was really good. What I really am still thinking about is the salad and salad dressing. That salad was very good, the dressing I used as additional sauce for my gyro.  This is definately a place I'm coming back to. The place is an okay size restaurant, but it's so busy there is no room to sit. That's really tells you it's a good place to eat. Just be prepared when you want to sit down and you have to wait 10 minutes.

03wHV4tqxwIV0EeIOcCRFg.text: The best value at any Greek place in the area. Amazing garlic shrimp and Lamb Gyros! The place is rather small so you may need to get your food to go, but it's worth it! !

cKW9e6Ekv_1ceWsCto4skg.text: Date night with the kids, they were hungry so we had to stay close to home and it could not be a huge wait... I yelped (thank you yelpsters for all of your continued help!) and found The Great Greek... not the one I keep reading about on your way to Cali that makes me drool just from the descriptions... but there's a NEW ONE here in Henderson on Warm Springs!!  Immediately I begin talking the 8 year old (newly picky eater) into the fabulous foods that await him, and my hubby and I repeat lines back and forth of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding' (oh, if only you knew how close this is to our lives!) including "YOU DON'T EAT NO MEAT! That's okay, I cook lamb for you."    We get there and there is not an empty seat in the house, and you can smell the goodies from the kitchen, and they have the desserts right by the cash register to get your saliva flowing!  We ordered the "Family of 4 Platter"  (approx $45) and as our luck would go, as we filled our glasses, a table opened up!    Almost immediately the salad showed up, simple with bright flavors that totally complimented one another, that even the 4 year old inhaled (and he is strictly a carbs/sugar kind of kid!)  Then the platters came out, and kept coming!  We had ordered a huge platter of the BEST french fries I think I have ever had, seriously! And then 4 heavenly Gyro's (2 chicken, 2 lamb/beef) on "MELT IN YOUR MOUTH" soft pita's, seasoned to perfection and oh so tender, and topped with the best goodies... and HUGE, did I mention how HUGE everything is?  To top it all off we had 4 desserts that came with the platter, so we tried multiple Baklava and Shamali, that with one bite made our eyes roll back and a low "ummmmm" sigh release from the adults at the table!  The food was beautiful, and tasted amazing.  What a treasure to have here in our little valley, that I KNOW we will visit often.  My husband is amazing at packing in the food, and even he stopped 3/4 of the way and said he was done, he was so stuffed!   KUDOS to The Great Greek!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Greek Fam of 4 Platter: 4 Gyro&#39;s, 4 drinks, Greek Salad, Fries or Rice, 4 desserts...amazing!!!

jo8AbNOcQobRXl64Z8_rww.text: The food here is to die for!! Reasonable and great service!! Thanks to Jak for helping us with the menu. Must try

cTvpOIuULgOdHTFptB_JHg.text: I have been here 3 times in the past month...   My first time I had the gyro plate, with a large portion of gyro meat, rice and salad - the tzatziki is amazing, slightly tart - rich flavor, sooooo yummy I wanted to bathe in it!  I couldn't wait to go back!  I met a girlfriend for lunch last Friday and had the Greek salad with falafel, again, I was so happy with the freshness of the food - the portions are perfect and the service is really good - the entire staff is helpful and friendly. My friend had the grilled salmon - oh my gosh, it was so good (even though we had to wait a little longer, it was worth it!).  All in all I was very happy on my second visit.  Saturday I met another friend for lunch - this time I ordered the rice bowl and had the gyro meat again.  Again, delicious and I just couldn't get enough tzatziki! My friend had the chicken rice bowl and was very pleased with the portion size and taste.  It was pretty busy for 2pm on Saturday, but still had great service from very attentive front end workers.    I am a fan for life!

dyLhhPzyGq5yTMKMO2sIMA.text: OMG!!!!!!!! The best!  Everything is amazing, but the feta fries with Taziki!!!!!! Holy buckets, who knew I could be a vegetarian and just eat that the rest of my life!!!  Hummus and lamb the best I have ever had!

Z1EqvuysSPrc-4wijbSlkw.text: This was delicious, the service was excellent, the portions very generous!  Next time I'm in Vegas, I know where I'm eating dinner

Ej5GRJFUV-bcL0O7EHxDzg.text: Simply delicious! BEST Greek food I've had in Vegas! This will definitely be a go to lunch spot for me! So fresh and flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp Traditional plate with rice pilaf

50oMlo9s9WYryobIYxp0XQ.text: I went here when the place was not busy, aka not a Friday or Saturday night.  The service was very quick and the food was excellent.  Big portions, fresh and very tasty...will be coming back here often.

nabn117xq4suLMb6GQcO9A.text: We just drove into town and are staying at a 5 star hotel, yet we came to eat at Great Greek for dinner. The staff was so nice, food is AMAZING, and the atmosphere is perfect. They're busy for a reason. If we're in Vegas again, were coming back!

1va_h_EqYcjdi5ijHSlXNQ.text: Food is still really good but I am through with this place. I have a family of five and every time I go, there is never any place to sit. They have four tops and two tops. The two tops are always open and the four top tables  always have one or two people taking up the tables meant for a bigger party.  I am tired of going  in and having to leave because there are no tables. Then I usually settle for Jason's deli. I don't like Jason's deli.

NW8daeN6ZQUdAEmjgMSK0Q.text: We love this place - the food is delicious and the service is great! A wonderful "mom and pop" place...it is a great change to all these "same old same old" fastfood chains in the area! They even have some outdoor seating - but since it is rather small it is sometimes hard to find seating outside. Awesome place - it really is  "great greek" food!

ym-goVcR2elJKelezX2acw.text: One of favorite places. I could eat there everyday. If you go at lunch expect a wait. Don't forget to order those delicious butter cookies. Amazing.

s_bT2nOW8YbZ2n8QRAnW0g.text: Went for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. It's a very small place but the food was amazing! People were very friendly and service was great. Prices were very good and portions were large.

qBow-1O93p8g2BJqNC71NQ.text: Beef/lamb gyro + fries + drink = $10?  Yes, that's what I had for lunch today at The Great Greek and it was a great deal!  It's probably only the second time I've had a gyro and this one was overflowing with meat, lettuce, tomatoes, feta cheese,Tzaziki sauce, and flavor.  The fries were also delicious.  The service is attentive, the place is clean, and I'm just sad that I didn't take baklava to go because I'm sure it's great, too.  Opa!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

aounwZQmOBw6ILpltE1a3w.text: Awesome unreal super fresh .... this will be a favorite each year really good food great people

FJ9HcGb16KPo7yEecaM68Q.text: The Great Greek used to be my favorite place for lunch or pick up. But that changed today, last time I picked up the food was just okay. Salad with mushy tomatoes. So I figured maybe an off day.   Today I ordered the same as always 2 salads with two med rare steak skewers. When I got home with my food once again mushy tomatoes but this time the steak was so well done I could not eat it Two salads both with charred steak skewers.  Not sure what happened in the last couple of months but I I'll not be back.

bHIZ8oyR9buGHu805M5-PQ.text: This is the best Greek food I've had in a long time!  I got a Gyro Platter, and it comes with a yummy salad and fries - you can actually spend a bit more to have "Feta Fries" so I did that, and they were amazing!  No skimping on portions at this place.  The salad was awesome with oil and vinegar and enough to actually coat everything on it!  Gyro meat had a great flavor, pita bread was soft and fresh, and tzatziki sauce was awesome.  Nice staff, too.

gXsUfzeOUdQF8MNxLxv8nQ.text: Fresh, tasty meals. A definite must try, if you are in Vegas. There are a few good choices in Henderson, but this place has to be on your list.

ws3G-dAqt5dTIWs3eLUvZQ.text: Got a lamb plate , it's was good,but  it's was raw in side ,  the rice it's not real and was very very salty . Salad it's was very nice. Next time have to try chicken!!!

bcuvw9x_zJLD2Fy_Jvwx9Q.text: Delicious gyros!  The staff is very friendly and helpful!  Not only are they friendly but the service is very quick.

Q3KqgjcMt37xtcxB2ifKjQ.text: I went to this place not ever going to a Greek place before. Not expecting much, I was blown away! Great food, great service, highly recommend this place, I will definitely be back!!

pxOGUNGSnKym_n5zort-zA.text: Some of the best Greek food I have ever eaten. You must try the feta fries if you go here! The pasticcio is the best! I have never seen this place without customers they stay very busy due to the good food. Service is good and they have outdoor seating for the days when its nice outside. I highly recommend!

cCLhOURJMiGT8Pp_FNmgrA.text: Food is great and reasonably priced! Everything looks pretty clean and the staff is very friendly. Busy spot at lunch (went to pick up lunch on a Saturday and place was packed), good thing we pre-ordered over the phone for pick up. Definitely coming back!

yaVfVvB4iJTfdejJt8ykeA.text: Place was crowded, while waiting to order the rest of our party sat at a table, when we were approached by a white haired man (who said he was the owner) and told us "tables are for people AFTER they order". Really?  You need 6 people in line when 2 know what to order.  Ended up leaving  & going to Millers Ale House around the corner.  Guess the "owner" doesn't want us!  Have to find a new Favorite Greek place

sx6ZLb_5xHq4pnV_I8HGDA.text: This place was filled with huge delicious plates and great customer service!  The gyro plate, the salad and rice bowl, and the gyro wrap were enormous. We were barely able to eat half, but we wish we could have eaten more because it was amazing.  The gyro was well done, sliced thin with no fat, and the pita was light and fluffy. I decided to have the rice pilaf with the gyro plate instead of fries, and I would highly recommend it. The gyro plate and gyro wrap both came with Greek salads which were filled with a lot of veggies, olives and feta.  I have had a lot of Greek salads, but this had to have been one of my favorites.  While we were eating, a gentleman at the table next to us said that the food is always amazing and that he had even had them cater for him.  In addition to the delicious food, the woman we ordered with was extremely friendly and added to our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Enormous plates and great customer service!

j5iH5LuCv1svrHyTbZOCyQ.text: Was there tonight busy.  Was here before lots of times. Left because when I was waiting for table and my family of six where just about to order a older guy came out to clean the table I was waiting for and said I couldn't have the table because they are for the people that have already ordered I said we are just about to he said I don't care  told him we are leaving 6  people that was going to spend $$$ usually 100 or more his loss. So if you want rude employees go there

5dmP3_4L2GRQ9q8TeZsfFg.text: I came around 2:00 pm on a Saturday and the place was packed! Staff members were absolutely wonderful! Fast service, friendly, gave recommendations on the food, asked if I would like a water cup while waiting, and was busing tables the soon as one opened up. Excellent food, staff, and atmosphere! Great little gem in the Henderson area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Souvlaki

FsR2cxrfkoUDehPJi6H2Qw.text: My favorite Greek restaurant in town! Staff is consistently helpful, friendly & efficient. The food is fresh & delicious. My only concern is occasionally waiting for a table or a line because of its popularity!

n35bd6Ihv72f8oQPRBVV8w.text: I've had better. Kabob Express on the East side is Better and not as crowded. I ordered take-out and thank goodness I did because it was Super Noisy and Loud with kids for such a Small place. The Lamb Gyro was a Huge portion but way too much sauce and cheese. Baklava was Large and tasty. My bf didn't care for the Grilled Chicken plate. Flavors weren't there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb Gyro

My41w1uyQfUh9auWUsyGTg.text: The Great Greek never disappoints. The food is excellent--I recommend the classic greek salad with added chicken kabob--and the employees are always friendly. Never had a bad meal there in the 2+ years I've been going regularly. A must-stop for fans of Greek cuisine, whether you're a local or just stopping by!

So3QXkEBsosatofCHh5luA.text: I have been there too many times to count, and every time the food is just as good as the first time. The reason for only 4 starts is the service. My husband and I have been coming here for years and there is one girl in particular who is very unfriendly. I'm a loyal customer and I always tip, but for whatever reason she is always rude. I really miss walking in and seeing Zack's friendly face. He is there on an occasional weekend, but not nearly as often as he used to be. Besides the service issues we've encountered, this is our go to Greek spot so check it out. Even if you're not in the area the food is well worth a drive!

qlXqZmvSi7d3yVGNmQcrXg.text: I love this place. The food is amazing, the staff is friendly, and the overall experience is just awesome.

gmYCljKwRDOh0yC4uPVlIg.text: OMG!! OMG!! OMG!!! That is really all I can say.  I ordered a gyro sandwich and feta fries. TO DIE FOR! Yup really. Can't wait to go back on my next visit to the area. Can I franchise this is San Diego please???

N9d8Sun59A2V2ZXxq5Q3DA.text: Outstanding food and service.  Warmly greeted when we entered the restaurant.  You can tell this is a family owned business.  I ordered the small Greek salad with grilled shrimp.  Delicious.  Everything was fresh and excellently prepared.  Tables were bused quickly, so you feel the restaurant is clean.  Many "regulars" came in for lunch while we were there.  We found our regular Greek food restaurant.

zVIvzm4fPKwBFyZhQiqk_g.text: There is absolutely nothing great about The Great Greek with the exception that they greatly manage to fool a lot of Yelpers into thinking this is a four-and-a-half star average listing. "Eek! Methinks not."  If this is the best greek in the valley, then I should quit eating greek food right here and fucking now because it was "A-OK" at best. Add to the sum of the equation the shittiest service I have received anywhere in Twenty-Fifteen, and you've got yourself a one-star. Great job, Great Greek.   The night I went -- the last time I shall ever patronise this shit show -- it was packed. It might be always packed here. (People have no taste.) Now, I will never penalise a business for being too popular; however, I will deduct stars for how they handle their high amount of traffic.   Service The ladies providing the table service were beyond rude. "Excuse me!" they would loudly shout every couple of minutes in the same way one would exclaim "Get the fuck out the way, asshole." The queue exists, and it only has a very small area where to exist, and those in it weren't even excessively occupying more square space than necessary. "Excuse me!"   On the other hand, the lovely, middle-aged lady behind the till was pleasant without exception the entire time  we were there. She should get a raise if she is not already the owner. "Excuse me!"  The service aside from the cashier continued to earn itself the Worst In Show with one of the "Excuse Me!" ladies tossing the plates on our table and snatching the table number without asking if we needed anything else. Missing was the dessert, naturally -- "Excuse Me!" -- and my fucking salad.   Food The food was alright. I had the Greek lamb burger because I am boring. The dessert might have been the greatest thing west of the goddamn Mississippi; however, I shall never know.   Just like The Great Greek will never know anything other than this one-star from Edwin P. from Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S.A.  The yuppies with no taste and no sense of decent service can keep it. One star.

MAQtuAP1E5_tffVKCRjGpA.text: Iva and Jack did a great food service was delicious the  restaurant deserves more then 5 stars Can't wait to go back and try more of the traditional greek food .

S0WEqj4eHwWndcijXbO4dQ.text: I love the Chicken Souvlaki Plate. Tender moist chicken, rice pilaf, pita bread, and a side salad. It's big enough for two meals. This place consistently has friendly staff and great food.

ygbWnSEGC0srhg_D56u8wQ.text: Baklava is awesome!   So YUM!  Pretty big portions and can be shared. If there are 4 of you.... get the Family Platter... it comes with kebabs, rice, salad, grape leaves, hummuss, pita bread and bakalava.  And it's a lot of food for a really great price.  They have a small patio area so you can sit outside when it's nice.  Note... It's a fairly small family run restaurant so the wait for your food can be long.  Suggest calling ahead and getting take out.

63dy7HdsieyVAyCMVBZq_A.text: This place was average. The kabob was good, the rice was ok, the hummas was ok. It wasn't my favorite in town, but if you're looking for something close by, for an ok price this place will do.

VxNRYcWaDqIq7sHSppI6RQ.text: This is the best Greek place in Las Vegas! Everything tastes fresh and delicious every time. I dream of their hummus! The feta fries are to die for too. I would eat every meal here if I could!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken souvlaki plate, grilled cheese, humus and feta fries!

c2BcRdJHdSy0QrmJoHSgsg.text: Excellent service, the portions are huge and the taste is great, the price is good, for Greek food, the restaurant is impeccable. Will definitely come back  again. If you come with a group the family deals are the best: Gyro, rice or fries, salad, soda and dessert for about $45-48. We had the 4 people deal and could not finish it. My husband wanted for me to add: "The rice pudding is great, just like my sito used to make."

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Salad that comes with family deal.
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Part of the family special no. 1

59zTh17aOuaR0W2-nYpfZA.text: When we got here, I was worried because of how busy it was. No problem, the staff had everyone happy and taken care of in no time. Apps came faster than it took to wash my hands. Since it was my first time, I got the gyro plate and the meat was as good as I've ever had. (The hummus too for that matter) however, the gold medal went to the baklava ice cream. If you were staying anywhere in Clark county, this little spot is worth the trip.

bBUx_2g8IlHIQvATLgzllg.text: Amazing gyros, we come here every time we are in town. Def a must have if in Henderson! The large gyro salad is my go to when I need some greens that have a little protein and flavor to help wash down all that healthyness. The baklava is worth trying if your diet can spare the extra amplifier of sugar but in my opinion well worth the extra time at the gym to indulge now and again. The specials that are posted daily are usually really tasty I had the salmon avacado wrap as a special and was sooo good.

8fVMM-nOUF_VlD_Hfw516g.text: Best Greek food I have had in a long time.  Moved to the area recently and heard about this place from some co workers.  Good value and really great service.  A little crowded with how many tables there are but they do a good job of shuffling people around if needed to accommodate bigger groups.  I had their Gyro and it was excellent.  Also you got to try to their fries.  Excellent!

oavY0fdp8DAykJxxxdfLAw.text: This place really is GREAT. After few unsuccessful attempts at eating here due to early closing time during the week, boyfriend and I became discouraged from eating here. This place was brought up again when myself, Jaime W, and Molly T decided to have our very own food crawl...at 11 am..  We arrived just as they opened and we were greeted by the friendly owner. I ordered Avgolemono Soup ($3.50) which is the traditional Greek soup with chicken, lemon, and rice. The portion was really quite large. It also came with a side of their delicious pita bread. Molly T and I decided to also split The Great Greek Gyro (~ $8.00) with lamb-beef combination. The portion, once again, was huge! And the gyro was really quite tasty. Jaime W shared her feta fries with us and they were delicious. They sound simple enough, but wow...they can quickly turn into a guilty pleasure.  All in all, the prices are extremely reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. It does get very packed during lunch time, and they close at 8 pm Mon-Thur.

8cg56vWMUtMjqnO4NZfy0Q.text: The restaurant was very busy on the Saturday evening, but a table opened up just as we approached the counter to place our orders.  My wife and I each each chose the Great Greek gyro - lamb and beef gyro meat wrapped in pita bread along with lettuce, tomato, tzazki and feta. At a nominal additional cost, these were upgraded to a platter that included a small Greek salad and soda.  We were more than happy with our dining chose this evening.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Greek gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. menu cover
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Patio

LISrj4X-x85XLjYnfrXAVQ.text: OUTSTANDING!  This was our 2nd trip to the Great Greek and once again it was amazing.  Last time we were there we had the Gyro and a Greek Wrap along with the hummus.  This time we both had rice bowls, I had it with gyro meat and my fiance had shrimp on hers.  Both were huge and were outstanding!  The staff is amazing!!  Everyone, from the ladies taking orders to the guys cooking in the back have a great sense of humor and are more than happy to answer any questions that you have.  We only live a few miles away so we will be back again soon!

M2WeQ7JJ1LfGYNmCkfpcXg.text: Great gyros and salad. Friendly staff. Only problem was tough to get a table at lunch!!

t9b2Tr4h94DGEIDadVDf_w.text: This place is a gem! I've grown up eating authentic greek food and I must say this place is the real deal. Best gyro I've ever had. Also, get the Feta fries! So worth it! Price is reasonable, food is stellar, staff is friendly. Only downside is the place is a bit small for the demand. The line is out the door every time I go and occassionally there is a 10-20 min wait. But so worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

Dpj61jRXXYp8E_ZdqRZMcg.text: Ooooh man!! I am addicted to this place. It's so good. I haven't had a single thing I don't like. The gyros are amazing and the baklava is to die for. I love supporting mom and pop shops. This one has a super cool vibe to it. All the staff is so friendly and they actually remember you!

z2lOV0aJ50u9F1OuV2bIlg.text: The salad wrap is kind of amazing. The plates is delicious too. This place is a little busy and I feel uncomfortable eating inside surrounded by so many people, but there is plenty of seating outside.

prIPmQJEXxsSupYJ7tHwUQ.text: The steak kebab was very tender and tasty and juicy. The Gyro sandwich was very tasty as well and they gave a good amount of tatziki sauce with it. Rice was flavorful.  Service was very friendly. The only thing is that they may need a bigger place to seat more patrons as customers kept coming. Our friend said that this was the best Greek food she ever tasted.

Y6Q3ffZr73o0QWCFZLKENA.text: This place is always amazing!  From the staff to the food. Even the free smells as you walk by are amazing. I've eaten at that location for 2 years and never a disappointment, ever. The lady that owns it is so sweet and even her sons that run it now are always friendly. Any way you want the food is how they will make it and they always remember me and what I want.  Love this place and will always go back!

WL-5vZBJkvH02kEBGWIwiQ.text: Food is amazing especially the Feta Fries holy snap! Employees are personable and polite. I've come here multiple times on my lunch break and unfortunately didn't get the chance to write a review until today. Give it a try, you'll be hooked! :)

ZEbwtxXUf8_MtpI9Eux4ng.text: I love the soup they have here and the rice. I dont really like the Gyros. They are so big , they fall apart, the meat they used was bad.

84aU7jZXZJOHsQajCw_szQ.text: This is a great lunch spot. I am so happy I found this place as I'm always on the lookout for fresh new lunch places!   We arrived around 1 and the place was packed.  We had to wait for about 10 mins for a table to open up but I'm so glad that we did. The restaurant was very clean despite the crowd.   I ordered the Greek Rice Bowl which had two chicken skewers on a bed of rice covered in lettuce, marinated chickpeas, feta cheese, and kalamata olives.  You can add onion and tomato if that's your thing.  The bowl is deliciously dressed but there is also a side tzatziki sauce which is so good I felt like I could drink it.  At the risk of embarrassing my company, I refrained...in case you were wondering.  The only note I would offer is that the place can be a little pricey (almost $30 for two if us).  There are some dishes on the menu (featuring lamb) that are pushing $18 which seemed high for the super casual atmosphere.   The staff was very accommodating and super friendly. I will definitely be returning!

EPfEArNME3kGOXH0toAulg.text: The best Greek food on this side of town. My favorite is the rice bowl! It gets very busy during lunch hour, I recommend to go either before or after lunch.

PUNaE6P7c12H0A2LESyMfQ.text: I wish we had one of these in Baltimore  because I would eat there everyday. I had a Greek salad with dolmades and chicken skewer and it was the best meal I had this week while in Vegas.  The veggies were crisp and fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Salad with dolmades and chicken skewer

256UgWh6V8GaeldblavDmw.text: Food was very good  Service was ok. One of the woman who worked the front was a bit rude when my mom asked a question about her order.   Atmosphere was ok. Small location.   The only negative was the cost of the food. It was $90 for 4 people including drinks and a side of hummus. I don't think this place was work that cost.   You - we had 2 gyros plates, 1 vegetarian plate and 1 shrimp skewer plate, 2 sides of hummus and 4 drinks. With 15% tip it was just over $90.

vEcHGsierk6nK4G1eXis1A.text: We stopped in for lunch and the food was so amazing. We had gyro salad's and those grape leave wrapped things. Wonderful meal, the folks that work there were so nice, and we had a super time. I highly recommend this one!

G34siO2rqxiD0e7BEVGpeA.text: Along the way to Hoover Dam, there was really not many choices. The Great Greek was the best I could find. We only tried Gyro Plate because they were not serving other grilled places that day. Attentive service, bright dining environment and food was served in a really generous size.

7VbsSWB4MPjJ54qIFjERLA.text: EXCELLENT FRESH DELICIOUS FOOD!!! If you are looking for a great Greek meal, this is the place.  The chicken greek salad is to die for, the salad dressing & toppings are always fresh & yummy.  The employees are always very friendly & it's more like a family style restaurant.  Every time I call me order in they remember me and when I show up I am greeted immediately by 1st name and taken care of in a timely fashion, no matter how busy they are.  They have daily specials that are always delicious and nice variety.  There are several Greek restaurants in the neighborhood but I only go to the GREAT GREEK.

ggJXy2MLv8NgwLJdiyuFsQ.text: We ordered the Gyros so good and so stuffed we have been back again wow the Baklava is amazing  and the french fries salad  its just good I recommend to try it

ekHbo7dDDD4RJQoioysang.text: This place is so delicious and easily now one of my favorite places to eat. It was so busy when we came in and now I can understand why! Everything we tried was so great and fresh. Not a bad flavor in anything. They are really doin it right. It's great that we live just a few minutes away. Definitely coming back no doubt. I recommend 200%!

9KyNyMKV3qIW3gdx-3A3vg.text: Two words... feta fries  I promise you, the photo doesn't do these fries justice. They're out of this world. And honestly, make up for the flavor lacking in everything else. The chicken was dry and the steak was very bland. I would say the meal was entirely subpar, however the fries and cookies are enough for me to come back.

kUE6rjw1KTi6vtLqDEbuSA.text: There is an asshole in charge here....after 3 people after me were served, I was told "Your sandwich takes time". This is after 35 minutes...this moron then proceeds to throw my money back and says,"Here's your apology" when I asked for my money back...good choice management...stop hiring children to work your counter...

Tm2dut8rqPNXKGD-MVUD7Q.text: This was our first time here and it was absolutely delicious. We are from denver but would make an effort to come here anytime we are in Las Vegas. The gyros were the best I've had and I loved the Greek salad and baklava. Highly recommend.

R0HNRBebD_agl1sdHloIcQ.text: I more than love Great Greek. I could eat here every day if possible. It's more than just delicious food. When I come into Great Greek I feel like a part of the family. Every person who works at Great Greek is friendly, efficient, and they make me want to come back to the restaurant. We met the owners and their family, and each of them thanked us profusely for coming to eat at their establishment. What more could you ask for?  Well, I guess you could ask for good food, but that is a given when you come to eat here. There is so much to try and not enough time! I haven't been able to eat the rice due to a gluten allergy - they did not feel confident that the pilaf was OK for me to eat (it rarely is), so I had Feta Fries instead. They were terrible. Never eat them! I will suffer the torment and eat anyone's orders if they don't want them! They're simple, overloaded with dressing and cheese - just delicious with herbs and feta. For $13 you get a Greek Salad with delicious good quality Olive Oil dressing, Pita (if you're not GF), 2 Chicken Souvlaki Skewers, Feta Fries and happiness. Could you ask for more? Their steak is also always cooked a perfect medium rare, and their shrimp are so delicious I could eat 4 skewers and still want more!  Their Avgolemono Soup is my favorite...ever. This is made with just white rice, no pilaf. Their hummus is homemade, smooth and delicious, just like everything else on their menu. What's not to love?  My husband has had the gyros and the rice bowls and loves them both. The gyros meat is good, not as salty as the meat we had back home in Chicago. He says the rice could be eaten in pounds all day long, the rice bowl is great because when you mix everything together and add a pita nothing can go wrong!   I would call ahead if you're ordering take out, or if you want to know their daily special. I've had their grilled lamb chops, and I assure you, it is worth every last dollar spent on that dinner. SO GOOD. The Greek Chicken special is one of my favorites too! You won't go wrong stopping by here! Eat and enjoy!

X6w5sNu-PrNHYpCwur30bQ.text: We wanted to take my parents somewhere different.  We had the four dip appetizer which everyone really liked.  The pita bread was outstanding.  Our party had the shrimp fettucine, the falafel salad, and the lamb souvlaki.  Everything was flavored well and cooked well.  My parents said they would come here again!

CSN_LtHfqgm0mi2yzcP91Q.text: 5 freakin stars. This place is one of my TOP 3 spots to eat. The food is always excellent. The service is even better. The feta fries are to die for. The only complaint I have is it I wish there was some closer to my neck of the woods, Summerlin. But it's always worth the trip!! Thanks Great Greek for living up to your name!! (:

xyEKuLuXRZSFx3BmBkdWNg.text: Fantastic food.  My wife and I go almost every week.  The Feta fries are amazing and the Gyro is always what I order.  Great food, great people.

HUQc2A9ri5Xza86fpUsQ_A.text: I'm so sorry I ate all my food before I could take pictures. My boyfriend and I both got gyros (one chicken one lamb) and they were delicious. Get the feta fries as well you will thank me later.   Food was awesome, and the service was just as great! Both young ladies assisting us were very sweet and efficient. While they weren't ringing orders through they were keeping the place spotless. We will be new regulars here. :)

YpZwcUi9vZKFPC0nSuy_dQ.text: Awesome crew! Direct, but friendly. The food was excellent. I got the large Greek salad with two sides of the gyros.   I wish they had more space to hold more tables. Seeing them do so well on Yelp I am sure they will be expanding in the future.

unn2DTytguHP-LM-xApk2w.text: This place is my absolute favorite. I came for dinner and lunch yesterday and I am back for lunch again today. I love it here!!!!! So flavorful and healthy. So fresh. Amazing!!!!!

aA2pA36BwU3tmAtj60qGAQ.text: After working at Estiatorio Milos inside of the Cosmopolitan for over three years, I'm a little spoiled and critical when it comes to Greek food. This is my third time visiting and each time it doesn't disappoint.   The restaurant was packed and every table was taken at 2PM on a Thursday. I was on that side of town after hiking in Boulder City and was running late to class, but decided that a chicken gyro was worth being 15 minutes late for. After having a few gyros from Paymon's and having issues with being skipped on hummus, I was worried that I would have to ask for extra tzatziki with my gyro but after seeing the monster of a sandwich that came out, I knew I was in great hands. So much chicken, so much sauce, the pita was perfect- a week later I'm still dreaming about it.   While waiting for my sandwich their cashier was sweet enough to let me try their vanilla cookie which was just as delicious and satisfyingly sugary. I can't wait to come back and am thinking of making the 30+ minute drive from my house just to have another gyro!

a2lkK7nLttpg47CJuIbrUw.text: Fabulously Exceptional Greek salad + perfect chicken souvlaki kebabs + light and tasty rice and warm pita....Opa!!! Welcome to Greece!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

pCTC2N-7_QezIXDOYIuLww.text: This place is a go to place that you can count on every time to be perfect . I love the Greek Salad and I get 1 of each meat . The chicken and lamb . The owner is super friendly and always in a good mood . Poor guy needs a day off though . The place Is always packed so give yourself plenty of time .

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad with lamb and chicken

AYujWhtlRYfS9kyKTBjOhQ.text: Great food but when you purchase two rice plates for over $30 and get no peta bread you feel a bit cheated. Should be part of the meal at $15 per head....still gave them 20% on the tip.

raUA_rW6bTJyd9cGkMSC-w.text: Good and fast! The chicken was perfectly cooked (thoroughly cooked without being dry). The feta fries are a must try! If you're in the area it's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

R0G3WYPfszU0uPJ0nF4gMQ.text: The lamb beef was delicious, as was the tzatziki.  The service was suburb. I would definitely go back!

gfIEWfOPP49SGvqQVmwJfA.text: This place is great. Their dressings, sauces, and hummus are spot-on. I love their salads, skewers, even there Burger is delicious. This is my new go-to spot. They are quick, the staff is friendly, and the food tastes great. Nice, modern, open concept.

WByWqgKjQGjNhQW7eOUxnw.text: I personally didn't think the food was as great as people said so on the reviews. Mediocre to me i give the gyro a 5/10 to be honest maybe it was a busy day an they couldn't put to much attention on it who knows. The feta fries were good just wish the cheese wasn't melted to the point where it was dry. The tiziki sauce was fair the red sauce they hard was rather good I enjoyed that. The shrimp skewers I had were fair. Like I said. Nothing special who knows if I'll be going back. Best place for gyros is Greek bistro in Henderson by sunset station I'll continue to go back there.  If you see me at the great Greek it's because my wife dragged me...

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. This is it.. nothing special. Don&#39;t know if I would like to come back my wife might but that&#39;s about it...
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Okay it&#39;s not bad but definitely is. It better than the #greekbistro in Henderson
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Can&#39;t complain nice lightly cooked the flavor alright could be better. But not bad.

c03cGqC2cCx5MKwR0ZXT5w.text: This is an amazing spot. The service is fast and friendly, and their food always tastes incredible. The ingredients are fresh and the flavors are amazing.  I recently tried this place about 3 months ago and have easily visited ten times since then. Everything about The Great Greek delivers.  I'm partial to the Traditional Gyro as their beef and lamb blend is delicious and always cooked perfectly.  My wife orders the Greek Salad with a side of gyro meat and always raves about the freshness of the produce. Their dressing is on point too!  And to top it off, Baklava Ice Cream is a delicious dessert. It's bursting with fresh baklava flavor and honey and the serving size is quite generous.

JmZHH5j5ptcWT31J4RUBNw.text: Second time I've gone there at 4 in the afternoon and I have gotten some dried out chicken pretty disturbing because they're pretty good when they serve fresh food...

AH_tjo-3U28cLaZJhqgzdA.text: Gyro Rice Bowl was so flavorful and fresh! I also got a side of feta fries that were great as well, but might not have been the best for takeout. Fresh gyro meat and rice with pilaf full of lemon and garlic! Top Greek food in the area for sure!

pSPbK0qgJk-gO2H6Ht9MBA.text: We are Great Greek regulars. Even catered our sons first birthday party. Our past two orders though, something has been off. We both ordered rice bowls, mine was chicken and the husband had steak. The chicken is usually a pretty yellow color from seasoning and both times it's tasted under flavored and didn't look the same. My husbands steak portion also looks less than usual. The tzatziki sauce was also much more mild than usual. Hoping this is just a bad week but thought you might like the feedback. Love this place though.

SW1GGdAYxdHUdufhd-WsKQ.text: Great spot for quick healthy options for dinner or lunch. I usually get the salad bowl and it's filled with so many toppings. The Greek fries are amazing as well. I love this spot.
