RkXQiFH0OiJ-WWb2zR6bdA.text: Cute little place. Air conditioning. Good food. Super yummy baklava ice cream!! I want to buy pints of that stuff!

IrDekMtZ5g43_kP_Or51DQ.text: It's almost comical how often I've eaten their food without actually making a visit. Now that I have, it's time to review.  My friend and I were going to try another Greek restaurant closer to my place, but they had already closed on Christmas Eve. Luckily, we had a plan B that was still open: Yelp and Las Vegas Weekly "Best of Las Vegas" darling The Great Greek.  It's tougher than expected to reach it because whoever designed the plaza inexplicably didn't add enough entrances or even paths. Even though you can see the restaurant from Warm Springs, you'll have to make several turns to arrive at the parking area. It's welcoming enough once you finally enter, with indoor seating for around 20 and a TV with ESPNEWS in HD.  The Great Greek Gyro ($7.95) with a beef and lamb mixture (or chicken if you really, truly must) is a solid lunch option. In addition to the tomatoes, red onions, and tzatziki of the "Traditional Gyro" ($6.95), this pita comes with lettuce and feta. I had experienced this in an assemble-it-yourself form many times with trays ordered for group events, and while it was certainly fresher and warmer at the restaurant, it still didn't truly tantalize my taste buds.  That said, it's at least on par with if not better than any other recent gyro that I've experienced. And it's really cool that they cut it in advance per request so that I could share it with a friend.  I also split one of the "traditional plate" menu items. The Grilled Garlic Shrimp ($12.95) has two skewers of four marinated shrimp a piece. The shrimp was cooked properly and had that juicy bite to it. I can't say that the stated garlic, and oregano were particularly prominent flavors, but I liked squeezing the lemon wedge for acidity. The pita was good, the tzatziki was fine, but... the fries.  Specifically, the feta fries, which I think was a slight upcharge (maybe I'll back-calculate from credit card records) from the regular fries. But it was worth it for the rich feta and its creamier partner in crime. Sure, the fries alone are the fairly thick, floured kind that I enjoy the most, but do the feta fries if you can.  There was also a small salad included in the plate, with a simple vinaigrette not really contributing as much as that ever-present feta. It's cool though. I mean, what are you doing here anyway if you don't like feta?  I'll probably be back, but not in a huge hurry or anything. My first visit bore out my past perceptions that the food is really solid, but not the be-all and end-all of Greek cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. The Great Greek Gyro, cut in half for our sharing convenience.
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Shrimp Skewer plate with feta fries instead of regular fries. Salad included because why not?

vk1VG0h4PCwWxI6CgT0peA.text: This place is awesome!! I've been twice and look forward to returning on my next Vegas  trip--it is worth the drive from  the Strip.   I've ordered the same thing both times: the Great Greek chicken gyro with the feta fries.   Today, I also tried the hummus and souvalaki. Amaze-balls. Everything is fresh and delicious. They bring you warm grilled pita. I gobbled every morsel. We were almost tempted to order to go. But the portions here are huge and our room does not have a mini fridge.  Hands down, the best Greek food I've ever enjoyed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

WB3-8Aiabt5BVT1V-EBPdQ.text: We have been here a million times. Never disappointed. We seem to always order the same things. Gyros plate with rice and salad, I like my salad village style...tomatoes, cucumbers, feta cheese and dressing.  My man orders the 2 skewer meal, lamb and beef, with rice and regular Greek salad. If we are really hungry we order the feta fries also. Feta fries are fries covered with melted Feta and I believe Monterey jack cheese...mmmm mmmm mmmm! The Gyros is cooked to perfection and so flavorful. The rice is buttery and lemony perfection. I don't know where they get their tomatoes from but they are always so ripe and red and flavorful.  The meat for the skewers is always cooked exactly how you request and the steak skewer meat is so tender and tasty I would think it was filet mignon.  They need to expand their Henderson location because they are sooooo busy that sometimes you have to wait for a table and they are always busy with take outs!!! We LOVE the Great Greek and even though it is a drive for us it is well worth it!!!! We always take visitors there for dinner when they come to town!  Keep up the great cooking!!!

qexjt05tp2ZKCsxaQPe6Rw.text: Omg!! The chicken gyro with the feta fries is AMAZING!!! I'll definitely be trying other items on the menu. Don't hesitate to check this place out.

k35wrXSCd-5LZcQQquRApA.text: Holy taste bud boner! Hit it twice in the last two weeks. Once at the restaurant, the other ubereats... Both experiences we're so good! Did the chicken plate my first go and tried the gyro today. Straight up crushed it!

1VZVXtK--ODli2EpiuVsCg.text: Came here on a Saturday afternoon when it was pretty busy. We decided to come here due to the good reviews and were not disappointed.  I ordered the Greek salad wrap (4/5) with chicken which was very filling and fresh. My husband had the gyro which was pretty big and stuffed with meat and all the toppings (5/5).  The feta fries with lemon were 5/5 due to the yummy melted cheese all over. The service was also fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries 5/5.. with a lemon wedge
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad wrap with chicken 4/5. I would have added a little extra dressing or spice

cwVQ0A_Ue8MAiVuXKfdonw.text: The grilled shrimp was excellent at a reasonable price. Grilled perfectly, great fresh taste. Crispy fries and fresh salad. If I lived here, I would frequent this place! I took some baklava to go. Delicious!

uR6cha3EwzQ2pHWViNgkSw.text: I've driven by this place dozens of times and never even knew it was there.  Don't make my mistake by passing it by.  We went there on a weekday after work.  Glad we got there early for dinner because by the time we left there wasn't an empty table inside.  But fear not, there's plenty of tables outside.  The owners are fantastic and friendly, and have such an enthusiasm for their food you can't help but want to order everything, and we just about did.  The food was great, service was great, prices were good... we'll definitely be going back and will be regulars.

T6oWjpq5SdPJ4CCVd1Jkzw.text: This place gets a lot of great reviews which is why I visited, but I have to say the gyro meat was simply too salty.  The hummus, however, was very good.    I will try it again when I am in Vegas, but I will pass on the gyro.

G24eKWWNFrKNkWUGuH-JFA.text: I miss this place. I love the food and the atmosphere. I cant wait to go back to vegas and eat at the great greek again.  That lamb is delicious

hQTu-vnecsSCpn385Eylxg.text: I could probably eat here for the rest of my life! I've tried a lot of different things on the menu and they're all delicious.  My favorite is the greek salad wrap with chicken, it is perfectly tangy and delightful but the gyro is solid too.  My boyfriend always gets the falafel which he loves and sometimes if we're feeling wild we'll get dolmades and hummus.  I almost forgot about the feta fries!!!  Great Greek is really doing something right with those fries they're the best.  I believe its family owned and the woman behind the counter is always so sweet and welcoming.  It can get pretty busy though so we always order it over the phone and pick it up, otherwise there are about 8 tables or so inside- not bad but it can get packed

hC6JObhvI5q1hT2mHcrUjA.text: Not to be confused with fast food, the food at the Great Greek is made from scratch. and is fresh and flavorful and very satisfying.   Without missing a beat the staff takes care of you in a timely fashion.  The  establishment is squeaky clean and the simplicity in the decor is a sign of sophistication.  Dining at  The Great Greek is a delightful culinary experience.  I ordered our rice pudding to go because it had just been prepared and needed time to set in the refrigerator.  We ate it later that night.  What a coup!  It was the best.

kbAQ3gbeXLvZbXa6u0T3Mw.text: What we ordered: hummus and tzakiki with pita, shrimp plate with salad and rice and steak plate.  What we got: A MAJOR case of food poisoning. Within hours of eating dinner here, my mother and I both began a violent night in the bathroom. We were the only ones who ate the shrimp so we suspect they were undercooked or laden with toxins. It is five days since the exposure and we are both still having symptoms, which can vary in severity and time to recover based on how much toxic food you ingested.  I am writing this as a public service, and warning, to just say no and avoid this restaurant.

UWdVXbYXxNuTj1b4SlE5Zw.text: Food was outstanding.  Well worth the wait! Nonstop customers!

VxWYD5KsVmP4heLnT71O8g.text: I used them to cater my 4 salon's Christmas lunches on all corners of town. Not only was the food delicious, it was hot , they showed up on time with everything that was needed. The staff goes out of thier way to make sure you are very well taken care of from the planning to the delivery.  Thank you Great Greek.  Studio Salons

Z56egs9dzAC0gp0dVg_GEg.text: Delicious. I really enjoyed the feta fries and gyro. A lot of delicious Greek food. The people are very nice. It gets really busy at certain times but it is totally worth it.

2nhm9jsb3SS7SpTdzSuUnQ.text: Food is excellent. Grilled steak melts in your mouth. The rice is the fluffiest (is that a word?) I've ever had. Yia Yia's Pasticcio is superb!! There are lots of regulars since the staff is on first name basis with everyone. What a great place!

6by8WAFKGcreDn9H4J19Ng.text: Love this place! Great for the whole family and fabulous service every time I have gone which ends up being about once a week.  Haven't had a bad thing there ever

baM0BlFMPk0hhMpfueesHg.text: Always amazing and always quality.  These guys really care about their business.  They go above and beyond to make sure the food is right, that you get what you want in a very clean and friendly enviroment.  We go all the time and will continue to do so

theOq7nrOMYU0QSW47Rh8Q.text: Delicious! I loooove Greek food and was very pleased with the efficiency of this establishment. I've been to Greece and the food, especially the Avgolemono soup, was PERFECT. Service was on par and overall the experience was great. Will be back in the future :)

beFAZxfYN7BcYKwr6yjP1g.text: Everything u can ask of for a Greek place! Great fresh made pita, feta fries were new for me(I think there was also some mozzarella on them too), decently quick enough, moderately priced! Minus 1 star cause my fried were not as crispy as I would've liked.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries and falafel pita

5nJzDg8PccUsh8EKTU1tBQ.text: Oh. My. Goodness. This place is FABULOUS! My husband and I recently moved to the area and were looking for a great new Mediterranean/Greek restaurant to satisfy our tastebuds and this place is truly spectacular! The lamb beef gyros are the best I've ever eaten and the feta fries are to die for. The portions are huge, as such, my husband and I share one portion of the feta fries. I simply can't say enough about how good the food is here! The baklava is truly decadent and definitely were sharing as well! We have been there 3 times in the past few weeks since we moved here and have unofficially planned to make it back at least once a week.

nM4xLpkMT75lIGWxkkcvmA.text: The food here is close to perfection in every Greek way. Reasonably priced and delicious. The only drawback is that  it does get busy here at dinner time and there are not that many tables so you may have to order to go. Great service and once again this is probably the skimpiest food review I will ever post because everything here is really good! You can't criticize perfection, the end.

sW2eB11LWxnGvqBW2_sOEQ.text: The customer service was very friendly and the atmosphere was nice, but there are only a few low tables in the center of the restaurant with hightops along the sides of the restaurant.  The beef platter was very good, with tender meat along with a choice of rice or french fries.  I was in the mood for rice, as it goes well with the accompanying Greek salad.  You also get some soft pita bread and a little side of tzatziki.  I will definitely be back for more!

7tWIVr-DzUZhq-86fslSDA.text: I love this place!  The food is great, the service is great, the overall atmosphere is really nice! There isn't anything I have had that I didn't like. They have some of the best Hummus and Melizanosalata (roasted eggplant puree) - it is addicting. I always end up ordering the Dolmades with my meal too.   They have a Greek Burger ($7.50), it has lettuce, tomato, red onion, feta cheese and tzaziki - the combination is amazing! If you are craving a burger and are looking for something a little different definitely get this.   You are always greeted with a smile when you go in there. They are very friendly and the service is fast. This a good place to go on a lunch break. You feel like you are part of the family when you are there.

CSCN7hC_tjAox_apqmFd8w.text: 3 stars for the food, minus 2 star for service. They have good food but service is terrible. We are a regular. We use to go there at least 2x or more a week. What disappointed us was they forgot to put in our order, We waited for over an hour. We understand it was very busy at after 7pm and it's a to go order but we waited for over an hour to almost closing and still no food. They did nothing but to rush to make our order right before they close. I am all about second chances. We went back and the same thing happen again. This time, it's not a to go order and not at 7pm. It was early in the evening. We waited for over 30 minute, and all the customer came after us got their food. I asked what happen to our order. They forgot about us again. What the heck. If you don't have enough people in the kitchen, hire more people or don't take any more orders if you can't handle it. We still come here but not as much as before. I don't want to starve us or give someone more business if they can't handle it.

dkjIEFDB7kCVyVxvrjf_gQ.text: Hubby and I have eaten here a few times now and have enjoyed the gyros and feta or garlic fries and the falafel, so when the parents came into town thought we'd bring them here.  They are not familiar with greek food due to living in the land of Packers, beer, brats and cheese.  Needless to say, they loved it.  The gyros are the best in town.  Everything is fresh and tastes fabulous.  The gyro meat is nicely seasoned and you know it comes off a doner.  I had a small salad with my gyro and the dressing was excellent, not heavy at all and the perfect amount.  Next time we will have to save room for some dessert.  I wish it was closer to where we live.

3ABRfvTCh6TFvNdloRQMrA.text: Amazing food with a Mom and Pop atmosphere.  Vegas doesn't have enough small chow spots like this.  We love this place!

zGHtX09Gof0gK63K1SAlbQ.text: Small restaurant, but great find.  Food is always fresh, and the feta fries are amazing!

zkB7yazki7-QoewoG8LCgQ.text: I eat regularly at this food. The food is great and the ingredients are good. It is a family owned business with an Old World feel to it. The service and decor are average but the food is excellent. I highly recommend the chicken kabobs and the eggplant appetizer. Definitely a treat for the taste buds

31GoHjOzCM8UyP3GVpnlBw.text: Excellent Greek food, authentic and staff was very nice! Traveling thru, right off expressway to/from Vegas in Henderson. Definitely will be back when in area!

je7Zdn5t2d3AdW7t7AP-mw.text: I love the soup here. So, I will continue to come back (not sure if hubby will though). I  am always taken a back by the service though. We find  the 2 girls who bring the food out quite  abrasive and to be frank, rude.  We have overheard other diners saying the same while we are there.

C8Hh0UgYDFDp0jNFDN6TQQ.text: This place is great! It is small, so sometimes seating is limited. But since we have mostly nice weather year round- out door seating is available. I love this place, I love the staff, and the food has never dissapointed! I haven't been back since I have gone vegan, but I am sure there are options.

C5_ZjA3-T2MuBzh1wQncnw.text: I gotta say I loved this place.  My gyro was the best I've had. The pita was incredibly soft and fluffy and the tzatziki sauce was awesome. Make sure you get extra sauce on the side... The had my  Lagunitas IPA and a nice little bottle of wine for my wife. The lady behind the counter told us about the kids meals even though they were not listed on the menu. Even my kids loved their half gyros in their meal.  Great place for a very good gyro.  They were semi busy and we got our food promptly.  This place will be my first choice for gyros in the future.

QvGuD_6IzYGtRrwIXD749w.text: The Great Greek is an outstanding choice for anyone who likes great food.  I guess if you're Greek it is just a bonus.  The food is tremendous, their soup is really good, their fries are some of the best in town and I just had their chicken sandwich with feta cheese and spinach and it was very good, and very filling as well.  If you have never been here, you'll want to come back before you leave.  Check it out!!!

4FOmcQobm87gPQgl8iLcBw.text: There are 2 things that set this place apart from the rest. Food - The food is fresh and extremely tasteful. Lots of wonderful flavors. Staff - I think the staff who work counter and tables are also owners or at least they act like it. Super, super, super nice people. Always smiling, asking how are you doing and taking care of the customers. Ambiance - If you want glitter, go some place else. This place seats 35 people and the nose level is just right - Greek level. Lol

KRkkQza4d5msw5duXxP2Sw.text: So.... We are really getting in to Mediterranean food.  We found this local eatery and we were very pleased.  The food was flavorful and fresh.  We will be back to try other dishes.

UTDBrOhbUuz8euMRCIOBdQ.text: This was the first Greek food I have ever tasted and I must say wow. I may not be an expert in Greek cuisine but I know what good food tastes like.  I got the Great Gyro with lamb and feta fries combo. It was one of the best things I have ever tasted, EVER. It was $11, but worth every penny and then some.  They definitely made a good impression on me, and they have made a new repeat costumer.

E3dLn_mLZWYKbm6a-RdvWw.text: first off, around 1120am the placed is already packed.  there are police officers sitting in a table. whenever I see police officers in uniform at a restaurant I get excited because they know all the good places to eat. after tasting the food I understand.  best Greek food I've ever had. rice pilaf is perfectly seasoned, meat is juicy and well cooked. if you're in the mood for some Greek food come here. if you're in a mood to try Greek food for the first time come here. highly recommend.

h89-CyLGzJABXz_6So40QA.text: So good...and the family really makes you feel welcome. The food is consistanly delicious. Alice makes all feel welcome. The baklava is outstanding

cDet0yvBEM5oBBZCKG3hAQ.text: I have been here several times and the food is always outstanding.  I only tried a handful of items on their menu because it is so hard to try something else when your 'Go-To' item is so delicious. The Greek Salad Wrap is delicious and satisfying without meat and the 'Rice Bowl' with shrimp is a delicious amalgamation of everything delicious-seasoned rice, veggies, shrimp, and a side of tzaziki.  My co-worker and I went here for lunch today because they have the best chicken salad (Greek Salad w/ Grilled Chicken Breast). The young man that took our order brought us a complimentary side of their amazing feta fries because the kitchen made an extra order- This is the kind of thoughtfulness that makes customers for life!  A variety of options for vegetarians and pescatarians too.

_gRyXE0LMnhlS-I9QqlE6g.text: Absolutely unbelievable food, and the owner(s) are really nice.

8cWB0Nbdwdo3TeMEOwnMWw.text: I ordered the Yia Yia's Pasticcio which is a ground beef pasta casserole with Greek bechamel  and fresh tomato sauce, I also had a Greek salad and an order of their baklava. I am not usually an adventurous eater so I called the restaurant and spoke with a very friendly woman named Alice. I asked her about it yia yia's pasticcio and she described it to me as a Greek lasagna.  I decided I would try it and I am not disappointed. it was incredible. I don't typically care about baklava either, but this was truly delectable,  due to the amazing food and very friendly staff, I will be coming here time and time again when I visit Las Vegas.

O2JfIi6PiS_vTEZDtrswBw.text: Words or pictures can't even describe! I have tried the gyro, souvlaki, garlic shrimp, spanikopita, bakalava, greek salad and my personal favorite FETA FRIES.  I have never left unsatisfied.  The services is always fabulous, they are so friendly. This might not be the fanciest place in town but it is definitely my favorite.

xgSbZJLkCf-wmlq4QipIUA.text: I must admit I'm addicted to gyros.....so of course I love this restaurant! It's a little small (seating only for about 20 or so), but the food is absolutely awesome and extremely affordable.  I was able to feed my family of 4 for under $50. We didn't leave the place hungry, either. In fact, my youngest daughter needed a to-go box.

thRTaWUybpbqTQrBztUk7Q.text: I ordered a Chicken gyro and greek salad it was very good.  The lady behind the counter was so nice!

t5-v3tj__saOz-94-ojwAA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Henderson. The food is delicious (and I have tried several different dishes) and the staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful.

va1OjQuKi1grqLjkDaVsrw.text: This place has the best Greek in town in the most friendliest owners I've ever met. They know what you're going to order even before you sit down when you've been a loyal customer I truly appreciate that

Xuzgp03VM4bwGwP0Xexyxg.text: Best place on town.  Everything on this'd u is good. The owner is nice and runs the front counter. Sitting outside right now enjoying the fountains and good food. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Relaxing

CYFjg_bkqgEo5tISClnxBg.text: This is my favorite Greek restaurant!!! The people are always so nice and the food is above and beyond delicious. We always get the hummus and falafel rice bowl. They are fantastic!!!

2MAL2sZJZMA6LMbq1CbaHg.text: Great food! Fast service! We will definitely come back again. The place is small, they definitely need to expand for more tables so people can sit down instead of taking your food to go.

Gc-xMFNxzrUf46M3ykrdXQ.text: Yummy chicken gyro! Friendly folks and fresh food. I have passed this place many times and never even noticed it. Thanks to Yelp reviews, Torrance and I decided to give it a try... and I am glad we did! Torrance had the beef/lamb gyro with feta fries. I had the chicken gyro with regular fries. We both ate every morsel, it was so good.  2 combo meals cost us a little over $20. We will be back soon!

S_4b8x3pTqQSMjclgMOedA.text: this is hands down the best greek food in Las Vegas.... if i dont go there once per week then im pissed off..... the food is great.. specially the rice pilaf with the grilled steak skewers.... love it...

qs-gOBD4wSEDbZQ4gtHsfQ.text: I work in the area,, and stopped in after reading the reviews... I ordered the gyro, i can honestly say it was the best gyro i have had in a long time.. It was a nice size, loaded,, I came back and ordered the pastisio,,  that was very good as well..  Generous serving,, took me 6 hrs to eat it all,, greek salad was the side salad,, the dressing was decent,, order 2 extra,,  I will continue to come here,, its good, busy, the people are nice...  Its across from Sunset Station on Warm Springs side..

uC_QYZFNXV0qdhfIkauvXw.text: Delicious little Greek spot! The food is delicious and the service is fantastic!! It is always busy when I'm there, but I think that's just a testament to how great this place is. (Okaye, the space is a little small as well) definitely plan on coming here more often.

zTS2WvX9MDgvaiy5OdbTqA.text: This place is definitely worth the hype. It is up to par with yassous. The lamb is great, the tzatziki was amazing, the fries were BOMB, and the gyros are one of my favorite. This is a place that I would absolutely go out of my way for.

1Uk548xf6FIbDiqRpDetJg.text: I would like this place more if it was next door to my house. Actually I would like this place more if it were in my house. 1 star because this place is not in my house.  Kidding! I loved every last bite on my food crawl with Jaime W. and Dana S. That egg-lemon-rice soup, yeah, I would bathe in that shit. It would make me smell funny, but I feel it probably contains healing properties for the soul that regular bath water can't fulfill.  The Gyro meat was especially delicious as well. Yeah, I could see myself eating here on a regular basis...they just have to move in downstairs. A major plus is that you can dine outside and they will bring your food to you. I know that their tea is just regular Fuze tea, but it was so good!   5 stars. Go before I renovate my basement to be their new kitchen.

heRUiBXYkp4aMt0zSzMzUw.text: This place is the best in town. It is consistently delicious with SUCH courteous service.  I recommend this place to any and every person in the area. You won't be disappointed.  The mezze plate completes me.  Last time we ordered from them, my husband went to pick up the food and there was an incredibly rude and obnoxious patron and we got a free baklava for the inconvenience. They didn't say anything, just slipped it into the bag. Needless to say, it was the greatest baklava I've ever had.  LOVE this place!

G5S_icYS8a44o06Q-1Blig.text: The name says it all.  It was great!  We each had chicken gyros with rice and fries.  Great!  We also ordered the rice pudding! Great!  Ordered a cup of coffee...Great!  Really hit the spot.  Family owned. Great!

BaCRjeipiW5-vmqGMDgA8A.text: I'm going to keep short and just say that this is quite possibly the best Greek food I have ever eaten. Everything from the souvlaki to the pasticcio to the rice pudding was phenomenal and I can't wait to go back. Loved it!!

VSCMNKPsO_NyMLn3-qyNFw.text: Tried this for the first time over the weekend. Based on all the other reviews, we tried the lamb-beef gyro, which was really good. I liked the thick slices of meat and that the gyro was packed full. Have had gyros at other places in the past that have such dry meat. The Great Greek knows how it's done! We also grabbed a couple of sides of grilled chicken skewers for our kids, and they shared our fries. The chicken  was buttery, lemony, garlicky good. Wasn't a thing left over. Really want to try their famous rice pudding, as well as their veggie app platter next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Greek salad wrap. Yum!

Dp06xFpn74122Cu_LZTPvg.text: Excellent food. Good value. We really like it. Service is quick and fast.

y5Dxz2VJF8FsIHae2dQ5SQ.text: I'm an out of towner here on business and am thrilled to be staying across the street. So far I've tried the gyro, feta fries, and lamb chops. All of them have been amazing. The lamb chops were perfectly cooked and served with a delicious side of rice pilaf. The gyro and feta fries were great too. I recommend it all.

eX_Qfjql0NBrvG6THeCjZw.text: I come here regularly, as it is by far the best Greek food spot I've been to in town.   My favorites are the grilled shrimp (either the entree, or added on a salad). The marinade/seasoning they use on the shrimp is flippin delicious. I'm also a fan of the falafel and greek fries.  It's family owned and I've always had great customer service. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

S_gKv5_JZWuL8Fhp1JYb-w.text: Traveling through the area after spending time in AZ. I had the salmon Greek salad with avocado & it.was.amazing!! The BEST meal I had on my whole trip. My family loved everything we ordered. A new must stop next time we drive through. And the owners are so kind!

zp-KjNUl_ZLZOIQDd-eU5w.text: This place has great food with generous portions! I got the beef/lamb gyros wrap to go. When I got home I opened it up and was really glad that I was super hungry because it was a pretty stuffed wrap.  The meat is tender, juicy and flavorful without being too salty or greasy. The feta cheese and tzatziki sauce added a nice dimension.  My only complaint that isn't really a complaint because it's also kind of a good thing is that it's messy. With the feta and tzatziki loaded on top, and the wrap stuffed full makes it a good messy. Especially when it gets to the part where its wrapped, use caution when unwrapping to be able to continue enjoying it as a wrap and not a splat.

O1XR2EGSyH0A24IBHjJUOA.text: Best Greek food in Vegas! Great service. Wish they would open another restaurant closer to green valley but, we'll drive

Tn28uhCrG70hZubHVjcLsA.text: Pita bread was super toasty, the Greek yogurt dipping white sauce was creamy, the chicken didn't have any burnt tips at all, salad was delish, and the rice pilaf was kick ass!  Good shit y'all! Keep up the good service, too!  Opah!!!!!!!!! Yours truly, Onasis

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Hell yeah!

xjeIb5eyvX9nRiYVupQhGQ.text: The food was fantastic! The Falafel was not too dry, it was perfect! Highly recommend if you enjoy Mediterranean food.

pkQHpaCrdcmZwf2kRP91gQ.text: This place was very busy for lunch. Not a big restaurant. I went to this place on the last day of Las Vegas trip and ate the Gyro Plate. It was good and a nice way to finish off the Vegas trip. All the ingredients were very fresh. You order at the cash register first and then one of the employees brings you the order.

hnVJXVAJ6ANZteEk1_yXGw.text: This is THE best dive in Henderson!  Great food, great service and always packed.  Whenever I'm in the mood for a gyro, this is the only place I go.  They also have great salads, great chicken, and the humus is amazing!  If you're ever in this neck of the proverbial woods, stop by and give it a try!

F2vsSmE53-TSYxVBxqduAg.text: I really don't know why I see so many 5 star reviews, where are people's taste buds? I think its because it's the most decent "Greek" you can find in Henderson. I got suckered into the hype but I have had way better.   I called in an order for pick-up. The guy put me on hold but I hung up after hearing him chat the whole time with another customer about irrelevant stuff. Second time I called the guy took my order and I liked how fast he turned around my order, said it would be ready in 15 minutes.   The restaurant is a bit small but it's really cute. It has an outdoor seating area with shades and a water fountain. The inside looks very clean and organized. I ordered two gyro sandwiches and a combo which comes drink and fries. The guy that took my order was a lot nicer in person and very cute I must say. When I got home I chowed down and it was satisfying but not out of this world. The amount of meat was good, how gyros should be, but it was not that marinated it was bland. The tzatziki sauce did not taste much like cucumber or the fresh dill it's described as but it had a lot of feta which made it taste better. The fries were ok.  I want to give the greek bowl a chance. Place is convenient for Hendersonians but I rather drive and use my gas tank to Las Vegas and go to The Fat Greek on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur. My review is from 2011, check it out but my thoughts have not changed. Maybe I held my standards high for this place in comparison but I'll update this review if my mind changes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

KChkEwyugSJYqfqWMHlcLQ.text: I guess I'm just not into Greek food but while others in my group ordered Greek (and didn't much care for it) I had the cheeseburger.  Note here: Don't go to a Greek restaurant and order American food... I had absolutely no flavor at all.

Cyyu8_5NhqNjCHGeMsFzbw.text: Now that I've been back to The Great Greek several times and have had the pleasure of trying several additional dishes on their menu, I've had to raise my rating from 4 to 5 stars.  This really is as good as this type of food gets in this type of setting.  Everything is always fresh and delicious and the several people I've brought all think so too.  I now make it a point to come here about at least bi-weekly or more.

k5DVpaguH3J2WdX-ut5gfw.text: Came to Vegas for work, had the chicken rice bowl yesterday and it was so good I had to come back again today fo

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

LaGuh57ts3Lzl2s8p0qRaA.text: The only reason its not a 5 star is that they close at 8pm ... stay open later guys.  I had the Gyro platter ... beef strips, pita bread, rice pilaf, and a mixed green salad that will blow your mind with how good it was.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t this make your mouth water?

N10XHsj6y_yNq9L4sc09ow.text: Great food with quick, friendly service. We order take our here from our office a few times a month. It's fresh and consistently tasteful. Love the feta fries!!!! So good! Although I usually stick with the healthier choice of rice with my chicken kabobs & salad, but it's an e notable "cheat treat" occasionally. It seems to be appreciated by all as it has always been very busy every time we've eaten there. They're efficient though because I've never had an unreasonable wait time. Enjoy!

amVg-L1N01SFqcPOUHy05g.text: We have been here many times, and love it.the food is excellent and fresh.  And, their service is always top notch.  It is a small place, so seating is sometimes in short supply.  They also appear to do a lot of carry out business.  They offer the best Greek food that we have found in the area.

aYaoGFxj65NxuCdsoQ9BWw.text: Just had the great Greek rice bowl it was awesome it's a nice location here and the people are very friendly and the establishment is clean

ENGonteOrJe0G6_xBi8D9w.text: Do they put crack in their food?!? It is so extremely addicting. I get an undeniable craving for the Great Greek at least once a week.  The restaurant itself is casual and small but has many tables to dine in at, and they have outdoor seating as well. It does get busy but you'll get a table soon enough. You can also call ahead to take out.   The service is OK. The employees are nice enough and they're great about clearing tables. It usually takes me quite a bit of time after ordering to get the food but it's so worth the wait.   Their classic greek salad is delicious. The hummus and pita is the perfect side dish or snack. They also include pita with the salad so I try just to get a small side of hummus and not the whole appetizer dish. The portions are great.   If you haven't tried this place I'll warn you, the food is so amazing that your first taste will make you a hopeless Great Greek addict just like me! I'm going to need a support group soon because my husband must think I have a serious problem with how often I want to come here!

in0iXWi2TAA_RdBKh82IoA.text: The food is consistently good. We always enjoy our meal no matter what we pick. The manager Jack is great! He always checks to see how we are doing and keeps us laughing. We will continue to eat here regularly.

nVTv9hh6eWxpNVqIZT7o2w.text: I haven't even taken a bite of the food yet and I Will never be back. Some of the worst service I've ever had.  The cashier was incredibly ride like o was inconveniencing her. I wasn't quite sure on what I wanted bc it was my first time here. She rolled her eyes and as she walked away she rudely said, "just let me know when you're ready, I need to do forks". Then I let her know I was ready to order, and she said, "hang on I'm not ready"  Then someone else came up to take my order and I thought she would be a better experience. We are healthy eaters, so when I didn't want fries or rice, I asked for a side of vegetables and she told me no. She didn't even give me another option. I told her I wanted to buy a side and she said that would be five dollars. And that they don't do substitutions. Overall it was a horrible experience.

R_4vo7q2mAYIET9ezr9Zzg.text: Delicious Greek food! I usually get the chicken gyro with feta fries. Very fresh and tasty! If I come in during peak lunch hour, I usually get my food to go because it's so packed that there isn't an open table. No big deal - just shows how much people enjoy their food. I'm glad that the manager clarified on Yelp what the picketing on the street corner was about. We were  really curious.

v2FDzviO0WR8ZAUeKgQo8g.text: If you're in Henderson, and want Mediterranean/Greek food, this is the place. Their chicken kabob is grilled to order, and is always fresh. The salads are huge, crisp, fresh, and their greek dressing is fantastic. I do enjoy a gyro on occasion, and the quality of gyro meat is very good, and tasty. Tzatziki is made in house, along with the hummus, and baba ganoush (which they call a different name) all delicious. They sometimes have a lambchop special which is fantastic. Plan ahead during peak hours, because it does get busy. Definitely worth the wait. Nona, at the counter, is the greatest too! She keeps things moving swiftly, and efficiently, and has never gotten my order wrong.

rSLkubkzLkLw0KNRrHcK4A.text: I am very picky about Greek food because I worked in an amazing Greek restaurant and this is one of the best Greek places I have ever been to.  Their gyro meat is juicy, thick, and it melts in your mouth.  I highly recommend the Greek bowls and they are big enough to share.  We moved away from Vegas four years ago but every time we visit we head straight here from the airport.  Oh and don't forget to order the tzatziki, it is creamy and the perfect combination of cucumber and dill.

Z1OwKFB9NLOD9UG_D71edA.text: Was looking for something a bit different from our norm so we figured on Mediterranean.  Now, usually, we'd go to Paymon's but this little place had some great reviews and was close to home so why not... Thankfully,  it lived up to the hype. The menu isn't extensive but it doesn't need to be, honestly. I chose the grilled steak, my wife (who was craving a burger from off the radar) chose The Athenian (as did a number of the folks grabbing a bite and the take out).  We also ordered the Dolmas and the Hummus, both being very flavorful. The burger was cooked to order and the feta fries very rich and tasty.  The steak skewers were near perfect as was the rice pilaf. I could have done without the minced onion garnish as well as the onions in the Greek side salad but other than that, no real complaints. The sitting area does get warm in the late afternoon sun so do try sitting towards the front or the mirrored side wall. The staff was friendly (at least the two cute young ladies we dealt with) and attentive, checking in a few times. We didn't try dessert,  but next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. My wife&#39;s order of &#34;Name I Can&#39;t Pronounce&#34; soup
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Hummus &amp; Dolmas
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Between take-out and dining, it was fairly busy.

_TGTN2r58hUEHBlQMPI35g.text: Amazing Mediterranean food, I love to seat on the patio and enjoy the rice bowl with shrimp and falafel. The baklava is to die for...

ncA354lLe7zx7Fj3Hpl5Xw.text: Amazing food! I've had Greek food from coast to coast, this was one of the top two places I've eaten. My hubby even told me as we were leaving that this would be our new spot. I'm glad there was a lot of food so I have leftovers for breakfast.

UlW2Z4CsnC7eN7TDU490_w.text: My mom and I stopped by here to get a couple of gyros to go. This place was super busy but from the looks of the food we weren't about to turn around. I ordered the traditional lamb Gyro and my mom got a traditional beef Gyro meal, that came with a salad and fries. We sat and waited for our food. A party of two ordered after us, then a party on one and a party of three ordered after them. ALL of them were served before our food to go was ready. We asked the cashier/server/bus boy why three parties for their food before us and he said "we're really busy right now. Maybe that big order up on the window is yours." My mom told him "We ordered two things and everyone else ordered way more than us. Why is it taking so long? This is not ok." The guy said sorry, but didn't try to make anything right. Thankfully when we got home and took a bite of the Gyros they tasted great. Hopefully, if we decide to go back this place will be on their game.

MZVvlaQJQ7x3YnIVF55Olg.text: Excellent service. Very friendly and amazing food. We go there for lunch and dinner all the time. Best Greek place in town.

X3v-8g3YQ6NQMn2S3nmRnA.text: I'm picky when it comes to ethnic food but this place is as good as it can get for Henderson. When I crave for fast Greek food I come here. Reasonable prices, very generous portion sizes and very friendly staff! I don't know if authentically though if fries comes as a side.

zqHhqJa7n_4T9tJxyxIubg.text: My husband and I LOVE this place and cannot believe it has taken us this long to give it a try. We're making up for it though, as we just went back for our second visit in four days! Delicious rice bowls and skewers, amazing feta fries, and some of the best hummus I've ever had...there's no doubt that this place has quickly become a favorite. Oh, and the service is great as well, definitely can't forget that!

tFlQiwIH0MyYeajld8BheQ.text: Best Greek food in the Henderson area!! Small but well appointed eat in area, we normally do take out its very tasty and packed well. And even during busy weekend they said twenty minutes and it was ready on time!  The dolmades are amazing with the proper hint of mint. The gyros and feta fries are our favorite along with the chicken Greek bowl. Pricing is in line with the quality so not the cheapest but the best we have found. Hope they expand someday so we can try sit down service.

CWp8jye83LZ__uHSQo0XAQ.text: Amazing. That's all I can say. I tried a lot of different dishes and everything was better than the last! I'm craving it as we speak :) can't wait to come back!

_pqvnpqwOJ7cUlh5XSgQkg.text: I'm from Chicago and a very picky greek eater. This was the best gyros I have ever had.  The place was packed but it was well worth the wait.

xdD_oaAaaJTPxE2QiX-rRg.text: Very good quality. Restaurant.was more like take out than sit down dining experience. Shrimp, rice pilaf & tazaiki were some of best ive ever had. Athena hamburger was also great. Side salad perfect size. Great value for money.

KDshRXyVJ45vhGumAs-zhw.text: The Great Greek has gotten "too great" and now it's so swarmed with people at lunch that the wait is 20-25 minutes and there's no place to sit when your food is finally ready.  I went in at 1:30 pm thinking I'd miss the "lunch rush," and it was still jammed with people. Don't get me wrong, their food is superb-- the rice bowl is delicious-- and the staff is super. The young man and young lady who wait tables are both very cordial, but it's still a ONE STAR for OVER-CROWDING.  The food doesn't matter when it takes 25 minutes to be served and only a half-hour lunch break.

OSAio4K62jS0sJRWiyFAAQ.text: Its places like these that make Henderson a great town for families! The people, food, music, and atmosphere........OPA!!!

b-KIHHUsjaDHq6F2qaNWXQ.text: Yum, yum yum lemon rice chicken soup with fresh dill? Wow.  The baklava is beautiful, can't wait to eat it... But too full from the small Greek sale with gyro meat. Good stuff.

7V8hHlYKdZNbvA2OYRyjUw.text: Quick lunch here with friends. I had the small salad with falafel. Excellent salad, liberal use of cheese, kalamata olives-watch for pits- and perfectly prepared falafel. The tziziki sauce - hey my spelling stinks- was thick and rich with a lovely flavor. Cheerful staff- eager to please. We ate outside. Very pleasant time. Locally owned. I will return next time I am in Henderson.

IaEgB_NhyG1o9hSXK6a-Ew.text: Visiting from the Bay Area we discovered this gem by walking by on the way to a nearby Starbucks. Checked it out on Yelp first. What a find! Fresh delicious authentic Greek food with friendly, fast and fun staff. Generous portions and did I mention fresh and delish? My favorite is the traditional gyro but the homemade pita and dipping sauces as well as the lamb chops were all amazing too. Hubby loved the crispy falafels too. They are closing end of July for a week of renovations but check it out as soon as you can. Worth the visit!

fAmfcpCC4yuIECT28DooeQ.text: The Great Greek is next to a deli place. It's a bit smaller and kinda hidden/easy to miss, and the parking lot isn't super big.  I really like the Greek salad wrap with gyro. I love that they load it with a nice serving of gyro as well as a good serving of fresh vegetables.. gotta get my vitamins and proteins in somehow! I also like the spanikopita and baklava. How can you say no to baklava? :)  Service is prompt and courteous. The food comes out in a timely manner, depending on what you order.

aVLhYqqq6u6CqUvVssDc1Q.text: I have a new addiction ... and its Greek.   Have tried the greek salad, gyro and rice pudding. Reasonable prices and large portions - the large greek salad usually lasts me two meals!  On the greek salad you can get, for an additional charge, your choice of added "protein" ... I usually choose the gyro meat.  They also give you sauce and pita on the side, so its like getting a mini gyro and salad.    On my last visit, someone in front of me inquired about the rice pudding and apparently it is made fresh / in-house.  So I had to get some to go!  WOW - it is amazing.  fresh rice pudding ... don't make a habit of eating it, but I just may need it each time I visit for a gyro or greek salad now.  Have outdoor seating also (although you look at a parking lot) but its a nice option.  order at counter and dine in, on patio or to go.

Q_JAH-ATzu7jY3PYvevyUg.text: Just a wonderfully family oriented staff that is so friendly and make the most amazing Greek food. I love coming here! The Greek salads are to die for! Even the small size comes with pita and a side of yogurt!

IoHqPNzMknpKjBoi-RHz3A.text: We love the Great Greek!  The service is great and so is the food.  So glad we found this great spot in our new neighborhood!

NKLQ_IOo5XVDjciBckJ8wg.text: We eat here about once every two weeks. Gyros are the best in town. French fries done crisply and flavorful. This fast-serve Greek food at its finest. Food is consistently good all the time!

jSvgnetgCvUHwQZU5TqVkQ.text: The staff makes you feel like family. I haven't come across a dish that I haven't loved. There are daily specials from time to time that do not disappoint.

i0QLp_C0FGDDXdGBDJFdiA.text: We are always happy when we leave this restaurant. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the food is fresh and delicious, and the price point is spot on. I recommend the hummus with a salad and a side of falafel. My husband always gets gyro & we share. The children get a very generous portion with the kids meals. If you like cheese fries, get the feta fries! My daughter & husband love them. Fries are not my thing, but their fries are crispy. The tzaztiki is thick and good.

dgZHo0uFAkui_j75Mpdgyw.text: Great family place good dessert the baklava ice cream is so good. The best gyros and Greek salad I've had. It's authentic Greek and the owners are friendly. Always come here when in Vegas.  Price is well worth it. Tried the garlic shrimp and Greek salad first time was here then the gyros but always get the ice cream. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled garlic shrimp plate
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Baklava ice cream
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro plate with fries

bM30TUXng7f8fkKACjM6Vw.text: SOOO GOOD! My favorite place to get my Mediterranean craving. This place has the best hummus and the best rice pilaf I've ever had. The lamb is my personal favorite cut of meat, but the chicken and beef are great too. The falafel is good but needs to be eaten right away since it gets quite dry quickly. And oh my goodness, the rice pudding is the BEST way to end a meal here, a must have in my opinion. I've had homemade rice pudding for years and this is just as good (maybe even better but don't tell my mom that).

pMLoN6qCPCFHcfC7bvquag.text: I am in love!!!!! I bought like 7 different items to try, and it was alll amazing . My 3 year old son loved EVERYTHING !!!! He is a picky eater so I am amazed . I could eat here everyday

bLRq0OaTEN_aymgLGA16Zw.text: As much as I love the atmosphere here at the Great Greek, there are no seats available tonight. Which I'm totally okay with, because the friendly smiles, the delicious authentic dishes make take out just as good as dining in! My wife and I love this place, from their traditional dishes like Souvlaki (chicken or steak), the gyros, or their modern options like feta fries, and the Athenian burger. The variety of delicious Greek food is worth the sometimes long lines out the door.  Come hungry, leave full and satisfied. And if you have any room left after a helping of their generous size dishes, the baklava and the baklava ice cream is phenomenal! The Great Greek always does everything right! I wish them continuing success, and I can't wait to done with them again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. The place is packed, and this is just after a few moments after placing my to go order.

oU8AeFvSbDYCBDX2pXIrJw.text: Great customer service, Brittany and Jack. We came in as the last customers, ( yes we were that couple) but the service was amazing.  The food was astoundingly good. Whoever owns the place, promote these two and the cooks. Way too good. Will be back.

W4FqFeFQWVfxkW7Th8opZg.text: I picked this restaurant for reunion lunch of my friends who live in Las Vegas.  We are so delighted with  fresh good tasting food.  I like shrimp plates.    It was the first time visit to this restaurant for all of us. We were so happy to pick this place.    I recommend this restaurant!!!  We definitely come back for another reunion. Thank you !!

DATyrTM-VdKKbMeGqQuNgQ.text: They have the best Gyros in Vegas! It's worth the drive, except on Sundays because they're closed. If they were open I could bring the whole family. Excellent customer service and very patient I picked up a to go order at 5:00pm on a Monday and it was packed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Love this place best Gyros and Greek salad, David the owner is awesome and looks at his reviews.

THsAHxSdm_Y6or9tmLRYbg.text: Love this place so much. Definitely a little gold mine waiting to be discovered by everyone. Their gyros are to die for and their feta fries make my life complete. If I could rate this place higher than 5 stars I totally would!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Greek Chicken Gyro &amp; Feta Fries

Ylui0cHdGlGefmQTYVJ9bw.text: Love this place! We order out from here about once a month. The fries and chicken gyro are my go-to and my husband loves the steak souvlaki. The service is always good even when they are completely slammed with customers. Get the greek yogurt for dessert!

eeJtbgeWmtU9IXiVs0XVIw.text: There are a lot of good Greek restaurants in Henderson.  From my house to this place is like climbing Mt. Olympus but it's soooo worth the drive.  Holy Michael Bolton, this is my favorite Greek restaurant in all the land!    It's a small but very clean restaurant.  This may be irrelevant to most people but for somebody who freaks out a lot when the battery on my phone is less than 90%,  the high top tables against the wall with outlets was a great plus! Oh yeah, the service is great too.  It's quick, to-go orders are quicker and phone-in orders are quickest.  The steak souvlaki is tender and has great flavor.  It comes with Greek salad and you can get it with either rice pilaf or fries.  What I always get is the beef and lamb gyro and feta fries.  Soft and warm pita bread hugging slices of meat topped with melted feta cheese and tzatziki...underneath lettuce, tomatoes and red onions.  It's heavy yet portable and non-messy.  I can eat their gyro hot or cold.  Raw onions give me a headache but theirs is sliced rather than chopped so it's easy for me to just pick them out.  The feta fries are amazing.  Each fry is lightly breaded for that extra crisp.  Hot fries topped with feta cheese = cheesy goodness!  "I'll be there someday, I can go the distance I will find my way, if I can be strong I know ev'ry mile, will be worth my while When I go the distance, I'll be right where I belong"  - Michael Bolton

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak Souvlaki
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro and Feta Fries
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Salad that comes with the plates

hXzP9c_K0oCJRuR8sGzvUQ.text: Before going to The Great Greek I thought I knew what a good gyro was. As it turns out, I didn't know jack.   Their gyros have incredibly moist and tender meat, crisp veggies, yummy tzatziki and blanket soft pita bread. The feta fries are a great mix of crunchy, salty and tangy. Their rice bowls are really good too!   If you come during busy times, you may have trouble finding seats. It can get packed as they only have limited seating inside. They do have an outdoor seating area but it's probably not the best during the summer. You know, Vegas heat.   They have the whole Greek vibe going with the music and decor. You can call in orders for pick up as well. Friendly service every time.   It's probably a good thing that they're not too close to where I live or work, otherwise I'd find myself there three times a week!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries &amp; gyro. Delicious! Combo w/ drink just over $12.

hZpapo2D1UUX2M-C76njow.text: Went there for pick up only.  Nice little place.  I ordered the greek salad, and a side of hummus and the bread.  The salad was huge!  I think next time unless I'm sharing I will get the 1/2 and the hummus and bread.  I was so full off of this meal.  I paid about $12.00 for it, it was enough for 2 people to eat if you both like this combo. I will be back to order something else in the future, because as I was waiting for my to go order, there was some pretty nice looking dishes going to peoples tables.  Try it, you might like it!

mJz4fYmaxG1iWUKqW-iSKw.text: Omg this place is the real deal....meat very tender....bread soft....food fresh....very clean.....simply delicious

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. .

pLZsT_xNQ_GOVx2Pj5NCJg.text: This place is phenomenal!!!  This was our first time eating here and the food was beyond delicious.  I got the Greek salad with an added chicken skewer.  The chicken had amazing flavor and was not chewy at all.  They also give you a ton of fluffy pita bread and the hummus was awesome.  Everything in the salad was fresh & perfect portions.  The kids' meals come with large portions of food.  We previously went to Crazy Pita, but this place is much better and authentic; the prices are cheaper, too.  Very reasonable prices!  We will definitely be back!

opb_y0Krhmf4GKh316km9g.text: This place is a hidden gem!   Everything here is incredible!  If you want a great family style restaurant run by a great family, make the drive out to Henderson and check out The Great Greek!!  You won't be disappointed!

-BqzrrlGu9OXuvMrC-opFQ.text: Oh what a disappointment.  We'd been there before many times. Food is good. Wait is unbelievable and today was the worst. We ordered to go. We waited over 30 minutes. That's not the problem. We saw four tables who ordered after us get their food in the restaurant and at least two to go orders made AFTER ours get their food and leave. Wrong. I won't be back. Learn how to run a business. Terrible treatment of regular customers. Awful.  By the time we got home with our food it was cold. Just gross. There are many other Greek restaurants in town. This is a service town.  Horribly disappointed

3xHAZmbUEG4ImRj6i2_9qQ.text: My wife found this place while searching online. We were in town for 5 days. Ate there twice. Steak souvlaki. Gyros. Everything we ate and saw going down other patrons throats looked and tasted awesome. Great service. Happy employees. Needs more space. Buy that place next door...... We'll be back and we'll eat here. You should too.

8C_lLGdVtud-_83lkkWEUg.text: This place is amazing. I am always more happy when I eat at a family owned restaurant and this place has both that and really amazing food.  If you are looking for Mediterranean food, and not wanting to wait a while, but still get awesome food, this is the place for you. It's an order and pay first, then they bring you your food and you can peace out as soon as you devour your last falafel. Which is sometimes just what you need from a restaurant. Waiting for the check is such a pain sometimes.    The food.  Falafel Pita: dang. I'm a sucker for a falafel pita and do I they do it so well here.  Greek salad with chicken: Okay. Greek salads aren't easy to mess up. They are pretty simple. The two most important things that you can mess up are the dressing and the protein. (As long as you have good produce, you're golden.) The dressing and the chicken were so amazing. The chicken is seared on the grill and served like a kabob on top of your salad. And the whole thing is just fantastic all together. One of the best Greek salads I've had.   Feta fries: So these are amazing. But what send these over the top compared to others I've had is 1. The crispness of the French fries and the fact that they use mozzerella and feta on the fries. So you get that creaminess of the feta and the stingy melted mozzerella that makes the French fries stick together. SO GOOD.   I absolutely adore this place. Go there if you like Greek food, go there if you aren't sure you like Greek food, and go there if you think you hate Greek food. Because chances are you haven't had Greek food as good as this.

67wOzpGL4wkVYg0a_CQAAg.text: Best Greek food I've ever had. Hands down. Been coming here regularly since my friend took me here for a birthday lunch a couple of years ago. The staff is friendly and helpful. This is not a sit down and be served place - order at the counter and they bring you your food.   The food is always extremely fresh, flavorful, and exceptional. My go to is the Greek salad with gyro meat. Occasionally switch it up and get grilled shrimp which is always cooked to perfection (many places over cook shrimp) Chris always gets the gyro, which by default comes with feta on it, which i love - lots of places don't include feta by default. Feta fries!!! Amazing. Their pita is always warm & the taziki sauce js in point!  Simply the best!

CZlYpRIrho2JFOoNHKPjIA.text: This is our favorite Greek place hands down! The entire staff is always hustling. The gyro meat is juicy with a little crisp on the edges. Even people who don't like lamb, love their lamb My husband always orders the Greek salad and adds gyro meat. I switch it up, but always get the feta fries.  The staff is the best too. So kind, remembers your name and just always makes eating here a pleasant experience!

PuHF5-x1_4oTkZoX58SgYw.text: I always love my food when I order from here! My favorites are the chicken gyro with rice pilaf or the Athenian burger. The Athenian burger is my favorite burger in town by far! They definitely compete with my love for some in and out burger. Also the kids meals that I get for my son every now and then are great! Love love this place

8F9W-gV2qj1iXyiLMFzs3Q.text: This place hits the spot every time the traditional gyro is my favorite! Priced well and the staff is friendly

lFY82Zg_oIvrt7KER9IExQ.text: First timers, I ordered the garlic shrimp with rice plate it was delicious and more then filling. Walked in around 11:30am and it was packed, but the staff found us a table. The dining area is extremely small.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro $7.95
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp $13.95

hghsuWwEtF8XeaWRskDHtQ.text: Husband & I travel between Las Vegas & SoCal frequently. BUT we have not found a better Greek Restaurant like The Great Greek! I get the chicken skewers & he gets the steak bowl. If I could eat it everyday I would. I mePlace is always popular so get there early or order take out or delivery thru grubHub.   This is a review #2! I am currently 5 months pregnant & I am even more in love with the Great Greek. It's the only full meal I can enjoy and still want to eat the leftovers.  The Taziki is the best. I've tried to make it homemade. Don't even try. It's not the same.  The mamas rice pudding is so good I need to my own because don't like to share with my hubby. Lol   The honey & Greek yogurt is amazing as well! It's not even normal. Haha.   Seriously The restaurant place ever!   Macro friendly if you focus on the proteins & taziki (Greek yogurt).   Xoxo!

DYCbcQpenCnvvc6alu0MCA.text: Don't tell my Yia-Yia, but The Great Greek's food is better than hers!

X_fIHraVyjejKedu9kCR1w.text: One of our FAVORITE restaurants in Henderson. Food is delicious, staff is awesome! That's all you need to know! But, if you want to know more the gyro plate, steak kabobs, Greek salad, lemon soup, rice pilaf are all excellent. Their tzatziki is ADDICTIVE. My hubby and I are always fighting over the last bits of it. Pita is always warm and soft. I could go on but the the best thing you can do it go and try it. You'll be glad you did!

3Q0koLTyjpY5AKoqCf7JMg.text: I ordered the athenian burger and fries and it was just alright. Not a ton of flavor but not bad. Burger was cooked well done and not as juicy as I had hoped (I ordered it medium). Fries were decent but overall I think the other greek joints were better. Maybe its because I ordered the burger and not the gyro or plates.

bclE5sqt2GNz7j0gznVnsA.text: Greeted by a warm welcome from what appeared to be a family member of the restaurant. She was impressive about asking questions and getting us what we liked. I had the gyro platter with a generous portion of gyro from the spit along with Rice pilaf. My wife had the rice bowl a warm rice base topped with fresh crisp salad and perfectly cooked chicken! The young lady engaged in conversation inquiring what we have in NY. There is a modest selection of wine and beer that made the meal complete. We stumbled upon this gem from Yelp.

vs315DmQNeT4HGKOcO3lpA.text: Great food and fast service. Very reasonable price. I just wished you have one in North west area.

2aCiz8Ep4VK1yGS_hzQrwA.text: I like this place for their freshness. I've only ever gotten the Great Greek Rice bowl. I get it every time, and I am never disappointed. I come here probably at least once month.

uKcueiBtVQ3OQbiEagVUwA.text: What I mean this side of town in Henderson I absolutely have to stop by the great Greek phenomenal food great service very fresh very clean and great desserts a nice little Beer and well. I thoroughly love the traditional plates a lot of food great fast service I got the rice pudding which is outstanding Tzatziki is lively. I ordered the combination plate of grilled marinated shrimp and the chicken Slovakia which was outstanding and very filling. This is a must if you're in the mood for some great Mediterranean or just a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States

kG9NGCBiw83KmTlN-rpS8g.text: Best gyros I've had !!! The wait was way too long. They were busy but still waiting 30 minutes for 3 gyros that's a bit much. They were still good just wouldn't recommend if you don't have time to wait.

TxX-FQhsUC5aMmj6Jd3diw.text: Great Greek Food, Nice Employees, clean establishment.  About 2 years ago I was introduced to Greek food.  Since then I have eaten at a number of Greek restaurants.  Although, the other were good, this place is fantastic.  A bit crowded, but what do you expect when the food is delicious and the price are very reasonable.  See you next time I am in town.

MRxhOL9SHO_DgwXYcavSGQ.text: Best Greek food around. This place is always busy and the food is always delicious. Great staff and if you have to wait it's definitely worth it. Only place we go for gyros and Avgolemono soup!

9ZXXKQeuQumA5IImNIuhVw.text: Came here after shopping around at Costco. We ordered the gyro plate with feta fries and a rice bowl to go.   The mini salad that came with the gyro plate was BOMB. Just be careful for the olives... they still have seeds in them and you could easily break a tooth if you aren't paying attention. I loved the feta fries because they had a nice crunchy coat/soft center with a strong garlic taste. I recommend not ordering this if you plan on going out afterwards because your breath may stank.   I think each dish was hovering around $10 to $12 range which was not too bad considering the decently large portion sizes and fresh ingredients. The meat was quite tender and flavorful which was a huge plus.   The guy working the register today was a cool dude. Very customer service savvy and eager to serve the patrons of the restaurant. All in all, I would recommend people to come check out this place especially if you are craving some fresh greek food.   I haven't tried the wraps at this location, but that is on my list of things to try here.

4lN7tq0dL2OTEwZdnS_zLg.text: Where I live there is no Greek food places at all. I tried this place last month and loved it. The feta fries were amazing!!

pa8MSxhR2OZcll5rnI72_A.text: the BEST greek food in town! very friendly staff great service

hpY1fO4UDQ6J0koeRTBaGA.text: I'm an out of towner. Looking for something to eat. came across this place online. Through yelp. On our way to our hotel in Lake Las Vegas. We called and placed a pick up order. Not knowing what to expect. Hoping that it will be decent at least. We ordered the chicken kabob, rice and salad. The portions were large. Salad was placed in a separate container. Which kept it crispy and fresh. Chicken was tender and so good. Overall so pleased by the results. We took a chance and so happy we did. They had my order ready and they even made me my own personal dressing for the chicken. Loved loved the food. Thank you for not disappointing. We will definitely return once we come back in town.   Only negative thing I have to say was. Google maps has a different directions then where it was actually located. But wasn't hard to figure  out the mistake once we arrived. But yet confusing especially from a non local.

lMQK4ZFNKKg1u5ZFhmFN4g.text: great mediterranean food and great service! I saw them behind the counter while it was busy and they were running like a well oiled machine! my order is always right and always ready on time, food has been consistently fresh. sweet baklava with almonds and walnuts that's reallllly good, and yummy feta fries  I will continue to come back

z4qd3idZgi3jE1UkKsLn4Q.text: I am traveling on business and was trying to find a good local place to eat. I found the great Greek by checking for places near my hotel and there it was. It is obviously a place locals like. It's not fancy but don't let that stop you. The food is great.  The Gyros  meat is tender and the tziki sauce tasted fresh made. The shrimp was also tender and well seasoned. I recommend highly.

EkYAqLaUX54K7fZNdl7-Pw.text: I would give their food 5 stars, but the past three visits the line is out the door and it smells like a locker room inside from so many people in such a small space. I've not even tried to order because there's literally nowhere to eat your food. They need to expand their space or I won't continue to visit.

7kKGE-lyqSKTGuTpniBoGQ.text: Never disappoints! Always yummy and fresh! The wait can be annoying on a weekend but the staff is great at getting you a table and being consistently kind and helpful! Don't worry if you come in and there's not a table available. You'll get one :)

PaQgatlz4U0KTKMEOAiSOg.text: We love this place!  I always get the chicken skewer and Greek salad.  He gets the gyro plate with fries.  All of it is fresh and super tasty.  The chicken was a tad over cooked on my salad the last time we went but all of the other times it's been juicy and tender.  Oh and the baklava is delicious!

DDjVL6GOdsRBeLXSeQtvKg.text: Huge fan of Greek food and came across The Great Greek by chance. Tried going to Chick-fil-A close by and line was LONG (as always). Opened up the yelp app to find an alternative.  First of all, their gyro is bomb. Super fresh and cooked perfectly. Ordered a gyro platter which comes with your standard side salad. More than ample amount of meat, definitely not stingy. Also comes with pita bread and your choice of rice/fries. GO WITH THE RICE! I mean, I'm carb conscious and all... but their rice is worth it.  Service was great. Super friendly and smiles all around. Price is fair for the quality of food. Needless to say, I'll be a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyro platter.

b6XaDWaWqsz_GNC3vuM02w.text: Great place to relax and eat. Friendly stuff and great service. I highly recommend this to everyone who likes Greek food. I would come back and bring friends

kmfWI2rLobCd4wIfGfa3yg.text: I ordered from The Great Greek the other day. I ordered 4 items and when the food arrived one of the items was not in the bag. I called to let them know and no one answered so I left messages. No one ever returned my call. Definitely won't be ordering from them ever again, really don't appreciate being ripped off.

kkyloZJoBtZEKy7IBb1L6w.text: Soft pita Tender gyro meat Top notch Mouth orgasm Very filling For cheap Crisp and sweet Wonderful treat!  Will provide a more elaborate update of my full experience soon, wanted to provide my enjoyment in a quick silly poem initially!

LzkNMSDDyutJnzCpmTpoOQ.text: I FINALLY made it in here after two years of being bookmarked.   First, I have to say the service is outstanding. We were greeted immediately and he (sorry didn't catch his name) asked if it was our first time. I loved that because he then went over the menu with us and answered all our questions.   I ordered the traditional Greek salad with a chicken skewer. The veggies were super fresh and lots of purple onion (which I love) .  The chicken was tender and juicy, perfectly seasoned.  Our appetizer was hummus and fresh pita. The pita was so warm, toasty yet soft, it melted in my mouth!!  Highly recommend !  I'll be back

tdDnMQBoCTnkxZYJN9QQkQ.text: Everything is amazing here.. never a bad experience..every time I come in I'm greeted and feel welcomed. U can taste the love in the food

yJhvV6hyQUGTTl6ncr0oOQ.text: On our way back to the strip from the dam and stopped at this little gem. Great food, great service and a reasonable price.  Everything was fresh and tasty and  the baklava was amazing, flaky and wonderfully sweet.

r-lZLqOoXZ0tShSmy15N8g.text: Came here last week.  Ordered the Greek Gyro.  It was fresh and flavorful, but a tad salty.  Lighten up on the salt and it would be perfect!  My family friends ordered the classic Greek salad - one with chicken and the other with shrimp.  They both loved the salads especially the pita bread.  Will have to try that next time.  The staff is friendly.  This place has a light and airy feel.  Also, it is clean.

9BCd6L1DYJappSII8Pc9AQ.text: Best Greek food in town. Delicious food, clean place, and friendly staff. Thank you for keeping the same standards.

1CGSp6d-R62-LnrNSp7s_A.text: Don't let the appearance fool you -it may be located in a strip mall but tastes like fine dining -extremely fresh ingredients -healthy, bursting with great flavors & wonderful service! We will  Definitely come back - loved the Salmon & rice bowl!

4c6ptBqpv1Bpi2ZvqtjzLg.text: Literally the best Greek food i've ever had, i'm a consistent customer because every dish you have there makes you want to try something else just to see if the deliciousness stacks up against one another and they consistently do! The workers are great and they're led by an awesome manager/ owner who clearly cares about the business and their customers, keep up the great work you guys!!!!

E7OLsDmKvlUO6w8sURyXFw.text: Best Greek Salad and best feta fries!   Jack runs a smooth ship there with amazing friendly service. I eat there 1-2x a week consistently!!

nhfOAFFs34IzaSWrFoNO0g.text: Delicious, reasonably priced Greek food. Love the gyro meat here! The staff are friendly and efficient as well. My biggest complaint is that there needs to be more seating! If you come in during rush hours (like 6-7pm for dinner, be prepared to wait for a table).

gjOFGH80sJsiYxguK6oQsA.text: Always great food & always great service. This place is always busy but they always have time to be cordial. The Steak Souvlaki is AMAZING! Do yourself a favor & get an order of their delicious rice pudding....you can thank Colt Daniels later!!!!

9jVq6Rx9S_p-MPqY4RhpmA.text: Came to try based on a friend's recommendation. So glad I did! Service was very friendly & helpful. I tried the gyro bowl based on cashier's  recommendation. It was fantastic. Lots of lamb, perfectly prepared. The bowl was a huge portion, I got 2 meals out of it!  I would definitely come back again.

LmkRSEQWvd8CvEu0oEN1uA.text: Flavorful food and fresh ingredients. I have ordered the steak bowl and chicken plate. Steak was dry and well done even though I asked for rare just in case they overcooked it, I could cook it more at home. Chicken was moist though. Avgolemono is good too! One of my new favorite types of soup. Pita is warm and soft

7UKC2ZjmOhlbv9nCL8p25g.text: This Greek place is EXCELLENT!  :-)  Very high quality food, service and facility + good prices = GREAT VALUE! I've become a regular over the past several years!

wb5DdlKh3nr2vVdSXGNAaQ.text: We came in right before closing (on accident... We realized this when we saw the door, oops). The staff was extremely nice and attentive. They took the time to explain the whole menu, and we felt right at home! The restaurant was full even though it was right before closing time.   It smells amazing inside, and the dessert looks amazing!   Everything we had was really good! I suggest the fries with feta because it isn't something you can get everywhere! Their soup is VERY good as well! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Beer selection is very reasonably priced!

xpdTyNzUgr-WB9IjUy3VKg.text: The great greek has awesome food.  I live right around the corner and come here often.  I get a greek salad wrap with chicken and feta fries. Sooo good!!

abR1q3LBDOPCaSvTy00OMw.text: A friend that knows his food told us about this little place and was he ever right! Went out of my dietary comfort zone and fell for their feta fries. Saw them on several tables and it was a done deal. Thank goodness after a few my craving was satisfied and I moved on to the real food. The chicken souvlaki plate was more than tasty. The two chicken skewers of marinated chicken breast were moist and tender. The rice pilaf was seasoned perfectly and side salad was delish with a more than generous side salad, romaine lettuce, too, no iceberg lettuce here! My hubby had the chicken bowl which he said was excellent.  Bascially,  it was a Greek salad with a skewer of chicken breast served over a bed of rice. We also sampled some hummus, which was also flavorful.  It was presented in a little bowl topped with  several garbanzo's and sprinkled with paprika. My only comment was that the grape leaves were bland.  A tad more seasoning would be helpful. The were presented beautifully and again the portion size was generous.  This family run restaurant has personalized excellent service. Very friendly and helpful!  Parking is easy, close and free,  can't beat that!   Next time we're in the area we will be back and I'll see if I can be strong and not yield to the temptation of the feta fries!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. This is it!!
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Feta fries, my downfall!
Photo of The Great Greek - Henderson, NV, United States. Dolmades, nice presentation

gBkq3M82KxlHj81BCnOgtQ.text: Absolute best "fast food" Greek spot I've ever been to. Better than my beloved Gyro House at home.  Take the "fast food" part away, and it's still one of the best Greek places I've been to - period.  Very clean inside, ingredients are colorful and fresh, staff is efficient and sweet (and super Greek). Owner can be seen walking around talking to friends.  Amazing hummus. Try the avgolemeno (lemon chicken soup). Greek salad is perfect. Feta fries are to die for. Free extra pita!!!!$&@&$$!
